label: personal-finance

label: personal-finance

label: economy

title: CNBC Changemakers: How the success formula is evolving for women leaders
label: media
content: The second annual CNBC Changemakers list of women transforming business and philanthropy includes leaders from biotech, AI, entertainment, food and finance. These women are pursuing purpose along with profits and tackling health-care needs, often their own.

title: Block's Bitkey rolls out bitcoin inheritance fix for 'multibillion-dollar problem'
label: energy
content: Jack Dorseys Block has created a fix for what it calls a multi-billion dollar problem waiting to happen for holders of bitcoin, and is now bringing it to market. The problem is what happens to a persons crypto when they die, which is a thorny issue for inheritance and estate planning, as bitcoin is a decentralised, self-sovereign asset.

title: Norway is poised to become the first country to fully transition to EVs
label: climate
content: Norway is on course to become the first country in the world to sell no new petrol or diesel cars, with EVs accounting for 96% of new car sales in the first few weeks of this year. The countrys push towards EVs has been driven by a combination of long-term policies, incentives and heavy investments in public charging infrastructure. While Norway is close to achieving its goal, the same cannot be said for other countries, with the EU and the UK still banning such car sales from 2035 and 2030, respectively.

title: Quincy Wilson, an Olympic gold medalist and straight-A student, is ‘more focused in the classroom than on the track’
label: Olympics
content: Quincy Wilson won relay gold as a 16-year-old at the Paris Olympics, and is already back in indoor racing. The high school student lists anatomy, pre-calculus and photography among his favorite subjects.

title: Figure skating community gathers for ‘Legacy on Ice’ to honor those lost in January plane crash
label: Olympics
content: The Legacy on Ice tribute saw performances from skaters including US national champion Amber Glenn, three-time US winner Johnny Weir and world silver medalist Isabeau Levito.

title: Dallas Mavericks star Kyrie Irving suffers torn ACL, likely out for the rest of the season
label: US Sports
content: Dallas Mavericks star Kyrie Irving has suffered a torn ACL in his left knee, an injury that is likely to see him miss the rest of the NBA season, the team announced Tuesday.

title: ‘When I see Russian athletes … I see every city destroyed,’ says Ukrainian high jumper Yaroslava Mahuchikh
label: Olympics
content: Yaroslava Mahuchikh is one of Ukraines biggest stars and is hoping to win gold for her country at the Paris Olympics this summer. The high jumper is also aiming to set world records.

title: Australian snowboarder Belle Brockhoff suffers broken back after high-speed crash
label: Olympics
content: Belle Brockhoff, 32, was competing in the final race of the day when the accident happened, causing a broken back. The Australian was taken to hospital in Georgia before being evacuated to Greece for surgery.

title: Snow joke: Chinese attraction apologizes for winter wonderland made of cotton and bedsheets
label: Olympics
content: The Chengdu Snow Village in Chinas Sichuan province promised a winter wonderland, but many visitors discovered the snow was actually made of cotton wool and foamy water. The village has since closed and market authorities are investigating the attraction for suspected false advertising.

title: Aleksandra Mirosław celebrates ‘dream come true moment’ as first speed climbing gold medalist in Olympic history
label: Climbing
content: Aleksandra Mirosław of Poland took gold in the speed climbing event at the Paris Olympics, defeating Chinas Deng Lijuan. The 30-year-old set a world record in the final with a time of 6.06 seconds, 0.04 seconds faster than her winning time in the final.

title: Teenager becomes youngest person to summit world’s 14 highest peaks
label: Climbing
content: Nima Rinji Sherpa, 18, has become the youngest person to reach the summit on all 14 of the worlds highest peaks. The achievement was confirmed by the Nepal Mountaineering Association.

title: Christmas dinner injury forces golf’s World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler to miss PGA Tour season opener
label: Olympics
content: Golf: Scottie Scheffler will miss the start of the PGA Tour season in Hawaii after suffering an injury on Christmas Day.

title: Olympic champion Janja Garnbret warns that climbing has a ‘cultural’ problem with eating disorders
label: Climbing
content: Olympic gold medalist Janja Garnbret wants to raise awareness of "cultural pitfalls" in competitive climbing that she says are contributing to a widespread issue with eating disorders. The ideology that weighing less means you climb faster has created an environment where young athletes skip meals, she says.

title: China raises budget deficit target to levels not seen since at least 2010
label: china-markets
content: China has announced plans to raise its fiscal deficit to around 4% of its gross domestic product, in a move expected to provide greater flexibility to fund its stimulus package in the face of economic headwinds.

title: China vows to retaliate as necessary after Trump threatens more tariffs
label: china-markets
content: Chinas Ministry of Commerce said Friday that it firmly opposes U.S. President Donald Trumps latest threat to ramp up tariffs on Chinese goods and vowed retaliation, if necessary.

title: UK economy unexpectedly shrank by 0.1% in January
label: economy
content: The U.K.s economy unexpectedly shrank by 0.1% month-on-month in January, official figures showed on Friday. Britains services output picked up by 0.1% month-on-month in January, but marked a slowdown from the 0.4% hike of December.

title: Layoff announcements soar to the highest since 2020 as DOGE slashes federal staff
label: economy
content: U.S. employers announced 172,017 layoffs in February, the highest monthly total since July 2020, according to data from outplacement firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas. More than one-third of the layoffs came from 17 federal agencies.

title: White House pulls Trump’s nomination for CDC director
label: health-and-science
content: President Donald Trumps nominee to lead the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has been pulled, a Senate panel confirmed Thursday, just hours before the former lawmakers confirmation hearing.

title: Here's why banks don’t want the CFPB to disappear
label: finance
content: Financial institutions that have previously criticised the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) are now concerned that the Trump administrations efforts to hobble the agency could result in non-depository institutions receiving less regulatory scrutiny than banks. Since the CFPBs creation following the 2008 financial crisis, digital players such as PayPal, Chime and Cash App have made significant inroads into the banking sector. The bankers association has previously sued the CFPB but now says it supports the agencys examinations of large banks continuing.

title: Hinge Health to go public as soon as April, source says
label: health-and-science
content: Digital physical therapy start-up Hinge Health is set to file for an IPO as soon as next week, with speculation it could go public as early as April, although timing could still change. The company, which generated $390m in revenue in 2024, has more than $1bn of investment from firms including Tiger Global and Coatue Management, giving it a $6.2bn valuation in 2021.

title: Netflix to hike prices on standard and ad-supported streaming plans
label: media
content: The streaming giant will raise prices for its ad-free standard plan from $15.49 to $17.99 per month while its cheaper ad-supported plan will increase from $6.99 to $7.99. Its premium plan will see a monthly cost increase from $22.99 to $24.99.

title: Disney, Fox and Warner Bros. Discovery call off Venu sports streaming service
label: media
content: Disney, Fox and Warner Bros. Discovery have called off plans to launch their Venu sports streaming service. The decision followed an antitrust lawsuit filed by TV provider Fubo, which forced Disney to merge its Hulu+ Live TV with Fubo in a deal that gave Disney control of the resulting company.

title: Comcast to launch Universal Ads in bid to win smaller advertisers
label: media
content: Comcast plans to launch Universal Ads, a new platform that will make it easier for smaller businesses to buy ad time and, in turn, beckon some advertisers away from social media and digital outlets and over to traditional TVs streaming businesses.

title: Oil, dollars, and debt: How safe is the Middle East from the global trade war?
label: energy
content: The Middle East has so far been spared of additional levies in the global trade war, but there are still reasons to worry – as well as opportunities to take advantage of – according to experts.

title: Amazon, Google and Meta support tripling nuclear power by 2050
label: energy
content: Amazon, Google and Meta Platforms on Wednesday said they support a push to triple nuclear energy by 2050, a nonbinding pledge also backed by Bank of America, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley to expand nuclear power.

label: cybersecurity

title: In AI chip trade war with China, there's one big mistake US can't afford to make
label: cybersecurity
content: Chinas DeepSeek generative AI app rivals the best the US has to offer from companies such as OpenAI, despite the US governments efforts to curtail AI development in China through tightened controls of chip exports. The US Department of Commerce issued rules to regulate the global diffusion of AI chips and models, which have been criticised by tech companies and policy experts, with some arguing that they could spur non-US makers of advanced chips to gain market share. There is a 120-day comment period on the rules which ends on 15 May.

label: enterprise

label: social-media
content: Shares of Doximity, a digital platform for medical professionals, closed up 36% on Friday, a day after the company reported fiscal third-quarter results that beat Wall Streets expectations for revenue and guidance.

label: tech-guide
content: Indias push into semiconductors, which includes plans to fabricate its first chip in two years, comes as US chipmakers look to expand in the country. India is in talks with the US and Taiwan about chip fabrication plants, and has also held discussions with the UK. India is looking to become a global hub for electronics, starting with semiconductors.

title: Portugal's government loses confidence vote, election looms
label: europe-politics
content: Portugals government led by PM Luis Montenegro, in power for 11 months, lost a vote of confidence in parliament on Tuesday, causing it to collapse. The country is now likely to head to the polls for the third time in as many years, with voters expressing frustration at the political instability.

title: Trump-Europe tensions could could have an unintended beneficiary: China
label: europe-politics
content: China is trying to exploit the current tensions between the US and Europe to bolster its relationships on the continent, with some suggesting Europe may be becoming less susceptible to US pressure. However, analysts have warned that Beijings efforts to restore relations with Europe aligns with its wider objective to weaken the West as a whole.

label: asia-politics
content: Singapores first post-pandemic budget includes measures to support households and businesses in its 2025 fiscal year, as Lawrence Wong takes further steps to combat cost-of-living concerns in his new role as prime minister. Wong, who presented the budget as finance minister before his recent promotion, also set out plans to help the country grow its economy and improve productivity.

title: 'Obstacles' in Egypt's $53 billion plan to rebuild Gaza, install Palestinian Authority control
label: world-politics
content: Arab states have come up with a counter-proposal to US President Donald Trumps plan to redevelop Gaza, which they have called the Riviera of the Middle East. The Arab plan, accepted at a summit in Cairo, proposes a three-stage reconstruction of the territory, but does not indicate who will pay for it.

title: How natural gas could help solve the India-U.S. trade dispute
label: world-politics
content: Indias liquified natural gas (LNG) imports are set to double by 2030 with the governments target to increase the share of natural gas in its energy mix to 15% by 2030 from 6.7% at the end of 2023, and the country is looking to the US to meet this demand.

content: Flights to several Florida airports were halted briefly by the FAA on Thursday night after a SpaceX Starship testing failure. The incident marks the second time this year that SpaceX experienced a mishap during a flight test of Starship.

title: Foot Locker results show the sneaker industry — and Nike — have more pain ahead
label: retail
content: Foot Locker said it expects another year of deep discounts across the sneaker industry as its largest brand partner, Nike, continues its reset and relies on markdowns to clear through stale inventory.

title: CNBC Sport: How new media is evolving traditional sports
label: sports
content: The TGL indoor golf simulator, co-founded by Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy, has a gameplay format specifically designed for TV, taking cues from the NFL regarding pacing and incorporating commercial breaks. Traditional sports such as golf, motor sports, boxing and UFC dont have natural TV breaks, so TGL has built pauses into its format. This approach could define the future of sports media, with certain sports suiting particular TV platforms or streaming services.

title: Treasury may fine small businesses $10,000 or more if they don't file this new report
label: small-business
content: Small businesses and their owners could face thousands in fines for not complying with a new U.S. Treasury Department reporting requirement on time. Many havent filed yet, despite the requirements aim of curbing illicit finance.

label: small-business
content: Black entrepreneurs are tapping into Tulsas history, including the site of the once-thriving Black business district known as Black Wall Street, as inspiration and a resource as they seek to launch and grow their own companies.

label: fintech

title: American consumer sentiment plunges on trade war fears
label: sports
content: The University of Michigans latest consumer survey shows sentiment fell 11% this month to a reading of 57.9, reaching its lowest level since November 2022. The escalating and haphazard trade war has caused uncertainty to intensify in recent weeks, rattling Wall Street and making it difficult for companies to plan ahead. Its also sown inflation fears, with expectations for inflation in the year ahead climbing to 4.9%.

His company Henderson Land, which he founded in 1976, was jointly controlled by his two sons. Lee was also a prominent philanthropist, giving away billions of dollars to charities in Hong Kong and mainland China.

label: sports

title: U.S. and global economic outlooks cut by OECD as Trump's trade tariffs weigh on growth
label: economy
content: Global economic growth is likely to be lower than expected due to the proposed tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump, according to the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD). The OECD said in its interim Economic Outlook report that global GDP growth is likely to moderate from 3.2% in 2024 to 3.0% in 2026, while US GDP growth is projected to slow from 2.4% this year to 2.2% in 2025. The report also warned that trade policy uncertainty and higher trade barriers had weighed on investment and household spending.

title: Tariffs got you down? How to substitute European wines for American alternatives
label: sports

label: internet

label: china-markets
content: Chipmaker Nvidias auto segment revenue more than doubled in the latest quarter to a record high on strong demand for driver-assist software, according to analysts.

title: Kugler says Fed should hold interest rates amid inflation risks
label: economy
content: The Feds Kugler has warned that inflation could prove sticky, and prices might pick up again, signalling the bank should hold rates steady.

title: U.S. tariffs could thrust Germany into recession, central bank governor says
label: economy
content: Germanys central bank president has warned that the countrys economy could be pushed into recession due to the impact of global tariffs. Joachim Nagel, who heads the Bundesbank and is a member of the European Central Banks governing council, said the EUs recent decision to retaliate against Trumps steel and aluminium tariffs could have severe consequences for Germany, the worlds third-largest exporter. The planned overhaul of Germanys fiscal policies, including the potential loosening of the constitutional debt brake, has also raised concerns among investors.

title: Healthy Returns: AbbVie is the newest potential weight loss drug market player
label: health-and-science
content: AbbVie will pay up to $2.2 billion to develop Gubras experimental obesity drug, marking its late foray into the booming market for weight-loss treatments.

title: Amazon to bring palm-scanning tech to NYU Langone Health facilities
label: health-and-science
content: Amazons palm-scanning technology will be rolled out at NYU Langone Health facilities to allow patients to check in for appointments. The health system, which deals with more than 10m visits annually, expects the system to cut sign-in times from two to three minutes to less than a minute. It will be available at facilities in New York from next week and rolled out further this year.

title: Disney to combine its Hulu+ Live TV with streamer Fubo
label: media
content: Disney and sports-focused streaming service Fubo are merging their respective live TV streaming services in a deal that will see Disney take a 70% controlling stake in the combined entity. The deal is expected to close within the next 12 to 18 months.

title: Liberty Media to spin off assets; CEO Greg Maffei to step down at year-end
label: media
content: Liberty Media announced it is spinning off most of its assets into a new publicly traded company, Liberty Live, apart from its auto racing properties, and that CEO Greg Maffei is stepping down.

title: Block bets on lending expansion after stock slump
label: energy
content: Block secured approval to originate loans through its banking subsidiary, Square Financial Services, allowing it to offer small-dollar consumer loans directly. The move comes as the companys revenue growth slows and its stock is down more than 30% this year.

title: BlackRock's Fink says deportations will have severe impact on agriculture, construction
label: energy
content: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said President Donald Trumps deportation policy will have a severe impact on the agriculture and construction sectors, which could lead to elevated inflation in the near term.

title: Who is Friedrich Merz, the favorite to become Germany's new chancellor?
label: climate
content: Friedrich Merz, migration hard-liner and rival of outgoing Chancellor Angela Merkel, is the frontrunner to become Germanys next chancellor. Heres what you need to know about him.

title: Tesla is offering Cybertruck discounts as EV market gets crowded
label: climate
content: The electric vehicle company is offering up to $1,600 in discounts on the new model and up to around $2,600 for demo versions of the trucks in inventory, according to listings on Teslas website.

title: Bank of America's CEO says growth is 'better than people think'
label: economy
content: Consumers are continuing to spend and economic growth should be solid though slower this year, Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan said.

content: German arms maker Rheinmetall said on Wednesday it expects sales to jump by as much as 30% this year, amid expectations of major high-volume orders from military customers and a recent shift in European defense policy.

title: SAP and Databricks partner to make AI work across business applications
label: cnbc-disruptors
content: Data analytics firm Databricks has partnered with software giant SAP to offer customers the best data platform for their human resources, finance and logistics software. Customers will be able to access and analyse their data more easily through the partnership, the companies said. Databricks will be available on cloud services from Amazon, Microsoft and Google.

title: Rep. Sylvester Turner, a Texas Democrat, dies at 70
label: congress
content: Sylvester Turner, who had served as Houstons mayor and a state lawmaker, died after a medical emergency following Trumps address to Congress.

label: asia-politics

label: transportation
content: Annual negotiations between U.S. companies and the worlds maritime shipping giants are beginning, and this year, there are several key headwinds for the ocean carriers that could help companies claw back logistics costs.

title: Jim Cramer names retail stocks to buy as the market pulls back
label: retail
content: Jim Cramer says the tariff reign of terror is temporary, and that some retail stocks will eventually make a comeback, so now is a good time to buy.

title: Inditex shares sink 7.5% as Zara owner points to sales slowdown
label: retail
content: Zara owner Inditex posted a 4% year-on-year rise in first-quarter sales, but said that growth had slowed from 11% the previous year. The Spanish fashion retailer reported full-year sales of €38.6bn, a 10.5% increase on a currency-neutral basis. Inditex owns a number of other clothing brands including Pull & Bear and Bershka.

title: How Facebook Marketplace is keeping young people on the platform
label: retail
content: Facebooks influence remains strong, but its popularity among young users has waned. Facebooks resale platform Marketplace is one reason why some young users still use the platform. It offers trust, no listing fees, and taps into the booming resale market. Marketplace helps keep users engaged and is a key part of Facebooks long-term strategy.

title: Birkin bag maker Hermes posts better-than-expected jump in fourth-quarter sales
label: wealth
content: The French fashion house reported a better-than-expected jump in Q4 sales, with full-year sales up 14.7%, outperforming forecasts. The company cited the loyalty of customers as the reason for maintaining sales growth in an otherwise volatile macroeconomic environment.

title: Social media chatter about Thailand pops 60% following ‘White Lotus’ premiere

Data shows that the show is having a positive impact on tourism to Thailand and is likely to lead to a surge in travel interest to the Thai island of Koh Samui, the latest setting for the show.

title: Democrats grant special convention access to more than 200 content creators
label: small-business
content: The Democratic National Convention is granting special access to content creators in a bid to multiply its reach and connect with younger voters, who can help the party counter the GOPs dominance among older voters. The party is providing exclusive access to events and full-time staff to help content creators engage with the convention and each other. The move reflects the increasing importance of social media in political campaigns.

title: These accounts can be the 'worst possible asset’ for retirement, expert says
label: personal-finance
content: Retirement savers should consider paying taxes now on traditional IRAs because they will owe more to Uncle Sam later, Ed Slott, IRA expert and certified public accountant, said. Traditional IRAs, which are rolled over from 401(k) accounts, are the worst possible asset because they trigger taxes upon distribution, he said.

title: Crypto exchange Bybit says it replenished reserves after record $1.5 billion hack
label: fintech
content: Crypto exchange Bybit said it replenished its reserves following a $1.5 billion hack last week, though it did not account for the stolen crypto. Bybit secured nearly 447,000 ether tokens through emergency funding, a proof of reserves audit confirmed. Recovering the stolen assets remains a challenge, with North Koreas Lazarus Group identified as the perpetrators.

Invesco Top QQQ ETF, which launched on 4 December, enables investors to capture the majority of the drivers of returns in the Nasdaq, Hartigan claimed. As of Wednesday, some of the funds top holdings included Apple, Nvidia and Microsoft.

The company is looking to grow its international presence after restructuring to focus on property and casualty insurance and wellbeing, including nursing services. The CEO expects growth to come equally from domestic and international markets, with 20% to come from the wellbeing segment.

title: Trump to sign executive order limiting Public Service Loan Forgiveness
label: personal-finance
content: President Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive order that would exclude certain student loan borrowers from the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program if they work for organizations that the administration deems engage in illegal or improper activities.

title: Can Trump launch Iran nuclear deal 2.0 in second White House term?
label: world-politics
content: Irans nuclear program has been a point of tension between the Middle Eastern country and the West for decades. As Irans nuclear material stockpile grows, experts say it may be trying to build leverage for negotiations. But theres deep distrust on both sides, analysts say, and the U.S. or Israel may try to prevent Tehran from building an atomic bomb.

label: world-politics

label: world-politics
content: FMCG stocks were expected to rally as Indias Union Budget offered a massive tax relief to boost urban consumption. However, the sector has underperformed, and investors should be as discerning as possible when picking stocks.

title: How India's emerging as a formidable player in defense
label: world-politics
content: India is set to spend $200bn on defence over the next decade to counter neighbours such as Pakistan and, most importantly, China. The country is already the worlds top weapons importer but is looking to strengthen its military capabilities further. Experts say Chinas expansionist policies and military build-up are the main reasons for Indias quest to beef up its defence.

title: Shares of Britain's Rolls-Royce hit all-time high on upbeat outlook, profit beat
content: British aerospace firm Rolls-Royce has posted a 57% rise in operating profits to £2.46bn for 2023, beating analyst expectations. The company, which makes jet engines for planes, as well as power systems for ships and submarines, has also upgraded its mid-term guidance and announced a £1bn share buyback. It is the first dividend payout from the company in five years.

title: India and China agree to resume air travel after nearly five years
content: India and China have agreed to resume direct air services after a five-year break, according to Indias foreign ministry. The decision signals improving relations between the nations, following a deadly clash on their disputed Himalayan border in 2020. India will negotiate a framework for the flights with China at an as-yet-unscheduled meeting.

title: China’s retail sales strengthen at the start of the year, industrial output tops expectations

label: energy

title: DeepSeek's breakthrough emboldens open-source AI models like Meta's Llama
label: cybersecurity
content: Chinese AI lab DeepSeeks new model shows the potential of open-source AI, rather than representing a win for China over the US, says Metas chief AI scientist. Yann LeCun said DeepSeek had benefited from open research and open source, and that its success showed open-source models can achieve state-of-the-art performance. However, the labs R1 model has also been found to have vulnerabilities that could be exploited.

title: How to stop Dropbox from sharing your personal files with OpenAI
label: tech-guide
content: Dropboxs artificial intelligence offerings, such as document summarisation and question-answering tools, are powered by third-party providers, including OpenAI. The collaboration comes with privacy concerns as Dropbox users data, potentially including shared files, may be sent to OpenAI. The companys CEO has attempted to alleviate concerns by stating that users are informed when using such tools, while a spokesperson added that data is never used to train OpenAIs models.

title: Chinese AI app DeepSeek was downloaded by millions. Deleting it might come next
label: cybersecurity
content: DeepSeek, the Chinese-owned AI search engine that recently surged to No.1 on Apples App Store, is raising concerns among US privacy advocates over the potential for data harvesting by bad actors in China. Privacy experts warn that Americans are putting themselves at risk by using the app, which could provide Chinese intelligence with a rich trove of intelligence on American industries and public sentiment. The open-source nature of the app also provides a potential backdoor for China to access US supply chains at an industry level, as well as giving the Chinese government access to users cameras and microphones.

content: Former Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, who also served as finance chairman of the Republican Party, said on Wednesday that he believes people are overreacting a bit to the policy changes from the current Trump administration.

title: Chuck Schumer says he won't block Republican funding bill amid Democratic divisions over shutdown strategy
label: congress
content: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer indicated Thursday he will vote to advance a six-month funding bill to avert a government shutdown Friday night. The move is a major concession from Schumer, who just 24 hours earlier vowed that Senate Democrats wouldnt allow it to pass.

title: Jeanne Shaheen won't run for re-election, opening another Democratic Senate seat in 2026
label: congress
content: Sen. Jeanne Shaheen, D-N.H., announced Wednesday that she will not seek re-election in 2026, kicking off a competitive race in a closely divided state.

title: Here's how the SALT deduction could change amid Trump's tax cuts debate
label: congress
content: As lawmakers debate President Donald Trumps tax cuts, a key deduction could become a sticking point in 2025 tax negotiations, policy experts say.

title: Zelenskyy seeks support at emergency European summit after bruising Trump encounter
label: europe-politics
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday, following a contentious meeting between Zelenskyy and Donald Trump on Friday.

title: Francis didn’t need mechanical ventilation Sunday after respiratory crisis Friday
label: europe-politics
content: Pope Francis remained in stable condition Sunday and didnt need any mechanical ventilation as he continued to recover from double pneumonia, the Vatican said.

title: 'The best experience': A company links travelers who can see with those who can't
content: For 25 years, Glyn Evans has traveled with a tour company that organizes trips for blind and visually impaired people. Travelers help their companions by describing what they see.

label: sports

label: sports

title: What to watch from the Sweet 16 of the men’s NCAA basketball tournament
label: sports

label: sports

title: Costa Rican authorities say it could take months to determine Miller Gardner’s cause of death
label: sports

title: Iga Swiatek subjected to ‘threats’ and ‘hate speech’ from Miami Open spectator
label: sports

title: How Jackie Reses rose from 'pretty gritty childhood' to top of U.S. fintech
label: fintech
content: As a child, Jackie Reses ran illegal carnival games on the Jersey Shore; today shes a fintech entrepreneur and bank owner who reached out to a Treasury Secretary during Covid. Heres how she got there.

title: Trump's first week in office: Crypto industry cheers executive order, task force
label: etf-street
content: The crypto industry is celebrating the creation of a working group on digital assets, hoping it will result in a regulatory framework and the creation of a crypto reserve.

title: Watch now: ETF investors bet on bitcoin, tech and fixed income in 2025
label: etf-street
content: CNBCs ETF Edge streams tomorrow at 1:10 pm ET, join us for actionable advice on how to build the best portfolio with ETFs.

title: Art Cashin's sons pay homage to NYSE legend with New Year's poem
label: trader-talk
content: Art Cashin, the director of floor operations at the NYSE, passed away this year, so his sons Arthur and Peter are continuing the tradition of writing a New Years poem.

title: China's Oppo taps Google for privacy AI push, taking page from Apple's playbook
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Chinese smartphone maker Oppo has partnered with Google to develop a private cloud computing system that will stop users sensitive conversations being accessed by its artificial intelligence. The deal will use Googles Confidential Computing software, which stops third parties accessing data through encryption, to create Oppos Private Computing Cloud. The aim is to stop users private information such as search history or private calls being used to train AI.

title: Meet the 21-year-old helping coders use AI to cheat in Google and other job interviews
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Software engineers are using artificial intelligence to cheat in technical job interviews, using tools that provide them with real-time answers to coding problems, according to a CNBC report. The phenomenon has become so prevalent that Google CEO Sundar Pichai has suggested that the company consider bringing back in-person interviews.

title: AI hiring startup Mercor now valued at $2 billion after recent strong growth
label: enterprise
content: Mercor, an AI startup which uses AI to vet job candidates, has raised $100m in a Series B funding round, taking its valuation to $2bn, five months after being valued at $250m in a previous round. The firms CEO said the new funds will be used to develop the companys AI tech, and to invest in the supply side of its marketplace.

title: More trifold smartphones are popping up after Huawei's $3,600 splash
label: mobile
content: Samsung revealed its Flex G and Flex S concept devices at this years Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, following Huaweis launch of its Mate XT smartphone with three screens. While Samsung stressed the devices werent going on sale any time soon, it shows where smartphone makers are looking to innovate to pull the market out of the so-called sea of sameness.

title: OpenAI co-founder Ilya Sutskever announces his new AI startup, Safe Superintelligence
label: tech-guide
content: Co-founder Ilya Sutskever has left OpenAI and has introduced his new company called Safe Superintelligence, or SSI, which will focus exclusively on the development of safe superintelligence.

title: Apple analyst Kuo says company cut iPhone 16 orders by 10 million units
label: tech-guide
content: Apples stock dropped 2% on the news that Apple had cut orders for the iPhone 16 by 10 million units. The analyst believes this is due to the iPhone 16 not innovating enough to drive significant growth.

title: Trump's 200% EU tariff threat not 'a big deal' for markets, says Treasury chief
label: white-house
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says Trumps latest tariff threat likely wont impact markets. Trump warned he would slap a 200% tariff on EU alcohol unless the bloc dropped its own duties on American whiskeys.

title: Palantir plunges after CEO changes share sales plan, Pentagon budget cut report
label: defense
content: The Pentagon has been told to plan for an 8% budget cut annually over the next five years, a move that could impact Palantirs contracting work with defense agencies.

title: Europe pushes for a role in Ukraine’s peace talks
label: defense
content: European leaders held an emergency summit to discuss plans for peace in Ukraine as they were left out of U.S.-led talks between Washington and Moscow on the Russia-Ukraine war. Meanwhile, Australias central bank cut interest rates.

title: China calls for 'peaceful coexistence' with the U.S. despite differences
label: china-markets
content: Chinas top diplomat struck a conciliatory tone on U.S. relations at a press conference, emphasizing the two countries need to peacefully coexist. He also advocated for a two-state solution in Gaza and said China is willing to share its technological development.

title: Here’s where the jobs are for February 2025 – in one chart
label: economy
content: Healthcare added 63,100 jobs in February, marking the fifth month that the sector saw the largest gains, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Demographic trends and recovery from the pandemic are two reasons cited for the sectors growth.

title: Justice Department is looking into egg prices in antitrust probe, report says
label: economy
content: The US Justice Department is investigating potential antitrust matters relating to the price of eggs, which has seen a significant rise, according to reports. The inquiry is in its early stages, but The Capitol Forum, an antitrust trade publication, said the department had launched an investigation last month.

title: European Central Bank to make 'last easy rate cut' amid tariff uncertainty
label: economy
content: The ECB is expected to cut interest rates for the second time this year on Thursday, but disagreement among policymakers may increase amid tariff uncertainty and the potential for ramped-up European defense spending.

title: Ron Baron says he won’t sell a single personal Tesla share
label: finance
content: The Baron Capital CEO said hes not selling a single share of Tesla personally until hes sold all the shares for clients.

title: FDA cancels vaccine advisory meeting for choosing flu strains for next shots
label: health-and-science
content: The crucial March meeting of vaccine advisors to the Food and Drug Administration has been canceled which concerns flu strains for vaccines. The Department of Health and Human Services did not respond to comment.

title: Healthy Returns: HHS Secretary RFK Jr. is making moves that may impact vaccines
label: health-and-science
content: Vaccine skeptic RFK Jr. is making moves at HHS that could affect immunization uptake and policy, despite attempting to distance himself from those views during his Senate confirmation hearings.

title: Anne Wojcicki has a new offer to take 23andMe private, this time for $74.7 million
label: health-and-science
content: 23andMe CEO Anne Wojcicki and investment firm New Mountain Capital have proposed a $2.53 per share takeover of the genetic testing company, according to a filing.

title: Digital physical therapy provider Hinge Health files for IPO
label: health-and-science
content: Digital physical therapy provider Hinge Health has become the latest company to file for an IPO, in a sign that the market may be thawing after a three year drought. The company, which offers patients help treating musculoskeletal injuries and chronic pain, saw revenues climb 33% to $390m last year, with its net loss narrowing to $11.9m from $108.1m in 2021.

title: Eli Lilly plans at least $27 billion in new U.S. manufacturing investments
label: health-and-science
content: Eli Lilly said it will invest at least $27 billion to build four new U.S. manufacturing sites as demand for its blockbuster weight loss and diabetes injections soars.

title: Comcast shifts strategy to mobile as fourth-quarter broadband numbers disappoint
label: media
content: The cable giant lost 139,000 residential broadband customers during the fourth quarter and will shift its focus to its mobile business in a bid for more customers.

title: China-made medical devices are in hospitals across US, and the Feds are worried
label: health-and-science
content: Popular medical monitor Contec CMS8000 is the latest device produced in China to receive scrutiny for its potential cyber risks. The monitor tracks electrocardiograms, heart rate, blood oxygen saturation, non-invasive blood pressure, temperature and respiration rate. The FDA and Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) have both warned about a backdoor in the device, an easy-to-exploit vulnerability that could allow a bad actor to alter its configuration. The American Hospital Association views the proliferation of Chinese medical devices as a serious threat to the system.

title: Disney doesn't plan to change its TV networks portfolio anytime soon
label: media
content: Disneys CFO says keeping TV networks business works best for now, despite losing subscribers. Comcast also exploring separating cable networks — but outcome is unclear. Traditional TV bundle still key to business, despite subscriber losses.

title: Stagflation fears bubble up as Trump tariffs take effect and the economy slows
label: economy
content: Fears of stagflation, not seen since the dark days of hyperinflation and sagging growth in the 1970s and early 80s, have accompanied worries over a resurgence in inflation and a potential growth scare in the economy.

title: Netflix ad-supported tier has 70 million monthly users two years after launch
label: media
content: Netflixs cheaper, ad-supported tier has reached 70 million global monthly active users two years after its launch. More than 50% of new sign-ups are for the plan, the company said.

title: DC housing market shows signs of cracks amid mass federal layoffs
label: real-estate
content: The Washington, D.C., metropolitan area is seeing an increased number of homes for sale, likely due to federal layoffs and funding cuts, according to Realtor.com, with active listings up 56% compared to the same week last year.

title: Ad revenue should stabilize for media companies in 2025 — if they have sports
label: media
content: Sports and live events such as awards shows are the key to growth in the advertising market, according to media executives. Traditional TV is still important to advertisers, especially when it comes to sports.

title: Ailing Swedish EV battery firm Northvolt files for bankruptcy
label: energy
content: Northvolt, a Swedish manufacturer of electric vehicle batteries, has filed for bankruptcy, citing rising capital costs, geopolitical instability, supply chain disruptions and shifts in market demand for its difficulties. The company had been seeking financial support, but was unable to secure the funding it needed to stay afloat.

title: Energy Secretary Wright vows to reverse Biden climate policies, says renewables can't replace natural gas
label: energy
content: Energy Secretary Chris Wright criticized the Biden administrations climate policies, saying they are economically destructive and dismissed the focus on climate as myopic.

title: We're raising our Coterra price target after a solid quarter, slight outlook tweak
label: energy
content: Coterra Energy Inc. shares dropped despite the oil and natural gas producer delivering better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings late Monday.

title: Trump tariffs will raise gasoline, electricity prices, Canada energy minister says
label: energy
content: If President Donald Trumps tariffs on Canadian goods go ahead on Tuesday as expected, it will hurt both countries economies and raise energy prices for US consumers, Canadas energy minister has warned.

title: Why the home insurance model is broken
label: climate
content: The wildfires that have ripped through Los Angeles in January have set a historic payout by insurers in motion, with estimates ranging from $30 to $50 billion, the largest fire-related catastrophe globally in history.

title: Investigators comb a scorched slope to solve a mystery: How did the Palisades Fire start?
label: climate
content: The cause of the Palisades Fire that killed at least eight people and destroyed hundreds of homes in Los Angeles remains unknown, investigators say.

title: Boeing plane prices could increase by millions with tariffs, says AerCap CEO
label: transportation
content: In a worst-case scenario of a 25% increase in tariffs across the board, AerCap CEO Aengus Kelly said the price of a Boeing 787 plane could increase by $40 million.

title: Aviation industry pushes for air traffic improvements, more hiring
label: transportation
content: The aviation industry is urging lawmakers to allocate more funding for hiring air traffic controllers and investing in new technology, as air travel demand has reached record highs and the industry suffers from staff shortages.

title: Tesla bounces for second day after steepest drop since 2020
label: transportation
content: Tesla shares rose nearly 8% on Wednesday, building on a 3.8% gain from Tuesday and snapping a seven-day losing streak after its worst day since 2020 on Monday.

title: GM raises quarterly dividend, initiates $6 billion stock buyback
label: transportation
content: The Detroit automaker is raising its quarterly dividend by a quarter and will launch a new $6 billion share repurchase program.

title: History-making probe achieves closest-ever approach to the sun
label: Tech
content: The Parker Solar Probe flew by the sun on Tuesday during a record-breaking flyby, coming within 3.8 million miles of the solar surface. The spacecraft flew at 430,000 miles per hour, which is fast enough to reach Tokyo from Washington, DC, in under a minute.

title: Microplastics are choking our waters. Could a sponge made of squid bones help remove them?
label: Tech
content: A Chinese team has created a biodegradable sponge made from squid bones and cotton that can absorb up to 99.9% of microplastics in water. However, there are concerns that the sponge might simply transfer the microplastics from one ecosystem to another.

title: Tired of subway delays? The MTA wants to fix that by strapping Google smartphones to New York trains
label: Tech
content: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority and Google Public Sector have partnered on a pilot programme that uses artificial intelligence to analyse sound and data to spot problems on the tracks before they become an issue. The TrackInspect programme, which ran from September 2023 to January 2024, saw Google Pixel smartphones installed on certain subway cars to collect data for analysis. However, it is unclear whether the programme will be expanded into a permanent feature due to a lack of clarity on costs.

title: Celebrity AI deepfakes are flooding the internet. Hollywood is pushing Congress to fight back
label: Tech
content: Steve Harvey is speaking out — and pushing Congress to crack down on malicious uses of AI, like scams using his image and voice. Several pieces of legislation are aiming to criminalize the harmful use of AI, including an updated version of the No Fakes Act, which aims to hold creators and platforms liable for AI-generated images, videos and sound.

title: China announces high-tech fund to grow AI, emerging industries
label: Tech
content: Chinas top economic officials have vowed to set up a state-backed fund to support technological innovation in artificial intelligence, quantum technology and hydrogen energy storage. The "state venture capital guidance fund" is expected to attract nearly CNY1tn ($138bn) in capital over 20 years. Chinese leaders see high-end chips, quantum computing, robotics and AI as critical to powering economic growth and upgrading manufacturing, amid US tech restrictions.

title: A guide to mastering small talk with just about anyone, according to experts
label: Fitness
content: Small talk can feel trivial, but it helps people connect and feel part of a community, experts say. Research has also shown that such conversations can positively affect a persons overall well-being. Heres what experts want people to know about the benefits of small talk.

title: Walking just 5 minutes a day makes a difference
label: Fitness
content: Starting a new exercise routine doesnt have to be daunting. Even a five-minute walk can help you achieve your goals.

title: Can the viral mini steppers help you reach your cardio goals? What experts are saying
label: Fitness
content: Looking to add more daily movement? Experts say the mini stepper is an affordable and easy-to-use device that can help you get off the couch and add variety to your fitness routine.

title: Replacing butter for some plant oils could significantly lower risk of mortality, new study finds
label: Fitness
content: Swapping butter for plant-based oils like soybean, canola and olive may reduce your risk of death, according to a new study. These findings challenge influencers who tout animal fats like butter and tallow.

title: Ultraprocessed foods make up to 70% of the US food supply. How to reduce your intake
label: Fitness
content: Researchers are trying to understand the mechanisms that make ultraprocessed foods unhealthy, and whether some of these ingredients interact with our bodies in ways that we dont yet understand.

title: Common vaginal condition is really an STD, study finds
label: Fitness
content: Bacterial vaginosis, a common vaginal infection, should be classified and treated as a sexually transmitted disease as it affects one in three women globally, and can lead to infertility, HIV and pelvic inflammatory disease if left untreated.

title: Jealousy is trying to tell you something. Five tips for handling it with grace
label: Fitness
content: Who hasnt felt the emotion of jealousy? Heres why its not always a bad thing, according to a psychologist who specializes in the emotion.

title: After abrupt departure of Lucid CEO, here are the EV maker's top priorities
label: transportation
content: Shares of EV start-up Lucid Group were down more than 10% Wednesday after the company announced the abrupt departure of its CEO and a stock downgrade by Bank of America.

title: DOT secretary says he spoke with Elon Musk on U.S. airspace reforms
label: industrials
content: U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said he spoke with CEO of SpaceX Elon Musk about reforming the countrys airspace and raised concerns about the militarys use of helicopters in Washington, D.C.s crowded airspace after a deadly collision last week.

title: Costco reports mixed second-quarter earnings, comparable sales growth
label: retail
content: Costco reported Thursday a beat on revenue but an earnings miss for its second quarter. The wholesale giants CEO said its difficult to forecast the impact of tariffs but aims to keep cost increases low for members.

title: Why some couples pick lab-grown diamonds over natural stones for engagement rings
label: retail
content: Lab-grown diamonds are becoming more popular for engagement rings as they are cheaper, often costing around one-tenth of a comparable natural diamond. However, experts say it is very difficult to tell the difference between the two for the untrained eye.

title: How a $5 million fix turned Paramount's 'Sonic' into a billion-dollar franchise
label: life
content: A design change for the titular character saved the movie franchise from being a disaster and has helped the series generate nearly $1.2 billion at the box office.

title: Amid DEI retreat, America's small businesses are not caving like corporations
label: small-business
content: Small business owners are maintaining their commitments to DEI initiatives and reaping the benefits, despite the rollback of federal policies and corporate retreat from such efforts, a CNBC-SurveyMonkey Q1 2025 survey found. Some 55% of small business owners have implemented DEI initiatives, while 65% said those efforts have helped their overall business success, the survey found.

title: Harris campaign launches small biz tour in a play for Latino, Black voters
label: small-business
content: The Harris campaign is launching a Small Business for Harris-Walz tour in six battleground states, with the goal of appealing to Black and Latino communities. The tour will host various events to try to win over small business owners, a key demographic that swung towards Trump in recent polls.

title: IRS rejects more than 20,000 refund claims for pandemic-related tax credit
label: small-business
content: More than 20,000 taxpayers who wrongly claimed a pandemic-era tax break will be hit with rejections from the IRS as the agency continues its crackdown on dubious filings.

title: Trump-election bump: Small business confidence surges
label: small-business
content: Small business confidence has climbed, with Republican business owners particularly optimistic, but concerns about the unknowns of the incoming administration—including proposed tariffs—are causing some concern, a Q4 2024 CNBC|SurveyMonkey Small Business Survey has found.

title: Your pre-tax IRA is an ‘IOU to the IRS,’ expert says. Here’s when it makes sense
label: personal-finance
content: Its easy to save for retirement without planning for future taxes, however, investors should save in after-tax Roth accounts, according to Ed Slott, who prefers Roth conversions and also favors some pre-tax money for certain opportunities.

title: Private equity wants a larger piece of the workplace retirement plan market
label: personal-finance
content: Private equity firms are looking to play a bigger role in workers retirement plans, but there are concerns about the liquidity and risk of these investments. Defined contribution plans, such as 401(k)s, hold around $12.5tn in assets. Private equity makes up less than 1% of these assets but this is beginning to change. Some private equity firms are creating new products in a bid to access the defined contribution plan market.

title: Block shares plunge 18%, for worst day in 5 years after earnings miss
label: fintech
content: Payments company Block, formerly known as Square, saw its shares plunge 18% on Friday, following disappointing Q4 earnings and guidance that failed to reassure investors. Competition from the likes of Toast, Fiserv, Clover and Shift4 is stiffening when it comes to payment systems for small- and medium-sized businesses.

title: American Airlines to start testing free inflight Wi-Fi
label: transportation
content: American Airlines plans to test free inflight Wi-Fi on some flights starting next week, as the pressure mounts on U.S. carriers to offer the service complimentary.

title: Adidas' fourth-quarter sales top expectations as final Yeezy stock sold off
label: retail
content: Adidas on Wednesday reported an uptick in fourth-quarter sales that exceeded expectations, but pointed to slower revenue growth in the year ahead, as the retailer sold off the last of its remaining Yeezy stock.

title: A 'radically inclusive' outdoor space for LGBTQ+ and people of color
label: small-business
content: Winter sports organizations aim to bring diversity to outdoor activities, including snowboarding and skiing, by introducing people of color and members of the LGBTQ+ community to the sports.

title: IRS will deny billions in ‘improper’ pandemic-era small business claims
label: small-business
content: The IRS will deny billions of dollars worth of claims for a pandemic-era tax break while working to process lower-risk filings. The employee retention credit was intended to support small businesses during Covid-19.

title: As Social Security faces an uncertain future, some say it should be privatized
label: personal-finance
content: President Donald Trumps efforts to slash federal government spending have ignited a new debate about the future of Social Security, with one idea — privatizing the now public program — getting new attention.

title: Fintechs like Block and PayPal battling to be your all-in-one online bank
label: fintech
content: Square, Affirm and PayPal are increasingly converging as they seek to become virtual all-in-one banks, but their lofty ambitions are a long way from translating into profits.

label: transportation
content: Airline stocks dropped to their lowest levels in almost a year on growing concerns about global economic growth and the potential for higher tariffs on goods from China and Mexico.

title: Million-dollar wage earners have stopped paying into Social Security for 2025
label: personal-finance
content: Most workers will see Social Security payroll taxes taken from their paychecks throughout the year, but once a worker hits $176,100 in earnings, they pay no more into the system for the year.

title: Lenovo teases solar-powered and foldable screen laptops in latest concept
label: internet
content: Lenovo has unveiled two new concept laptops; one with a foldable screen, and one which is capable of being charged via solar power, though both devices are currently just prototypes. The foldable screen can function as an 18-inch display or folded to create a dual-screen device, while the solar-powered model can gain an extra hour of charge via ambient light.

title: Palantir's Alex Karp says short sellers bet against companies so they can pay for their cocaine
label: tech-guide
content: Palantir CEO Alex Karp spoke out against short sellers in an interview with CNBC, referring to them as cocaine addicts and saying that taking away their supply of lines of cocaine brings them joy. Shares of Palantir jumped on March 6 after the company announced it had been selected by the U.S. Army for a project using AI technology.

title: Democratic Rep. Raúl Grijalva of Arizona dies at 77
label: congress
content: Grijalva died from complications of his cancer treatment, his office said. He was first elected to Congress in 2002 and was the longest-serving co-chair of the Congressional Progressive Caucus.

title: India's finance minister faces a tough choice crafting the annual budget — boost growth or cut deficit?
label: asia-politics
content: The Indian government is expected to prioritize deficit reduction over spending in its annual budget as it looks to tighten fiscal policy and attract investment ratings upgrades while supporting growth.

title: China says it hopes to 'properly manage differences' with the U.S. on trade
label: asia-politics
content: China says it is open to negotiation with the U.S. in a bid to avert the possible implementation of increased tariffs on its exports to America, according to a spokesperson for the Chinese Ministry of Commerce.

title: Not using these job interview tips can reduce your chances of getting that job
label: sports
content: Some Gen Z college graduates are unprepared for job interviews, bringing parents to in-person interviews, refusing to turn cameras on for virtual interviews, using inappropriate language and dressing unprofessionally, experts say. Heres how to stand out and prepare for your next job interview.

title: Government travel has 'fallen off' since Trump inauguration, United says
label: industrials
content: United Airlines CFO says that government travel demand has fallen off since the inauguration. It accounts for 2% of the airlines revenue.

title: Dollar General store review and closures dent fourth-quarter earnings
label: retail
content: Dollar General on Thursday reported fiscal fourth-quarter revenue that narrowly beat Wall Street estimates, while a store portfolio review cut into the chains profit.

title: Dick's Sporting Goods is latest retailer to forecast rocky 2025 amid recession fears
label: retail
content: Dicks Sporting Goods announced Tuesday its expecting profits in 2025 to be far lower than Wall Street anticipated, becoming the latest retailer to forecast a rocky year ahead as consumers contend with tariffs, inflation and fears around a potential recession.

title: Michael Jordan, Kobe Bryant rookie jerseys set to sell for $20 million at auction
label: retail
content: The first game jerseys of Kobe Bryant and Michael Jordan, from their respective rookie seasons, are both up for auction and are each expected to fetch around $10 million. The auction house says rookie memorabilia has seen a recent uptick in demand among its customers.

title: Family offices face hidden risks in making direct investments
label: wealth
content: Family offices are taking on more risk than they realise with direct investments in private companies, according to a new survey. Nearly three-quarters of the executives surveyed by Campden Wealth said they felt the risk was manageable, but 46% said they had no formal procedures in place to accurately assess those risks.

title: Disney tops profit estimates, but starts to lose Disney+ streaming subscribers
label: life
content: The companys streaming business reported another quarter of profitability despite a 1% decline in subscribers for Disney+, the companys flagship service.

title: It's been a great run for Wall Street, but Main Street is feeling left out
label: small-business
content: Small business owners are feeling left behind by policymakers more concerned with what happens on Wall Street than on Main Street, a new survey has found, with most saying they have experienced no benefits from this years stock market performance.

title: Small business confidence hits highest level since Biden took office
label: small-business
content: Optimism among small business owners has risen, despite stubborn inflation, with 28% of those surveyed describing the economy as excellent or good, a 5% rise from Q4 2023 and 18% YoY. The CNBC|SurveyMonkey Small Business Confidence Index reading of 47 out of 100 was the highest since Joe Biden took office. Inflation remains a key concern for business, although some are optimistic that it has peaked, with 29% of owners surveyed saying its the biggest risk to business.

content: UK, US Hold Talks in Bid to Resolve Apple Encryption Feud

label: climate
content: The weather system that spawned deadly tornadoes, dust storms and wildfires across the South is moving Monday toward the U.S. Southeast and Mid-Atlantic, bringing the potential for more damaging weather.

label: personal-finance

label: economy
content: The Bank of England is widely expected to hold interest rates at 4.5% when it meets on Thursday, as the U.K. economy shows signs of stalling and the threat of a trade war looms.

title: Trump administration weighs travel ban on dozens of countries, memo says
label: policy
content: The Trump administration is looking to expand its travel ban to include citizens of 41 countries, according to a memo seen by Reuters. The proposed ban is yet to be approved.

title: China has room to act on fiscal policy amid uncertainties, finance minister says
label: china-markets
content: China has more fiscal room to support its economy in the face of U.S. trade tensions and other uncertainties, Finance Minister Lan Foan said Thursday.

title: How Trump's trade policy is putting pressure on U.S. farmers
label: economy
content: Tariffs on agricultural products from the U.S. could lead to further market share losses for American farmers, as Brazil already accounts for 40% of global production of soybeans, a crop that faces additional duties.

title: Bluebird Bio sells itself to private equity after tough times
label: health-and-science
content: Bluebird Bio Inc. said it will be acquired for about $30 million, marking the end of the companys fall from one of the buzziest biotech firms to one that was on the cusp of running out of money.

title: Comcast shares tumble as executive calls broadband 'intensely competitive'
label: media
content: Comcast CEO Dave Watson said the company expects to lose more than 100,000 broadband subscribers during the fourth quarter as competition in the sector remains fierce.

title: Fox reveals plans to launch subscription streaming service this year
label: media
content: The company is designing the app now for a year-end launch and plans to offer its sports and news content, CEO Lachlan Murdoch says. Foxs streaming service wont upend its place in the traditional bundle, he says.

title: Microsoft is open to using natural gas to power AI data centers
label: energy
content: Microsoft is open to the idea of using natural gas to power data centres, providing carbon capture technology is used, according to Bobby Hollis, the companys vice president of energy. The technology industry has found that renewable energy alone is not sufficient to power data centres, and Microsoft has previously signed a deal to support the restart of the nuclear plant at Three Mile Island. Oil companies such as Exxon and Chevron are looking to develop natural gas plants with carbon capture technology to power data centres.

title: Small business uncertainty about the economy spikes to the second-highest level since 1973
label: sports
content: Small business optimism has fallen as President Donald Trumps chaotic trade policy and uncertainty over the economy take hold, a NFIB survey shows.
