label: Consumer Tech
content: Apples iPhone 17 ‘Air Is a Step Toward a Slimmer, Port-Free Era

title: Tesla booted from Vancouver International Auto Show over ‘safety’
label: sports
content: Teslas display was removed from the Vancouver International Auto Show this week due to safety concerns and protests against the brand. The spokesperson for the event said Tesla had multiple opportunities to withdraw from the event. The automaker is also facing a drop in sales for the first time.

title: Former JPMorgan and Barclays exec Jes Staley tells court he slept with Epstein assistant
label: sports
content: The former Barclays boss, Jes Staley, revealed in court this week that he had sexual relations with a member of staff of serial pedophile Jeffrey Epstein.  The British regulator, the FCA is seeking to ban Staley and fine him £1.8 million for allegedly misleading the watchdog over his relationship with Epstein.  Staley is appealing.

title: Jamie Dimon raises concerns about tariffs two months after his now-famous ‘get over it’ line
label: sports
content: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon told protesters of President Donald Trumps tariff policy to "get over it," but now Dimon himself may not be over it, according to reports.

title: From food to cars: What Americans could pay more for from Trump’s steel and aluminum tariffs
label: sports
content: The 25% tariffs rolled out on Wednesday could still impact consumers wallets as companies pass on the cost of tariffs to American shoppers.

title: Trump threatens 200% tariff on European alcohol as trade war escalates
label: sports
content: The EU imposed a 50% retaliatory tariff on US spirits Wednesday in response to Trumps tariffs on steel and aluminum. Trump threatened to raise the stakes with a 200% tariff on European alcohol. The EUs retaliatory tariffs could deal a heavy blow to American spirits makers.

title: DOGE layoffs may 'overwhelm' unemployment system for federal workers: report
label: finance
content: The Trump administrations purge of federal staff may flood an unemployment benefits system ill-equipped to handle the deluge, triggering delays in aid for jobless workers, according to a new report.

title: Ultrawealthy to retail investors: Street expands exposure to private credit
label: finance
content: The exchange-traded fund industry is looking to give retail investors more access to alternative investments such as private credit, but some think the so-called velvet rope isnt worth going through.

title: RFK Jr. could further deter childhood vaccinations as rates fall in the U.S.
label: health-and-science
content: The new top health official at the Department of Health and Human Services is a prominent vaccine skeptic and now wields enormous power over the federal agencies that regulate vaccines and set shot recommendations.

title: Hims & Hers falls on margin miss and warning it may stop selling some weight loss drugs
label: health-and-science
content: Hims & Hers shares plunged as much as 18% in after-hours trading on Monday after the telehealth companys gross margin fell short of Wall Street expectations.

title: Teladoc shares tumble on wider-than-expected loss, disappointing revenue guidance
label: health-and-science
content: Telehealth company Teladoc Health reported a wider-than-expected loss and disappointing quarterly guidance, causing its shares to fall in extended trading on Wednesday.

title: Microsoft unveils new voice-activated AI assistant for doctors
label: health-and-science
content: Dragon Copilot has been designed to help doctors quickly pull information from medical sources and draft clinical notes, referral letters and more. It has been tested by 250 locations and nine hospitals throughout central Pennsylvania and northern Maryland. It will be available in the US and Canada from May, with roll outs to the UK, the Netherlands, France and Germany to follow.

title: Novo Nordisk offers Wegovy for less than half the price through direct pharmacy
label: health-and-science
content: Novo Nordisk has launched a direct-to-consumer online pharmacy that will offer its weight loss drug Wegovy for less than half its usual price per month. Called NovoCare, the pharmacy will allow patients to pay $499 in cash per month for the weekly drug, which usually costs $1,350 per month.

title: Comcast and NBCUniversal receive FCC inquiry on DEI initiatives
label: media
content: The FCC said it would investigate Comcast and NBCUniversal, in part over concerns that the companies promote diversity, equity and inclusion in a way that does not comply with FCC regulations.

title: ESPN hopes to reach more casual sports fans with Disney+ integration
label: media
content: ESPN is introducing a dedicated ESPN tile on Disney+ on Wednesday for those who subscribe to ESPN+, in a bid to boost subscribers. Those with ESPN+ subscriptions will have full access to all ESPN content through the tile on Disney+.

title: Disney says about 157 million global users are streaming content with ads
label: media
content: The media giant said its Disney Advertising unit has defined a methodology for estimating ad-supported audience numbers. It includes 157 million global monthly active users watching ad-supported content across Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+.

title: Comcast to spin off cable networks as subscribers flee the bundle
label: media
content: Comcast said it is moving forward with the spinoff of its cable network channels, including CNBC, MSNBC and E! The company had said it was considering a split of the cable networks.

title: 'Please unleash us': Europe's telcos bang the drum for more mega-deals
label: finance
content: Telecoms firms in Europe are calling for further industry consolidation in order to compete on key technologies such as 5G and AI with nations such as the US and China. CEOs of firms including Orange and Deutsche Telekom have called on regulators to simplify the process of combining operations with other businesses. Oranges Christel Heydemann said that some progress had been made but that there was still a long way to go.

title: Comcast stock falls after company underwhelms in broadband, Peacock subscribers
label: media
content: The companys broadband losses were disappointing and worse than what we indicated in early December, company president Mike Cavanagh said.

title: Fed is likely to hold rates steady, but some borrowing costs are starting to ease
label: real-estate
content: Inflation may rise due to the trade war, despite the Federal Reserve expected to hold interest rates steady next week. Although rates on things like mortgages and credit cards are down, theyre still relatively high compared to recent highs.

title: Tax breaks, free college: How a Kansas town is enticing people to move there
label: real-estate
content: The oil town of Neodesha, Kansas, is offering new residents incentives like waived state income tax, property tax rebates and help with daycare as it tries to attract new people to the area.

title: Here’s how rent can make or break your credit, experts say
label: real-estate
content: Rent reporting services can help those with no credit history build credit through on-time rent payments, but late payments will also be reflected. Make sure you understand the pros and cons before enrolling in such a program, and always pay your rent on time.

title: BP ramps up annual fossil fuel investment to $10 billion in strategy reset
label: energy
content: BP has announced plans to increase its annual investment in oil and gas to $10bn between now and 2027, as it looks to cut spending on renewables and double down on fossil fuels. The company plans to lower its annual capital expenditure to between $13bn and $15bn over the next six years, while also targeting $20bn of divestments by the end of 2027. The announcement comes as BPs new CEO, Murray Auchincloss, seeks to reassure investors.

title: U.S. will collapse Iran's economy by shutting down its oil industry, Treasury secretary says
label: energy
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said sanctions are intended to shut down Irans oil industry with the goal of slashing its oil exports from 1.5 million barrels per day to a trickle.

title: PayPal lays out strategy for Venmo to reach $2 billion in revenue in 2027
label: energy
content: At its investor day on Tuesday, PayPal will lay out its plan to deepen user engagement and position Venmo as the default app not just for peer-to-peer transactions but for spending, saving and moving money.

title: How Elon Musk's Trump support could hurt — or help — Tesla
label: climate
content: Some think President Trumps policies will be bad for Tesla, others think they will be good. For example, Trumps policies are seen as making autonomous vehicles more likely. On the other hand, some think Tesla will suffer because of Trumps stance on EVs, which may lead to the removal of EV-friendly policies.

title: Inside the sustainable farm beloved by King Charles III
label: climate
content: King Charles III, a longtime supporter of organic farming, visited Honeydale Farm in Englands Cotswolds region to learn about its focus on growing a wide variety of plants to regenerate the soil.

title: This startup plans to recycle aluminum from cars and keep it all in the U.S.
label: climate
content: A startup is using AI to sort shredded aluminium in the US, allowing the metal to be reused in domestic industries like automotive, construction and aerospace, while maintaining its value. Sorteras technology could reduce energy use in aluminium production by 95%. Backed by RA Capital and Macquarie Capital, among others, the company has raised $73m to date.

title: How the construction industry is trying to tackle climate change
label: climate
content: A Turkish businessmans solution to stolen manhole covers has led to a new earthquake-resistant, environmentally-friendly building material being used to construct buildings. More than 200 buildings in Turkey have been built using Renco blocks, which have also been used to construct an apartment complex in Palm Springs. The material has a lower carbon footprint than concrete or steel, is lighter to transport and can be recycled.

title: Xiaomi plans to sell EVs globally after launching $73,000 premium car
label: transportation
content: Xiaomi President William Lu has announced at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona that the company plans to sell its electric vehicles outside of China within the next few years. While there were no concrete timelines for Lus comments, Xiaomi launched its first premium EV, the SU7 Ultra, in China last week, with 15,000 orders made within 24 hours.

title: Delta Air Lines slashes earnings outlook on weaker U.S. demand, sending shares lower
label: transportation
content: Delta Air Lines has joined other airlines in warning of a slowdown in travel, as it cuts its first-quarter revenue and profit forecasts citing weaker domestic demand and increased macro uncertainty.

title: Rivian beats Wall Street's Q4 expectations, but expects lower deliveries in 2025
label: transportation
content: Rivian reported its first gross quarterly profit of $170 million during the fourth quarter of 2024, but the electric vehicle maker expects lower sales and adjusted losses in 2025.

title: DuPont jumps on a strong quarter, and a big reason to own remains on track
label: industrials
content: DuPont shares jumped on better-than-expected earnings and revenue, boosted in part by the companys exposure to the fast-growing AI semiconductor market.

title: Wine consumption is changing. The industry hopes new trends will help it survive
label: retail
content: Global wine consumption is falling, with the International Organisation of Wine and Vine predicting a 2% drop in production last year, to levels not seen since 1961. Economic challenges and changes in drinking behaviour have contributed to the decline, with consumers now drinking less and opting for higher-quality wines. This has led to a rise in demand for organic, orange and non-alcoholic wines, as well as higher-end fine vintages.

title: Comcast expands partnership with Olympics, extends media rights through 2036
label: sports
content: The media rights agreement will see Comcast and the IOC collaborate on broadcast infrastructure, in-venue distribution, U.S. digital advertising, and more.

title: Women's sports firm Monarch Collective ups fund size to $250 million
label: sports
content: Womens sports-focused investment firm Monarch Collective is expanding its fund from $150m to $250m after increased interest in the sector from investors. The firm, which has backers including ex-Netflix executive Cindy Holland and Pivotal Ventures, the venture capital firm of Melinda French Gates, will use the funding to invest in teams in the US and abroad.

title: Treasury Department halts BOI reporting enforcement for millions of businesses
label: small-business
content: The U.S. Department of the Treasury wont enforce penalties or fines for required beneficial ownership information reporting for millions of domestic businesses. The Corporate Transparency Act was enacted to fight illicit finance and shell company formation.

title: Main Street is more optimistic this year even as inflation persists, survey says
label: small-business
content: A survey by Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Business Voices found 75% of small business owners are optimistic about their financial trajectory in 2024, despite inflation and lending issues. More than half of respondents said they expect to create jobs and 62% reported they anticipate profits will increase.

title: AI is inside the operations, and behind CEO desk, at America's small businesses
label: small-business
content: While large corporations are increasingly using generative artificial intelligence to gain an advantage, many small businesses are also finding ways to use this technology to their advantage, according to a 2024 survey by Gusto. The biggest benefit of using gen AI for small businesses is getting ahead in the race for talent, with AI-equipped businesses 45% more likely to fill open roles. In addition, gen AI is helping owners and employees focus on the skills they want to use.

title: Military families have special tax breaks — but the rules can be tricky
label: personal-finance
content: Members of the U.S. military and their families can take advantage of several tax breaks, including some exemptions on certain types of income and allowances, as well as a break on state taxes.

title: Rules for repaying Social Security benefits just got stricter. Here's what to know
label: personal-finance
content: The Social Security Administration will reinstate a 100% default withholding rate on benefit checks for those who were overpaid, reversing a policy implemented in March 2024 that reduced the amount withheld to 10%.

title: Register now: Applications open for the world's top fintech companies of 2025 list
label: fintech
content: CNBC has partnered with Statista for the third consecutive year to find the top financial technology companies in the world. Applications are now open for companies to register for consideration by Statistas researchers, with the deadline for submissions on April 25th, 2025.

title: It may be a good time for investors to look at less risky ways to stay in the stock market
label: etf-street
content: With the market correcting and President Trumps hardline approach to tariffs raising recession risks, investors should consider downside-protecting ETFs, says Goldman Sachs Asset Managements Bryon Lake. Covered call and buffer funds are worth investigating, he advises.

title: Santander says 750 jobs at risk as it pursues UK branch closures
label: finance
content: Santander UK has announced plans to cut 750 jobs and close a total of 95 branches as part of a wider strategy to update its operations. The bank has observed a shift towards digital banking, with transactions at physical branches declining since 2019. The bank employs 18,000 people in the UK.

title: Retail sales increased 0.2% in February, though spending up less than expected
label: economy
content: Consumers spent at a slower-than-expected pace in February, though underlying readings indicated that sales still grew at a solid pace.

title: Goldman Sachs offers its newest option for downside protection
label: finance
content: Goldman Sachs has launched a buffer exchange-traded fund to offer investors protection from market turmoil. The funds value is designed to protect investors from a 5% to 15% drop in the market, while also allowing them to benefit from up to a 5% to 7% rise in the market. The fund is the firms U.S. Large Cap Buffer 3 ETF, which started trading on March 4.

label: industrials
content: The remains of all 67 people killed in the crash of an American Airlines regional jet and a Army Black Hawk helicopter over the Potomac River near Reagan National Airport have been recovered, officials said Tuesday.

content: LVMH shares sink as investors cautious following its annual results, despite them beating expectations. LVMHs critical fashion and leather goods and wines and spirits segments saw declining sales. The results come as a contrast after Cartier-owner Richemont reported highest ever sales over Christmas.

title: Ad spending on women's sports more than doubled last year
label: sports
content: TV advertisers spent $244m on womens sports in 2024, a year-on-year increase of 139%, with basketball receiving the most investment of any sport, according to marketing firm EDO.

title: CNBC Sport: ESPN braces for brand confusion with flagship streaming service
label: sports
content: ESPNs new service will be marketed as a tier of the more expensive platform, rather than its own standalone product, meaning there will be a flagship light, which will be the artist formerly known as ESPN+.

title: The SBA is unveiling credit lines of up to $5 million to fund small businesses
label: small-business
content: The US Small Business Administration is launching a pilot programme offering credit lines of $5m aimed at increasing the appeal of its lending options to small businesses. The agencys existing products have had less uptake from borrowers and lenders, according to SBA Administrator Isabel Casillas Guzman, who said the new offering would have a simpler fee structure. The agency will offer loans with an annual fee and interest rates of between 12% and 15% based on the prime rate.

title: You could score a tax break for hiring your own kids — if you know the rules

content: Hiring your children can lead to tax benefits, but there are labor laws and IRS rules to follow and nuances to consider.

label: sports
content: Hundreds of demonstrators have gathered nationwide outside Tesla showrooms as part of a "Tesla Takedown" movement calling for people to "sell your Teslas, dump your stock, join the picket lines.

title: Digital humans: the relatable face of artificial intelligence?
label: sports
content: UK startup Sum Vivas has created a digital DJ called Dex, who performs on video screens and holographs, with her mixes created by humans while her memory and conversational skills are generated by AI. The company is now developing digital humans capable of holding conversations with humans in real time, who could work as avatars on company websites or as concierges in airports.

title: Pepsi joins the healthy soda wars and buys Poppi for $1.6 billion
label: sports
content: The deal marks PepsiCos further shift into the "better-for-you" category as consumers shy away from sugar-filled drinks. Poppi, which sells prebiotic soda, will complement PepsiCos portfolio transformation efforts, the company said.

title: The number of available jobs in the US grew in January
label: sports
content: The number of job openings rose from Decembers 7.51 million to 7.74 million in January, according to the latest Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey. Although the report shows optimism from employers, economists warn that the labor market could be in for turbulence ahead.

title: Nvidia warns of growing competition from China's Huawei, despite U.S. sanctions
label: china-markets
content: Chipmaker Nvidia said in an annual filing that Huawei is giving it increased competition, despite U.S. restrictions on the Chinese telecoms company.

title: Huawei charts global comeback with pricey phones — but major challenges remain
label: china-markets
content: The Chinese tech company, which used to be a major player in the international smartphone market, is attempting to maintain its brand image as an innovative company while selling high-end smartphones.

title: Mainland Chinese investors snap up a record amount of Hong Kong stocks
label: china-markets
content: Mainland investors bought a record amount of Hong Kong stocks on Monday, data showed, as the Hang Seng Index traded around three-year highs.

title: China targets 'around 5%' GDP growth in 2025 and lays out stimulus measures
label: china-markets
content: China raised its budget deficit target to around 4% of GDP from 3% last year as the countrys top legislative body held its annual meeting.

title: Gold prices soar to record high fueled by safe-haven demand
label: world-markets
content: Gold prices hit a record high as concerns over global trade wars fuelled safe-haven demand for the precious metal. Spot gold rose 0.1% to $2,936.38 an ounce, having earlier hit its tenth record high so far this year.

title: Yen rises, dollar steady as traders assess tariff risk, policy outlook
label: world-markets
content: The yen firmed and the U.S. dollar held steady on Thursday as investors pondered what U.S. President Donald Trumps latest tariff agenda would mean for the global economy.

title: Egg prices are rapidly falling so far in March
label: economy
content: Egg prices have fallen by 15% since February, due to reduced fears of further outbreaks of bird flu, but they are still 170% more expensive than this time last year.

title: New York AG announces bill to protect consumers after Trump hobbles CFPB
label: finance
content: New York Attorney General Letitia James has announced a bill to protect consumers and small businesses from scams and deceptive practices from lenders, debt collectors and health care firms, saying that the legislation would plug gaps left by a hobbled federal consumer protection agency.

title: SolarEdge surges despite posting steep fourth-quarter loss
label: climate
content: SolarEdge shares surged 16% on Wednesday following a steep Q4 loss, as results beat Wall Street expectations despite being down year over year. High interest rates and a potential repeal of the Inflation Reduction Act threaten the residential solar sector.

title: Trump and bitcoin: BlackRock predicts another historic year for crypto
label: etf-street
content: Bitcoin should see another historic year due to deregulation under President-elect Donald Trump, says BlackRocks ETF and index instruments CIO.

title: HPE to cut 2,500 employees as stock slides 19% on weak earnings outlook
label: earnings
content: Hewlett Packard Enterprise slid as much as 19% in after-hours trading on Thursday after issuing quarterly and full-year guidance that came in below Wall Streets expectations.

title: Why the toll road text scam is out of control across U.S., and Apple, Android can't stop it
label: cybersecurity
content: Toll road text scams are at epidemic levels and are likely being perpetrated by Chinese criminal gangs, according to cybersecurity experts. The texts warn drivers they face fines and the loss of their license if they do not pay a toll. Some people have fallen for the scam, but those who comply are also targeted for further scams, experts warned.

title: CrowdStrike CEO describes the escalating threat of foreign hackers
label: cybersecurity
content: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz told CNBC that the company is seeing break out times, or how quickly a hacker is able to enter a system and then move somewhere else in the network, of 51 seconds, a speed he says the company hasnt seen in the past.

title: OpenAI urges Trump administration to remove guardrails for the industry
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: OpenAI has submitted its proposal to the US government, calling for the freedom to innovate and a partnership between the private and public sectors, while also highlighting the dangers of AI tech coming out of China.

title: Cramer's Lightning Round: 'You've got a winner in Cheesecake Factory'
label: mobile
content: Jim Cramer dishes on stocks and shares his thoughts on investing in turbulent markets. Here are the transcripts of his latest Mad Money TV show.

title: Nominate a company for CNBC's 2025 Disruptor 50 list
label: cnbc-disruptors
content: CNBC has opened applications for its annual Disruptor 50 list, which looks at the most innovative venture-backed companies using breakthrough technology to solve increasing economic and consumer challenges. The deadline for entries is Monday, Feb. 10.

title: Why OpenAI is first company to top CNBC Disruptor 50 list for two years in a row
label: cnbc-disruptors
content: OpenAI has made history by becoming the first company to top the CNBC Disruptor 50 list two years in a row, thanks to the companys ongoing pace of innovation and its application of AI to a broad range of industries.

title: Apple's new iPad Pro is thin and fast, but the software needs an update
label: tech-guide
content: Apples new iPad Pro is finally here and while its impressive on hardware specs, the devices software is feeling dated, according to a CNBC article. The new iPad Pro is thinner and lighter than its predecessor and features an OLED screen, the M4 chip, and an updated Magic Keyboard, but the articles author believes iPadOS needs to catch up with the hardwares capabilities.

title: Apple's Vision Pro virtual reality headset launches in U.S.
label: tech-guide
content: Apples high-end mixed reality headset, the Vision Pro, has officially launched in the U.S. and is also being pitched as a tool for enterprises, CEO Tim Cook said.

title: EU leaders prepare 'concrete' measures on defense financing, sources say
label: defense
content: The EU will look to announce new measures to boost defence financing at a key summit on Thursday, as Europe continues to support Ukraine in its defence against Russia. The EU has been keen to not alienate President Trump, who has repeatedly criticised European defence spending, while ensuring support for Ukraine continues. The EU may announce common borrowing for defence projects, or repurposing of outstanding financial capacity from pandemic funds.

title: Why a European Starlink rival's shares rocketed 190% in a week
label: defense
content: Shares of French satellite operator Eutelsat rocketed almost 390% last week. The firm is in talks with the EU to potentially boost its services in Ukraine, filling a potential void left by Elon Musks Starlink.

title: Trump touts BlackRock's Panama Canal port deal as part of U.S. 'reclaiming' passage
label: china-politics
content: President Donald Trump touted on Tuesday a deal between BlackRock and CK Hutchison to buy two Panama Canal ports as a positive step in his broader effort to reclaim the canal for the United States.

title: Nissan could face cost-cutting 'carnage' in Honda merger, Carlos Ghosn says
label: asia-politics
content: The merger would put Nissan in a weaker position compared to Honda, the former chief executive told CNBC. The combined group would be the worlds third-largest automaker.

title: Utah just gave Mark Zuckerberg a big win. But other tech giants aren’t so happy
label: sports
content: Utah has passed a law requiring app stores to verify users ages and obtain parental consent before minors download apps, a move thats being backed by Meta and other platforms. But Apple and Google have raised privacy and First Amendment concerns about the legislation.

title: Streaming and texting on the Moon: Nokia and NASA are taking 4G into space
label: sports
content: NASA and Nokia have partnered to set up the first cellular network on the Moon, aiming to lay the groundwork for long-term human presence on other planets. The network would aid in streaming high-quality video and scientific data and could one day allow space colonists to use smartphones. It may also have commercial benefits on Earth, surviving in extreme locations.

title: Amazon touts its first quantum computing chip a week after Microsoft's unveiling
label: enterprise
content: Amazon revealed its first chip designed for quantum computing, called Ocelot, and said the design is a step toward building efficient high-scale systems.

title: Apple to open AI server factory in Texas as part of $500 billion U.S. investment
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Apple has announced a $500m investment in the US over the next four years, including a new AI server factory in Texas and plans to hire 20,000 new employees. The move comes as Apple faces pressure from the Trump administration to manufacture its products in the US.

title: How the first Nvidia earnings day after DeepSeek will be different
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Chinese start-up DeepSeek temporarily dethroned OpenAIs ChatGPT as the most downloaded free app on Apples App Store in January, shaking the AI market. Despite Nvidias stock falling more than 15% in a single day, companies are still developing AI-specific semiconductor chips and building out compute power for models to use. Experts predict more foundational models will appear, with increased competition keeping things in check.

title: Doximity shares soar 25% after company beats on revenue, raises guidance
label: social-media
content: The medical professional networks revenue rose 25% in Q3 from the year-ago period, and the company expects a strong Q4, too.

title: Snap shares soar on better-than-expected profit and revenue
label: social-media
content: Snap shares rose as much as 11% in extended trading Tuesday after the company reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings and revenue.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX, Tesla lobby Trump trade representative on tariffs
label: white-house
content: Tesla and SpaceX have submitted letters to the U.S. Trade Representative warning of the negative impact of Trumps tariffs. Tesla warned of the negative effect on its bottom line from tariffs as well as from duties imposed by other countries on U.S.-made products in retaliation for those tariffs. SpaceX, meanwhile, complained that trade barriers abroad increase operating costs for its Starlink internet service, while foreign competitors face no such costs in the United States.

title: Early signs of dementia can show in your finances
label: sports
content: Warning signs of dementia may include a deterioration in financial acumen, with researchers finding that in the five years before a dementia diagnosis, a persons credit score starts to weaken and payment delinquencies rise. Those close to someone who is showing signs of dementia should try to take steps to help them manage their finances, such as setting up automated bill payments, and ensure they have the legal rights to do so, such as being given power of attorney.

title: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif targets LA Olympics in 2028 after brushing off Donald Trump criticism
label: sports
content: Imane Khelif, the Algerian gold medal-winning boxer at the Paris 2024 Olympics, says she is aiming to defend her title at the Los Angeles 2028 Games, despite criticism from Donald Trump.

title: Magnus Carlsen rules out classical World Chess Championship return, shifting focus to new era
label: sports
content: Norwegian five-time world champion Magnus Carlsen is ruling out a return to the classical World Chess Championship, citing a lack of motivation. Instead, he is focusing on newer competitions, such as the Freestyle tournament and the Esports World Cup, where he will represent Team Liquid.

title: Bulgarian team apologizes after holding a minute’s silence for former player who isn’t dead
label: sports
content: A Bulgarian soccer team held a minutes silence for a former player, only to realize he was still very much alive.

title: New Zealand’s Sam Ruthe, 15, becomes youngest person to run a four-minute mile
label: sports
content: Sam Ruthe has run a sub-four-minute mile, becoming the youngest person to do so. The New Zealand athlete, who turns 16 in mid-April, ran a time of 3:58.35 in Auckland on Wednesday. Ruthe was paced by two-time Olympian Sam Tanner.

title: Tennis players’ association formed by Novak Djokovic taking legal action against the sport’s governing bodies
label: sports
content: The association, co-founded by tennis star Novak Djokovic, has filed lawsuits in the US, EU and UK, alleging tennis bodies make it "impossible" for players to earn a fair living.

title: Amazon to stream Trump’s ‘The Apprentice’ reality TV series
label: sports
content: The reality TV show that gave Donald Trump his first big TV break will be available for streaming on Amazons Prime Video.

title: OpenAI’s wild week. How the Sam Altman story unfolded
label: sports
content: The drama at the AI firm has captivated tech watchers after CEO Sam Altman was fired and then reinstated within the space of a week.

title: LeBron James says he’s ‘happy to have helped’ Mirra Andreeva in Indian Wells win
label: sports
content: LeBron James said hes happy to have helped tennis player Mirra Andreeva, after the 17-year-old credited one of James interviews as inspiration for her Indian Wells title win. Andreeva beat world number one Aryna Sabalenka to claim the title on Sunday.

title: March Madness starts with a bang: Alabama State earns thrilling win and North Carolina has dominant performance
label: sports
content: Alabama State defeated Saint Francis (PA) 70-68 in the First Four of the mens basketball tournament to secure its first-ever tournament victory. The win propels the Hornets to a Round of 64 matchup with the top-seeded Auburn Tigers.

title: Iga Świątek says she’s either called ‘a robot’ or ‘hysterical’ in response to ball boy incident at Indian Wells
label: sports
content: Iga Świątek, a five-time grand slam champion, has addressed an incident in which she vented frustration by hitting a ball thrown to her by a ball boy hard into the ground during a semifinal defeat at Indian Wells.

title: From Oh to Ohtani: How Japan developed a generation of baseball superstars (again)
label: sports
content: From 1934 to the present day, baseball has had a profound influence on the sporting landscape in Japan — and vice versa.

title: Rory McIlroy comfortably beats JJ Spaun in rare Monday playoff to win second Players Championship
label: sports
content: Rory McIlroy won his second Players Championship with a three-shot victory in a playoff with JJ Spaun. The Northern Irishman sealed victory with a one-over par performance across three playoff holes.

label: Tennis

label: Tennis

title: Deflation-hit China's $41 billion plan to boost consumption is just a start
label: china-markets
content: Chinas latest move to boost consumer spending wont lead to a spending spree for all goods and services, analysts say. Instead, look for retail sales of so-called big-ticket items like cars and appliances to get a boost as the government offers consumer subsidies.

title: Inflation rate eased to 2.8% in February, lower than expected
label: economy
content: Inflation data for February showed consumer prices rising less than expected, giving some relief to consumers and businesses worried about the impact of tariffs on prices.

title: Bessent said the White House is focused on the 'real economy' and not 'a little' market volatility
label: economy
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the administration is focused on long-term economic gains, and not a little bit of volatility over three weeks.

title: A child dies of measles in West Texas outbreak
label: health-and-science
content: A measles outbreak in Texas has resulted in the death of an unvaccinated child, the first death from the disease in the U.S. in a decade.

title: Paramount ends DEI policies, cites Trump executive order
label: media
content: The media giant told employees it will comply with President Donald Trumps executive order banning the practice and demanding that agencies investigate private companies over their diversity, equity and inclusion programs.

title: Denver Broncos president Damani Leech praises NFL's diversity commitment
label: media
content: Denver Broncos president Damani Leech praised the NFLs commitment to diversity despite corporate and governmental efforts to rollback diversity, equity, and inclusion hiring practices.

title: Former New Orleans Saints quarterback Drew Brees hints at return to broadcasting
label: media
content: The former NFL quarterback indicated he is in talks to join a teams broadcast crew as an analyst. Brees, a certain Hall of Famer, has followed the path of other retired quarterbacks like Tom Brady and Tony Romo in commenting on plays and games from their unique perspective.

title: 13 anonymous media executives make predictions for the new year
label: media
content: Some of the predictions made by media executives in 2023 about what would happen in the industry in 2024 turned out to be correct. But others missed the mark.

title: Alphabet aims to slash cost of new nuclear with small reactor deployments, CIO says
label: energy
content: Alphabets Google unit is aiming to slash the cost of building new nuclear reactors by deploying a series of small reactors through its deal with developer Kairos Power, the tech companys President and Chief Investment Officer Ruth Porat said.

title: MoonPay pushes further into enterprise with Iron stablecoin acquisition
label: energy
content: Crypto payments company MoonPay is expanding its push into the enterprise market through the acquisition of Iron, an API-first stablecoin infrastructure startup. The acquisition will enable MoonPay to offer businesses the ability to accept stablecoin payments. It marks MoonPays second significant acquisition in two months as the company looks to dominate the stablecoin payments market.

title: Trump's first White House Crypto Summit has VIPs pushing for favorable laws
label: energy
content: Crypto industry leaders head to the White House on Friday for Trumps first crypto summit; Trumps plans for a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve was announced late Thursday; Brian Armstrong of Coinbase has been instrumental in shaping the new administrations approach to digital assets; Crypto leaders head to the White House on Friday for Trumps first crypto summit.

title: U.S. consumers are starting to crack as tariffs add to inflation, recession concerns
label: transportation
content: Companies that serve everyone from penny-pinching grocery shoppers to first-class travelers are seeing cracks in demand as the Trump administrations tariff policies and rising inflation take their toll on consumers.

title: Trump grants automakers one-month exemption from tariffs
label: transportation
content: The White House said it would exempt vehicles and parts that comply with the USMCAs rules of origin from the new 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada that take effect next week.

title: The biggest self-defeating mistakes investors make in trying to beat the market
label: etf-street
content: Charley Ellis, a pioneer of index investing, warns investors that their own mindset is just as key among the variables that can set their financial portfolio back as market volatility.

title: Adobe drops 13% as concerns about AI growth overshadow better-than-expected results
label: earnings
content: The software makers shares closed down more than 12% despite beating earnings expectations on Wall Street.

title: CrowdStrike falls 9% on disappointing earnings forecast
label: earnings
content: CrowdStrike shares dropped nearly 9% in after-hours trading on Tuesday after the company issued disappointing earnings guidance.

title: Remembering Art Cashin’s most valuable stock market lessons
label: trader-talk
content: Cashin, a fixture at the New York Stock Exchange for nearly 60 years who died this week at age 83, was a consummate storyteller who used parables and anecdotes to convey investing lessons.

title: Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak blasts Musk's DOGE over 'sledgehammer' approach
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Steve Wozniak has criticized the sledgehammer approach taken by Elon Musks Department of Government Efficiency to cut administrative costs and implement mass firings at federal government agencies.

title: Scale AI announces multimillion-dollar defense deal, a major military push
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Scale AI has announced a deal with the Department of Defense for its flagship AI agent program, which it says will provide the military with AI-powered, data-driven warfare. The program will initially be rolled out to the U.S. Indo-Pacific Command and U.S. European Command, before being scaled up. The deal comes after several AI companies, including Google, Microsoft-backed OpenAI and Meta, have reversed bans on their technology being used for military purposes.

title: Why automakers Honda and Toyota are investing in rockets and satellites
label: social-media
content: Toyota, Honda and others are investing in space startups to develop rockets and satellites that could be used for improving navigation services and autonomous vehicle technology.

title: Market action signals the White House should change course on tariffs, Jim Cramer says
label: mobile
content: Jim Cramer says the market is indicating that President Donald Trumps tariff policies arent working and the White House should take a different approach. Cramer also weighs in on the major indexes movement and the companies that reported earnings on Wednesday.

title: Microsoft's Surface Pro isn't the AI device to change personal computing
label: tech-guide
content: Microsofts new premium Surface Pro laptop aims to take on Apples MacBook Air with similar Arm-based chips for greater energy efficiency and the promise of AI-powered features. But it faces app compatibility issues.

title: Trump CMS nominee Dr. Oz won't commit to opposing Medicaid cuts
label: white-house
content: President Trumps pick to lead Medicare and Medicaid, Dr. Mehmet Oz, would not commit to opposing future cuts to the programs during a Senate confirmation hearing.

title: Trump Media stock has lost half its value since Inauguration Day
label: white-house
content: Trumps preferred social media company sank more than 11% on Monday, continuing a downward slide since the Republican president took office.

title: Trump meets with CEOs at Business Roundtable as market sell-off continues
label: white-house
content: President Donald Trump insisted Tuesday that his tariffs are helping the U.S. economy, even as the market sell-off continued and Wall Street called for clarity on his trade policies.

title: Trump downplays concerns about his tariffs and the prospect of higher prices
label: policy
content: The president said his broader tariffs will go into effect April 2, raising them to match what other countries assess. He seemed to acknowledge that his plans could affect US growth, but said it would be great for us.

title: Global bonds sell off as investors react to Trump's tariffs and a German 'paradigm shift'
label: policy
content: Bond yields rose across the globe on Thursday, with the yield on Germanys benchmark 10-year bund rising more than 10 basis points as investors digested the countrys new political direction.

title: Southwest Airlines to slash 15% of corporate jobs in 'unprecedented' move to cut costs
label: industrials
content: Southwest Airlines is laying off about 1,750 people, or 15% of its workforce and mostly by the end of the second quarter, citing an unprecedented move to cut costs, CEO Bob Jordan said.

title: Trump 'not happy' with Boeing Air Force One delays, but airlines grow upbeat
label: industrials
content: Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said at a conference on Thursday that Elon Musk is helping the aircraft manufacturer deliver two new Air Force One planes to the US government faster.

title: Globalstar CEO Paul Jacobs: Why satellite company listed on Nasdaq
label: industrials
content: Satellite communications company Globalstar listed on the Nasdaq on Tuesday after delisting from the New York Stock Exchange. The company signed deals worth billions with Apple and MDA Space. CEO Paul Jacobs sees a lot of investment going into the NBA as valuations continue to rise.

title: From bridges to refineries and defense, robots fix on aging US infrastructure
label: industrials
content: More than a third of US bridges and 153 oil refineries require structural repairs, putting human safety at risk and increasing pollution. Robots can inspect infrastructure without putting humans in danger, gathering data on structure health over time. Growing industries include defence, energy and manufacturing, with companies like Gecko and Percepto using AI to predict when failures might occur.

title: American Eagle says consumer is slowing down, issues weak guidance
label: retail
content: Shares of American Eagle dropped about 5% in extended trading on Wednesday after the apparel retailer warned investors that consumers are pulling back on spending.

title: IMAX CEO expects $1.2 billion in box office receipts in 2025
label: life
content: Rich Gelfond, CEO of IMAX, discusses the companys outlook for the year, pointing to several blockbuster titles slated for release in the next 10 months.

title: Middle school students in Utah are learning to pitch like a Shark Tank founder
label: small-business
content: Draper Park Middle School students in Utah participated in a competition inspired by Shark Tank with Olympic gold medalist Ashley Caldwell and three top Utah business leaders as judges. The junior achievement event was part of a broader effort to expose students to financial education.

title: The Taylor Swift economy has reached every town in America
label: small-business
content: Small businesses are using Taylor Swift-themed events to attract customers, from pizza places to theaters, with the economist Ryan Herzog calling the singer a global economic phenomenon, even at the micro level.

title: Don’t hide cash at home — here’s what you’re risking and what to do instead, experts say
label: personal-finance
content: While it can be helpful to have cash on hand in an emergency, its important to consider where you keep it. Heres what experts recommend.

title: Here's what student loan borrowers should know as Trump targets PSLF
label: personal-finance
content: President Donald Trump has signed an executive order that aims to limit eligibility for a popular student loan forgiveness program. Heres what borrowers need to know.

title: Trump says Education Dept. shouldn't handle student loans: 'Not their business'
label: personal-finance
content: The president says the Education Department shouldnt be handling student loans, but moving the loan accounts of tens of millions of people to another agency would cause chaos, experts say.

title: 'Wealthy tax dodgers' could benefit from IRS layoffs, Democrats warn
label: personal-finance
content: Congressional Democrats are concerned that ongoing IRS layoffs will hurt the agencys ability to audit wealthy tax dodgers. Theyre asking the IRS to provide more information about the terminations of thousands of workers.

title: Stripe's valuation climbs to $91.5 billion in secondary stock offer
label: fintech
content: Stripe revealed it generated $1.4 trillion in total payment volume in 2024, up 38% from the year prior. The company also announced a new tender offer to employees and shareholders, valuing the payments startup at $91.5bn.

title: PayPal brings many of its brands under single umbrella, but Venmo remains stand-alone
label: fintech
content: After two years and two CEOs, the company is consolidating many of its offerings — Braintree, Zettle, Hyperwallet, Chargehound — into a single brand in an effort to boost its importance to businesses.

title: Oakland A’s being valued at $2 billion in sale of new shares of team
label: sports
content: The Oakland As are looking to raise funds for a new stadium and have been vetting investors for several weeks, according to sources. The team is valued at $2bn and is looking to raise $550m to finance the stadium, with the Fisher family contributing the rest. The As have played in Oakland since 1968 but have struggled with low attendance in recent years.

title: FTC asks to delay Amazon trial over staff shortages following Musk-led cuts
label: Tech
content: The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has asked a Seattle court to delay its case against Amazon, alleging misleading practices over its Prime subscription service, due to staff shortages.

title: First-class seats are getting so fancy they're holding up new airplanes
label: transportation
content: Aircraft manufacturers say seats and other cabin features are among the latest delays in getting new planes to customers. Regulator approval for luxurious first- and business-class cabins with hundreds of parts are part of the holdup.

title: Donatella Versace steps down as head of Versace
label: retail
content: Donatella Versace is stepping down from her role as Versaces chief creative officer, a position shes held since her brother and the fashion houses founder was murdered in 1997. She will be replaced by Dario Vitale, formerly of Miu Miu, and will remain with the company as its chief brand ambassador.

title: Egg prices are threatening a classic holiday tradition: Easter dye kits
label: life
content: Egg dye kit makers are concerned about diminished sales ahead of the Easter holiday because of the ongoing egg shortage. Many companies rely on Easter sales for a significant chunk of their annual revenue.

title: Anxious Gen Z are taking telephobia courses to learn the lost art of a call
label: life
content: Telephobia, or a fear of making or receiving calls, is prevalent among Gen Z who prefer to text or use social media to communicate, causing some to panic when faced with a phone call, according to Liz Baxter, a careers advisor at Nottingham College. The trend has been exacerbated by Covid-19 lockdowns which saw young people turn to digital tools for communication.

title: Meta is targeting 'hundreds of millions' of businesses in agentic AI deployment
label: small-business
content: Clara Shih, head of business AI at Meta, believes that not long from now every business... is going to have an AI agent representing it and acting on its behalf. title: Nasdaq 100 celebrates 40 years: Is crypto the next big driver for gains?
label: etf-street
content: The Nasdaq 100 is turning 40 this week and undergoing a historic shift, according to Strategas Securities Todd Sohn, who sees cryptocurrency companies fuelling the next wave of gains, suggesting the Qs will be the biggest.

title: BMW posts 37% drop in annual net profit, warns of 'subdued' Chinese demand
label: earnings
content: BMW has warned that the implementation of tariffs is set to have a negative impact on earnings in the year ahead, saying that added tariffs on US imports alone would lower its autos earnings margin by one percentage point.

title: Shares of DocuSign surge 14% on strong earnings, AI boost
label: earnings
content: Shares of the firm jumped 14% after it reported stronger-than-expected earnings. The companys new AI-enabled content is expected to account for low double digits of the business by Q4, CEO Allan Thygesen said.

title: Rally in small caps just starting: VettaFI's Rosenbluth suggests
label: etf-street
content: Small-cap stocks just had their best week in three years, and one ETF expert predicts the groups record highs will drive investors back into a group thats historically been known for market-beating gains.

title: Best Buy shares plunge as CEO warns price hikes are 'highly likely' due to tariffs
label: earnings
content: The consumer electronics company reported fiscal fourth-quarter earnings and revenue that topped expectations, but CEO Corie Barry said prices for U.S. consumers would rise.

title: Broadcom shares rise as AI growth powers strong guidance
label: earnings
content: Broadcom posted strong first-quarter earnings and guidance, signaling ongoing demand for its chips that power AI applications.

title: Okta pops more than 24% on strong earnings and guidance beat, posts best day in more than two years
label: earnings
content: Oktas shares soared 24.3% after the cloud-based identity management company delivered strong Q4 earnings and a beat on guidance, rocketing the stock to its best day since Dec. 1, 2022.

title: Palantir delivers first two AI-enabled systems to U.S. Army
label: cybersecurity
content: The company is rolling out its Tactical Intelligence Targeting Access Node systems for the U.S. Army, harnessing AI to help improve warfare strategies and targeting.

title: China's Honor pledges $10 billion AI investment and deepens ties with Google in global push
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: The Chinese smartphone maker, which spun off from Huawei in 2020, is looking to expand its market share. It will use the funds to develop AI agents and platforms, and prepare for the AGI era, according to a spokesperson.

title: Online scams easier than ever, as cybercrime markets flourish, experts warn
label: cybersecurity
content: Advances in scam technology and the growth of organised online markets have reduced the barriers to entry for would-be cybercriminals, posing unprecedented threats to cybersecurity. Criminal gangs now operate like legitimate organisations in their structure and processes, offering a range of malicious tools and cybercrime-as-a-service on underground markets. These services can be used to facilitate scams, such as fraudulent investments, for a relatively low cost.

title: Operation Hope CEO: AI will eliminate jobs for those at 'bottom of the pyramid'
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: John Hope Bryant warns that AI will disproportionately impact those at the bottom of the pyramid. Urges governments to invest in upskilling the working and middle classes, and younger generations, in AI to boost economies. Jobs such as convenience and grocery store jobs are disappearing, he warns, and warns that those in lower education with limited relationship capital will be most at risk of redundancy within five years.

title: OpenAI to pay CoreWeave $11.9 billion over 5 years for AI data centers, services
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Artificial intelligence company OpenAI has signed a deal with CoreWeave, a data centre technology provider, in a deal worth $11.9bn. As part of the deal, CoreWeave will receive a stake in OpenAI, valued at around $350m, which will be realised when CoreWeave lists publicly in the next few weeks.

title: AI's growth is just getting started, BlackRock's thematic ETF head says
label: etf-street
content: BlackRocks US head of thematic and active ETFs, Jay Jacobs, has predicted that the infrastructure and cybersecurity sectors will thrive in 2025, due to the AI boom and the need for data centres and cybersecurity. He suggested that investors look beyond megacap tech names for other companies that will benefit from the rise of AI.

title: Microsoft reiterates plan to invest $80 billion in AI, but may 'adjust' some spending
label: enterprise
content: The company said it remains on track with its plan to spend more than $80 billion this fiscal year on data centers that can handle AI workloads.

title: OpenAI starts research preview of GPT-4.5 general-purpose large language model
label: enterprise
content: OpenAI has released a research preview of its GPT-4.5 model, saying the new tool is more natural and provides more accurate information than its predecessors. The release, which will be opened initially to software developers and ChatGPT Pro subscribers, comes after the company announced a $40bn funding round at a $340bn valuation.

title: 'What Europe needs is a DOGE,' Deutsche Telekom CEO says in plea for deregulation
label: internet
content: Europe needs its own Elon Musk-style Department of Government Efficiency to tackle red tape and bureaucracy, particularly in the telecoms industry, said Deutsche Telekom CEO Tim Höttges at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona on Monday.

title: Broadcom's report gives the battered AI trade a much-needed win
label: earnings
content: Shares of Broadcom climbed more than 5% in after-hours trading Thursday after the chipmaker reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue for its latest quarter.

title: Samsung to launch its Apple Vision Pro rival headset this year
label: internet
content: Samsung is set to launch its XR headset, Project Moohan, this year, according to a company spokesperson. The device will compete with Apples $3,500 Vision Pro headset, which was launched in the US last year. Samsung has worked with Qualcomm and Google to develop a new XR platform and there is speculation that the company is also working on a pair of smart glasses, having teased such a product in a January presentation.

title: US stocks rally but Dow posts worst week since 2023
label: sports
content: US stocks surged Friday but all three major indexes still closed the week in the red as President Trumps budding trade war has sent jitters through markets.

title: The Washington Post is reinventing its newsroom as it struggles to retain subscribers
label: sports
content: The Washington Post announced a major reorganization of its newsroom, including separating its digital and print workflows and expanding its social media presence, as the Jeff Bezos-owned publication looks to grow its dwindling subscription numbers.

title: 401(k)s did well in 2024, but not just due to market gains. You deserve credit, too
label: sports
content: Strong stock market performance last year helped 401(k) balances rise, but employees who saved consistently and invested wisely also deserve credit.

title: Trump administration backs off mandate addressing housing segregation and discrimination
label: sports
content: The Trump administration is rolling back an Obama-era rule that required cities to address housing segregation. Affordable housing advocates say the move will exacerbate racial disparities.

title: Washington Commanders to acquire Deebo Samuel in trade with San Francisco 49ers
label: US Sports
content: The Washington Commanders have agreed to trade for star wide receiver Deebo Samuel from the San Francisco 49ers in exchange for a fifth-round draft pick.

title: Fans are being let into ‘the inner sanctum’ of F1 – for a price
label: Motorsport
content: F1 Experiences offers a range of race week offerings for all 24 races in the calendar year, with the goal of bringing fans as close to the action as possible.

title: Iron Maiden frontman Bruce Dickinson finishes 13th in prestigious fencing tournament
label: Olympics
content: Bruce Dickinson, frontman of Iron Maiden, has participated in a fencing tournament in northern France. The singer came 13th out of 31 competitors in the veterans category.

title: A new home for Lewis Hamilton and can anyone stop Max Verstappen? Everything you need to know about the 2025 F1 season
label: Motorsport
content: The new season of Formula One begins with Sundays Australian Grand Prix and ends in Abu Dhabi in December. Lewis Hamiltons move from Mercedes to Ferrari is the biggest storyline ahead of the new season.

title: 18-year-old prodigy Andrea Kimi Antonelli passes driving test weeks before Formula One debut
label: Motorsport
content: Rising star Andrea Kimi Antonelli, who is set to replace Lewis Hamilton at Mercedes, has passed his driving test ahead of his Formula One debut. The 18-year-old will be in action at the Australian Grand Prix.

title: Inside the ‘brutal’ logistical challenge of staging a Formula One Grand Prix
label: Motorsport
content: It takes thousands of hours of hard work and meticulous planning to transport the Formula One circus – comprising some 4,000 people and 50 tons of freight per team – to each of the 24 races, around the world in a matter of days.

title: Celtics’ Derrick White has teeth glued back in after taking hit vs 76ers
label: US Sports
content: Boston Celtics guard Derrick White was injured Thursday night after an inadvertent elbow caused him to lose a tooth, but he was able to continue playing and contribute to the teams victory. This is not the first time White has lost a tooth while competing for the Celtics.

title: Normani and NFL player DK Metcalf are engaged
label: US Sports
content: DK Metcalf, a newly acquired wide receiver for the Pittsburgh Steelers, just scored both on and off the field. The NFL player announced at a press conference that he is now engaged to singer Normani, who he reportedly proposed to in Houston while both their families were in town.

title: Olympic kite surfer Bruno Lobo rescues drowning woman at sea
label: Olympics
content: While kite surfing, Bruno Lobo rescued a drowning woman from the ocean. Lobo, an Olympic athlete, used his kite surfing equipment to get the woman to safety where lifeguards could help her. The woman expressed her gratitude to Lobo in the comments of his Instagram post. Lobo warned of the dangers of strong currents and urged people to be cautious near bodies of water.

title: Max Verstappen wins fourth straight World Championship as George Russell takes victory in Las Vegas
label: Motorsport
content: Max Verstappen claimed his fourth consecutive Formula One World Drivers Championship at the Las Vegas Grand Prix on Sunday, with George Russell taking victory for Mercedes.

title: Paralympic medalists receive hundreds of thousands of dollars less than Olympic medalists
label: Olympics
content: Many gold medalists from this years Paralympics in Paris will be enjoying vast bonuses and gifts in reward for their athletic achievements.

title: ‘I lost all respect’: Max Verstappen furious with George Russell after qualifying incident at Qatar Grand Prix
label: Motorsport
content: Max Verstappen won the Qatar Grand Prix, despite being in a sour mood after accusing George Russell of Mercedes of trying to "screw him over" after a slow driving penalty resulted in a one place grid penalty.

title: CNN announces about 200 layoffs as it attempts to modernize business
label: media
content: CNN CEO Mark Thompson announced the cuts in a staff memo, confirming previous reports by CNBC. The company plans to invest $70 million in new digital plans and hire 100 workers for digital product and journalism roles.

title: The U.S. is appointing an 'affordability czar' — here’s what that means for you
label: personal-finance
content: President Donald Trump vowed to make America affordable again, but steep tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China are expected to raise prices for consumers. Heres how to safeguard your own budget.

title: 'Buy European': Airbus and others call for sovereign fund and higher Europe tech autonomy
label: defense
content: More than 90 European companies and lobby groups have called on the European Commission to increase public investment and bolster the regions autonomy in the tech sector. The letter stated that Europe is in a laggard position in the digital space and will have a near-complete reliance on non-European technologies within three years. The request was for the creation of a sovereign infrastructure fund to assist in capital-intensive projects such as quantum and chips.

title: Why uncertainty makes the stock market go haywire
label: finance
content: Investors are grappling with uncertainty around trade policy, the economy and the stock market. Heres how to cope.

title: This psychological ‘booster’ could help people resist misinformation, a new study finds
label: sports
content: Misinformation training can be an effective tool for helping people identify and reject fake news in as little as one month, according to a new study.

title: Arctic blast brings widespread snow, frigid temperatures across U.S., with 175 million under cold weather alerts
label: climate
content: More than 175 million people are under some form of a winter weather alert as a potentially historic snowstorm nears Houston and travels east and a second storm brings snow and rain to the Northeast.

title: China retaliates with additional tariffs of up to 15% on some U.S. goods
label: china-markets
content: Chinas finance and commerce ministries announced additional tariffs on some U.S. goods and restrictions on exports to U.S. companies in response to new U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods. The U.S. duties took effect Tuesday and bring the total amount of new tariffs imposed in about a month to 20%.

title: Starting the day with a healthy breakfast is becoming a pricey luxury
label: economy
content: Consumers are changing their coffee and breakfast buying habits as prices for both climb to record highs and show no signs of stopping.

title: Most of the S&P 500 is in correction territory as benchmark nears milestone
label: finance
content: More than two-thirds of stocks in the S&P 500 are already in correction territory as the sell-off on Wall Street continues to drag the benchmark closer to that key threshold.

title: Powell says central bank awaiting 'greater clarity' on Trump policies before next move
label: finance
content: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the central bank can wait to see how President Donald Trumps aggressive policy actions play out before it moves again on interest rates.

title: Amgen starts two critical late-stage trials for weight loss drug MariTide
label: health-and-science
content: Amgens experimental weight loss injection Maritide is undergoing two critical late-stage trials to enter the booming obesity drug market. A monthly injection, Maritide could compete against existing drugs from Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly, which are weekly injectables. Around 6% of US adults are already using GLP-1s, a hormone produced in the gut to tamp down appetite and regulate blood sugar.

title: Singapore is aging fast. It hopes AI can help manage its elderly care
label: health-and-science
content: As the population ages, Singapore is turning to artificial intelligence to help manage the health of its elderly population, with technology seen as a potential paradigm shift in healthcare, helping to fill the care gap. By 2030, a quarter of Singaporeans will be 65 or older, with technology able to assist caregivers and help seniors stay independent and age in place. However, developers have been urged to ensure that older people participate in the design of new technology to avoid replicating biases held by society, and ensuring the elderly are on board with any new initiatives.

title: Ex-Facebook engineer tackles clinician burnout at Freed after seeing wife's challenges
label: health-and-science
content: Freed has built an AI scribe for doctors that automates the clinical notetaking process in real time, helping doctors to spend more time with their patients and cutting down on administrative tasks. The company has just announced a $30m funding round led by Sequoia Capital.

title: Richard Parsons, former Time Warner CEO, dies at age 76
label: media
content: Richard Parsons, who helped Time Warner divorce from AOL after what was considered one of the worst takeovers in history, has died at age 76. He became CEO of AOL Time Warner in 2002, replacing Gerald Levin.

title: David Sacks sold $200 million in crypto holdings before joining White House: ethics memo
label: energy
content: David Sacks, the Trump administrations AI and crypto czar, sold over $200 million worth of digital asset-related investments before starting the job, according to a memo from the White House.

title: Europe's battle for power sparks new ecosystem for energy-hungry firms
label: energy
content: Businesses are facing five to eight year wait times to connect to Europes ageing and strained electricity grids, as the emergence of new areas of demand drives an unprecedented rise in permit requests for power.

title: NTSB calls for permanent helicopter restrictions by DCA after crash
label: transportation
content: The agency is calling on the FAA to prohibit helicopter flights in certain areas to avoid midair collisions with planes arriving at the airport.

title: With the CFPB weakened, could risky lending make a comeback?
label: sports
content: The Trump administration has severely limited operations of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, the agency tasked with ensuring financial companies treat consumers fairly. Though the agency is hobbled, experts say Americans are still safer from a repeat of the 2008 financial crisis.

label: etf-street
content: Big banks and small cap stocks could see a boost under the Trump administration, according to experts. Banks could see a boost from deregulation while small caps could be largely sheltered from threats of reshoring and tariffs.

title: Workday beats estimates for revenue and profit, stock jumps
label: enterprise
content: Workday posted better-than-expected quarterly results, thanks to rising demand for its artificial intelligence tools.

title: 'America is not Canada,' new Prime Minister Mark Carney says in rebuke to Trump
label: white-house
content: Canadas new prime minister has firmly rebuffed U.S. President Donald Trumps suggestion that Canada could become Americas 51st state, saying: We will never, ever, in any way, shape or form, be part of the United States.

title: Trump draws anger for praising police after he pardoned Jan. 6 rioters
label: congress
content: Trumps former political opponents and allies have taken to social media to criticise the ex-president for his recent pardoning of Jan. 6 U.S. Capitol rioters and his remarks on law and order.

title: As U.S. officials arrive in Moscow, the Kremlin could struggle to evade a truce
label: europe-politics
content: Russia is under pressure to agree to a 30-day ceasefire and show its serious about ending the war against Ukraine, with US President Donald Trump hinting more sanctions could be imposed if it doesnt.

title: China’s exports growth slows sharply at the start of 2025 as U.S. tariffs weigh
label: china-politics
content: Chinas exports growth slowed in the first two months of the year, while imports plunged, as a lacklustre domestic demand and US tariffs challenge Beijings bid to bolster sluggish growth, data showed Friday.

title: South Korea’s ex-defense minister attempts suicide; police raid president office
label: asia-politics
content: Police have raided the office of South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol as part of an investigation into his imposition of martial law last week. The president has faced calls for his removal and a vote to impeach him is expected tomorrow. His former defence minister has been detained on insurrection charges and reportedly attempted suicide.

title: South Korea’s markets power through troubles
label: asia-politics
content: Heres what you need to know about Fridays markets, including the U.S. nonfarm payrolls report for December and a look at South Koreas market reaction to recent events.

title: Germany's conservatives win election as far-right AfD leaps to second place, exit polls show
label: world-politics
content: The CDU-CSU alliance of Chancellor Olaf Scholzs center-right rivals appeared to have won the largest share of votes, according to exit polls.

title: Women's pro tennis introduces paid maternity leave funded by Saudi PIF
label: retail
content: The Womens Tennis Association and Saudi Arabian investment fund have launched a programme of benefits including paid maternity leave and grants for fertility treatments. Critics point to Saudi Arabias history of human rights abuses while supporters say the move will bring it in line with other womens sports.

title: Macy's strategy to revamp some stores, close others appears to be working
label: retail
content: Macys delivered another quarter of mixed results on Thursday as investors wait and see how quickly CEO Tony Spring can pull off a turnaround of the business with yet another activist investor looking to take the chain private.

title: Target to expand online sales as it aims for $15 billion in sales growth by 2030
label: retail
content: Target is looking to third-party marketplace, media network and same day delivery services to drive more than $15bn in revenue growth over the next five years. The big-box retailers plans to grow its business and better compete against rivals like Walmart and Amazon come as Target finds itself in a rough patch, struggling to grow sales of high-margin discretionary merchandise and reclaim its competitive advantage.

title: Roberta Flack, Grammy-winning singer of 'Killing Me Softly with His Song,' dies at 88
label: life
content: Singer Roberta Flack, who won Grammy awards for The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face and Killing Me Softly, among other songs, died on Monday at age 88.

title: Small business optimism hits 11-year low as inflation fears won't go away
label: small-business
content: Small business confidence fell to the lowest since 2012 as a quarter of respondents cited inflation as their biggest problem, even as other indicators show inflation receding.

title: Florida judge denies Pulitzer Board’s bid to stay defamation lawsuit from Trump
label: sports
content: A Florida judge denied the Pulitzer Boards request to pause a defamation lawsuit from Donald Trump until he is out of office, despite arguments that it would interfere with his presidential duties.

label: sports
content: The US economy appeared to be growing at a solid pace. Now, recession fears are seemingly everywhere. Heres how we got here.

title: Singapore's is expensive. So it's using a different playbook to attract visitors
label: life
content: Singapores tourism industry is facing increased competition from other Southeast Asian cities, as it moves away from budget tourism. With costs high for retail and leisure activities, the city-state is increasingly reliant on attracting visitors to world-class attractions such as Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands. Singapore attracted 16.5m overseas visitors in 2024, an increase of 21% from 2023, according to the Singapore Tourism Board.
