label: etf-street
content: A newly launched ETF is raising questions about the SECs oversight of listings after regulators ordered State Street to make a number of changes to the fund.

title: Market volatility creating buzz for these two types of ETFs
label: etf-street
content: Leveraged and inverse ETFs that allow investors to make big bets on market direction are gaining in popularity, Direxion CEO says. Market volatility and frequent market-moving headlines are fueling demand for these products, he says.

title: MongoDB shares sink after company issues weak guidance
label: earnings
content: MongoDB issued disappointing guidance, sending shares down 16% in after-hours trading. The company reported $15.8 million in net income, or 19 cents per share, for its fourth quarter, compared to a net loss of $55.5 million last year.

title: The foundation of modern software development is under rising cyber attack
label: cybersecurity
content: Organisations are witnessing a rise in cybersecurity attacks on application programming interfaces (APIs), which allow software components to communicate. However, many companies are unprepared to defend against such assaults, with many unable to identify APIs that return sensitive data, and the cost of remediating API incidents averaging $591,400 in the US.

title: Google's DeepMind says it will use AI models to power physical robots
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: The tech giant has unveiled two new AI models which it said would help robots adapt to different situations, respond to instructions and manipulate objects. Google will partner with Texas-based robotics firm Apptronik to develop robots which can follow spoken commands.

title: Autodesk says it will cut 1,350 employees to make the most of sales changes
label: enterprise
content: The software maker said it would lay off roughly 9% of its workers following a series of headcount reductions across the tech industry.

title: AI startup Baseten raises $75 million following DeepSeek's emergence
label: enterprise
content: San Francisco-based startup Baseten, which runs AI models for clients on cloud infrastructure, has raised $75m in a funding round that values the company at $825m. The funding demonstrates that venture capitalists believe many startups will benefit from the AI boom, rather than just those building large language models. Basetens offering helps companies deploy their models and provides access to more GPUs than a single clouds supply.

title: AppLovin short-seller urges exclusion of the stock from S&P 500 index
label: internet
content: Fuzzy Panda Research is urging the S&P Index Committee to keep AppLovins stock out of the benchmark index, saying the ad-tech companys recent revenue growth has been based in data theft, revenue fraud.

title: So long, Trump bump: Tech stocks wipe out last of post-election gains
label: mobile
content: The Nasdaq has wiped out all of its post-election gains amid rising concerns over tariffs, weaker job numbers and a potential cooling in the AI market.

title: Trump Media sues Brazil Supreme Court justice who once crossed Musk
label: social-media
content: Trump Media and fellow conservative-oriented social media company Rumble on Wednesday sued a Brazilian Supreme Court justice whose clash last year with Elon Musk led to the blocking of Musks own social media firm, X, in that country.

title: Neuralink rival Synchron lets patients control Apple Vision Pro with their mind
label: tech-guide
content: Neurotech firm Synchron has announced that it has connected its brain implant to Apples Vision Pro headset, allowing patients with limited mobility to control the device using their thoughts. Synchron is developing a brain-computer interface to help paralysed patients operate technology such as smartphones and computers. The company has implanted its device in six patients in the US and four in Australia but requires FDA approval to commercialise its technology more broadly.

title: Apple $3,499 Vision Pro headset now available to order ahead of Feb. 2 release
label: tech-guide
content: Apples $3,499 Vision Pro virtual reality headset is now available for pre-order in the U.S., ahead of its official Feb. 2 release date.

title: Trump's World Liberty Financial crypto project says it sold $550 million in tokens
label: energy
content: President Trumps crypto banking platform WLFI announced it raised $250 million in its second token sale, bringing the total amount of coins sold to $550 million, and claiming more than 85,000 participants.

title: Harvard announces free tuition for families making under $200K annually
label: personal-finance
content: Harvard University will offer free tuition to students from families earning less than $200,000 and free tuition, food, housing, insurance and travel expenses for students from families earning less than $100,000. The scheme starts in the 2025-26 academic year.

title: This retirement strategy a 'game changer' for married couples, advisor says
label: personal-finance
content: A lesser-known retirement strategy, spousal individual retirement accounts, can help boost retirement savings for couples in single-income households. Roth or traditional IRAs are set up in the name of the non-working spouse.

title: CrowdStrike slumps more than 6% on weak earnings outlook, overhang from outage costs
label: earnings
content: CrowdStrike shares dropped on weak earnings guidance. The company also said it expects to take another $73 million in expenses due to the global IT outage that rattled businesses in July.

title: What Trump's Department of Education dismantle means for the future of AI in schools
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Public schools in the US, which educate around 50m students, face an uncertain future due to the Trump administrations plans to dismantle the Department of Education and reduce federal support for education. Some 13% of a schools overall funding comes from the federal government, and educators and learners are having to find ways to fill the gap, with many turning to AI tools such as OpenAIs ChatGPT. While some see the potential for AI to reduce teachers burdens, others are skeptical, pointing out that even the most advanced software needs human interaction to get the best results.

title: Asana CEO Dustin Moskovitz announces retirement, stock plummets 25%
label: internet
content: Asana CEO Dustin Moskovitz will step down from his role and transition to the chair position once the company finds a new CEO, according to an announcement on Monday. Moskovitz is one of the original founders of Facebook.

title: Trump puts new limits on Elon Musk's authority amid backlash to DOGE cuts
label: white-house
content: President Trump said he instructed Cabinet members to work alongside the Department of Government Efficiency on spending and workforce reductions, but that final job cuts will be at the discretion of the department leaders.

title: Ontario's Ford suspends U.S. electric surcharge, will join bilateral trade talks
label: white-house
content: Ontario Premier Doug Ford said he has agreed to temporarily suspend a planned 25% surcharge on electricity exported to the U.S. after a conversation with Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick.

title: Volkswagen and Stellantis evade Trump's 25% tariffs, while BMW braces for impact
label: policy
content: Volkswagen and Stellantis vehicles made in North America will be exempt from U.S. President Donald Trumps newly rolled out 25% tariffs, while BMW faces levies as European car manufacturers grapple with new trade rules.

title: USDA eliminates two food safety advisory committees
label: policy
content: Two key advisory committees have been eliminated by the US Department of Agriculture, prompting concerns about government oversight of food safety. The National Advisory Committee on Microbiological Criteria for Foods and the National Advisory Committee on Meat and Poultry Inspection have both been disbanded.

title: Mystery surrounds DOGE acting administrator Amy Gleason
label: white-house
content: Amy Gleason, a former ER nurse turned health care technologist, was scared. It was 2010 and no doctor could figure out what was behind her daughter Morgans strange symptoms.

title: South Korean defense stocks track gains in global peers amid rising security concerns
label: defense
content: Defense stocks in South Korea surged on expectations of higher defense spending by Europe, as the Russia-Ukraine war fuels security concerns.

title: Thales CEO presses for Europe defense spending to stay in the region
label: defense
content: Europe needs to take its defense into its own hands and not rely on other countries, according to Patrice Caine, CEO of French defense company Thales. The European Union is looking to spend as much as €840bn ($841bn) on defense, with Caine hoping his company will be a beneficiary of some of that money. Caine said that Europe should follow the examples of countries such as the US and Australia, who are also completely self-sufficient when it comes to defense.

title: Trump lawyer Habba on fired veterans: 'Perhaps they're not fit to have a job'
label: congress
content: President Donald Trumps top lawyer, Alina Habba, suggests some veterans fired from federal government jobs are not capable or willing to work, questioning the spending of taxpayer dollars on those who dont work.

title: Senate votes to confirm Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as health secretary
label: congress
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., a longtime anti-vaccine activist, was confirmed Thursday to lead the countrys most powerful health care agency in a mostly party-line vote.

title: They fought for the Social Security Fairness Act. Now they wait for extra benefits
label: congress
content: A new law, the Social Security Fairness Act, removes a pension offset that reduced Social Security benefits for individuals who receive pension income based on work where employers were not required to withhold Social Security payroll taxes.

title: Trump could scale back Canada, Mexico tariffs Wednesday, Lutnick says
label: congress
content: The US president will probably announce a scaling back of tariffs on imports from Mexico and Canada, according to Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. Lutnick said the president was being reasonable and would meet the countries in the middle. The announcement is expected as soon as Wednesday.

title: EU chief proposes plan to hike defense spending by mobilizing around $840 billion
label: europe-politics
content: The president of the European Commission said the EU should spend more on defence and take on more responsibility for its own security. The proposed ReArm Europe Plan would see the issuing of loans to member states to invest in capabilities such as missile defence.

title: A global tax turf war between Trump and U.S. allies is brewing
label: congress
content: The Trump administration is taking a stance against global tax statutes that seek tax payments from firms that operate in multiple jurisdictions, including the U.S., if those entities come in under a 15% net effective income tax rate paid.

title: We 'must act,' Europe says, retaliating against Trump's latest tariffs
label: europe-politics
content: The EU has retaliated against the Trump administrations 25% steel and aluminium tariffs, imposing counter-tariffs on €26bn of US goods. The EU has said the tariffs will affect up to €26bn of the blocs exports to the US, and will apply to industrial-grade steel and aluminium, and derivative products. The EUs two-pronged approach will also see previously suspended tariffs reimposed on €8bn of US exports.

title: China kicks off annual parliamentary meeting as investors watch for clues on economic policy
label: china-politics
content: Chinas annual parliamentary Two Sessions event begins in Beijing this week, as the US threatens more tariffs on Chinese imports. China has vowed to fight back.

title: Tech execs say DeepSeek ramps up China-U.S. competition but won't hurt OpenAI
label: china-politics
content: Chinese artificial intelligence lab DeepSeeks recent advances have shown the US-Sino competition in AI is heating up, top executives told CNBC. Though critics point to apparent censorship by DeepSeeks AI model, and some question the companys costs, leaders of major tech companies agree China has narrowed the gap in the global AI race.

title: South Korea impeaches acting President Han Duck-soo, deepening political turmoil
label: asia-politics
content: South Koreas acting president, Han Duck-soo, has been impeached by the countrys lawmakers, just two weeks after predecessor Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached himself. The acting presidents impeachment is a result of his reluctance to appoint three justices to the countrys Constitutional Court. The court will decide whether to uphold Yoons impeachment or reinstate him.

title: South Korea's mint is grappling with a gold bar shortage amid supply constraints
label: asia-politics
content: South Koreas state-run mint has suspended sales of gold bars due to a shortage of the precious metal, with vending machines in Seoul also selling out of gold bars as individuals look to protect their wealth. Demand for gold in South Korea has surged due to domestic political turmoil and fears over the impact of US President Donald Trumps tariffs on the country.

title: Surprise RBI governor pick could pave the way for India rate cut as soon as February, economists say
label: asia-politics
content: Capital Economics and Citi now expect a rate cut early next year after the appointment of a new Reserve Bank of India governor, who they expect to be more dovish than his predecessor.

title: Undersea cable cuts in the Baltic Sea are stoking geopolitical tensions — here's what's going on
label: asia-politics
content: Two key subsea cables in the Baltic Sea were severed, prompting warnings of sabotage and a potential hybrid warfare targeting the West amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Heres what you need to know.

title: Trump says Palestinians wouldn't be allowed back into Gaza under his plan
label: world-politics
content: The president said in a pre-taped interview that his plan to take ownership of the territory includes no right of return for Palestinians.

label: options-action

label: health-and-science

label: energy

title: ETFs will soon beat mutual funds among financial advisor holdings, report finds
label: etf-street
content: Financial advisers will allocate more client assets to ETFs than to mutual funds by 2026, a report says. ETFs have seen steady growth since the early 1990s, and advisers cite their tax advantages as well as their lower fees and liquidity as reasons for their popularity. Currently, mutual funds make up 28.7% of client assets, while ETFs account for 21.6%.

title: João Lucas Reis da Silva, the only openly gay player in men’s tennis, drew ‘strength’ from response to selfie with boyfriend
label: sports
content: After coming out in a social media post, João Lucas Reis da Silva says he was uplifted by the supportive reaction of others, and it gave him strength on the court.

title: Trump says there will be no exemptions from steel and aluminum tariffs
label: sports
content: President Donald Trump has said he will not be creating exemptions from steel and aluminium tariffs and that additional sectoral, as well as reciprocal tariffs will be imposed on April 2.

title: Trump reverses new tariffs threat on Canada after Ontario rescinds electricity charges
label: sports
content: President Donald Trump backed down from an extraordinary trade war escalation Tuesday that had threatened a massive surge in tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum and new tariffs on Canadian electricity.

title: Snapchat’s new AI chatbot is already raising alarms among teens and parents
label: Tech
content: Parents and some Snapchat users are concerned about the potential dangers of the apps new AI chatbot, which is powered by ChatGPT and cannot be removed from chat feeds unless users subscribe to Snapchat+. Some are calling for stricter regulations around AI.

title: Alibaba launches DeepSeek rival, sending stock surging
label: Tech
content: Alibaba has unveiled its latest AI model, which it claims outperforms those of rivals OpenAI and DeepSeek. The news sent Alibabas Hong Kong-listed shares up by more than 8% and buoyed the Hang Sengs China Enterprises Index. The Chinese company said its next-generation model has a "qualitative leap" in capabilities and can match the performance of DeepSeeks models.

title: Trump administration touts deportations under Alien Enemies Act after a judge temporarily blocked its use
label: white-house
content: The Trump administration said it deported nearly 300 members of a Venezuelan gang to El Salvador after a judge temporarily blocked the effort on Saturday. A judges order only applied to those who had not yet been deported.

title: Stock pickers are on record run with investors. Don't be fooled: Index fund guru
label: etf-street
content: Stock picking looks easy, but the numbers prove it isnt. S&P Global reports that after one year, 73% of active managers underperform their benchmarks. After five years, 95.5% of active managers miss the mark. After 15 years, nobody outperforms. Thats not going to change.

title: Analysts defend Capital One stock after Monday's selloff. Here's where we stand
label: finance
content: Analysts defend Capital One stock after Mondays selloff. Heres where we stand

title: Oracle's federal electronic health record experienced a nationwide outage
label: health-and-science
content: The Department of Veterans Affairs confirmed that all users of Oracles Federal EHR experienced a outage on Tuesday, impacting several VA facilities.

title: Eli Lilly offering additional cheaper doses of Zepbound weight loss drug
label: health-and-science
content: Eli Lilly is now offering higher doses of its weight loss drug Zepbound in single-dose vials through its website, LillyDirect, for eligible patients to buy and have shipped to their homes.

title: 23andMe special committee again rejects CEO Wojcicki's take-private offer
label: health-and-science
content: The special committee of independent directors at 23andMe rejected CEO Anne Wojcickis proposal to take the genetic testing company private, according to a release.

title: WBD adds 6.4 million Max subscribers, forecasts 150 million subs by end of 2026
label: media
content: Warner Bros. Discovery said Thursday it added 6.4 million global streaming subscribers in the fourth quarter for a total of 116.9 million subscribers.

title: MSG Networks goes dark for Altice USA's Optimum cable customers
label: media
content: Cable TV operator Altice USAs Optimum service lost the regional sports networks MSG Networks due to a carriage dispute. The disagreement led to New York Knicks, New York Rangers, New York Islanders, and New Jersey Devils fans losing access to games.

title: Disney earnings offer hope that streaming can successfully supplant linear TV
label: media
content: Disneys streaming platforms are set to generate enough income to offset linear TV declines. The company predicts its streaming divisions will produce over $1bn in operating income for fiscal year 2025.

title: Disney stock surges on streaming growth, guidance
label: media
content: The streaming business growth and profitability — combined with a blockbuster summer at the box office and further investments in the companys theme parks business — comes during a time of turmoil across the media industry.

title: Economist: This step is ‘really important’ if you plan to sell your home in 2025
label: real-estate
content: Getting the asking price right when selling a house is crucial, according to Joel Berner, a senior economist at Realtor.com, to avoid the property sitting on the market for too long, eventually requiring a price cut. Homes that are well priced and marketed tend to sell within weeks, while those that miss the mark can linger for two months or more, he added.

title: Watch Constellation Energy CEO speak about push to restart Three Mile Island
label: energy
content: Constellation Energy CEO Joseph Dominguez is among the speakers at a major energy conference in Houston, as the company pushes to restart the shuttered Three Mile Island nuclear plant.

title: Companies should stick to ESG and DEI commitments, says incoming DBS CEO
label: climate
content: The incoming CEO of Singapores DBS bank has urged firms to stick to commitments to ESG and DEI initiatives, saying leadership was about responsibility not saying one thing and doing another.

title: UN delivers U.S. warning after Trump withdraws from the Paris Agreement — again
label: climate
content: The U.S. presidents pledge to withdraw from the Paris climate agreement paves the way for other countries to take the lead in combating climate change, the United Nations top climate official says.

title: Porsche CEO says Volkswagen ties 'should play a role' amid U.S. tariff threat
label: transportation
content: Porsches CEO says the company could lean on its partnership with Volkswagen, which has its own U.S. manufacturing base, as it braces for potential tariffs imposed by the White House.

title: Wholesale price measure was flat in February, compared with expected increase
label: economy
content: Wholesale prices were flat in February, the Bureau of Labor Statistics said Thursday, providing some welcome news on inflation amid tariff fears.

title: Apple unveils new MacBook Air models with $100 price cut despite tariffs
label: mobile
content: Apple has cut the price of its MacBook Air laptops in the US, despite tariffs on electronic products which have increased the cost of production. The 13-inch MacBook Air now starts at $999, down from $1,099, while the larger 15-inch model starts at $1,099, down from $1,299. The new machines will go on sale on 12 March.

title: Musk praises Bezos' new rules for Washington Post opinion pages as top editor resigns
label: social-media
content: Jeff Bezos said Wednesday the Washington Posts opinion section will be dedicated to supporting personal liberties and free markets and will not publish views that oppose those ideas.

title: Neuralink competitor Paradromics secures investment from Saudi Arabia's Neom
label: social-media
content: Neom, a Saudi Arabian hub for innovation, has partnered with Paradromics, a Texas-based neurotech startup that is developing a brain-computer interface. The partnership will establish a Brain-Computer Interface Centre of Excellence in the region to advance the development of BCI-based therapies, according to a company statement. Paradromics is developing an implantable system designed to help patients with paralysis regain communication abilities.

title: UiPath to lay off 10% of workforce in companywide restructuring
label: tech-guide
content: The company, which makes software that automates repetitive tasks, is laying off about 420 workers, or 10% of its workforce, as part of a restructuring.

title: Apple releases first preview of its long-awaited iPhone AI
label: tech-guide
content: Apple has released the first version of Apple Intelligence, which includes a suite of AI features that will improve Siri, generate emails and images, and sort notifications. Its currently available for developers to test.

title: Apple Intelligence on your iPhone probably requires an upgrade
label: tech-guide
content: Apples new AI offering, Apple Intelligence, will only be available on the newest iPhones, driving customers to upgrade to the iPhone 15 and 15 Pro Max.

title: Apple Analyst Kuo says Series 10 Watch to include larger screen, thinner design
label: tech-guide
content: Apples next watch, the Series 10, will be thinner and have a larger screen, according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, with components made using 3D printing. The watch is expected to be released in September.

title: Apple execs explain why its AI is different from competitors
label: tech-guide
content: Apples focus is on AI for its devices, using personal data to improve user experience without storing or reusing it. Its approach is to have a series of different models and different sizes for different use cases, with a 3-billion parameter model compared to ChatGPTs 175-billion parameter model, which requires more memory and computing power. It is faster and more private than cloud-based options and will enable users to generate new emojis using AI without connecting to the internet.

title: White House: Stock market plunge is not as 'meaningful' as business activity
label: white-house
content: The White House on Monday downplayed the stock markets sell-off, insisting that recent moves by business leaders suggest a brighter outlook for the U.S. economy.

title: Musk's X to pay about $10M to settle Trump lawsuit over account suspension
label: social-media
content: Trump sued the social media company, then known as Twitter, for deplatforming his account following the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot and the company has agreed to pay $10 million to settle the lawsuit.

title: Senate passes GOP funding bill to avert a government shutdown
label: policy
content: The Senate passed a stopgap funding bill Friday, averting a government shutdown later in the evening. Ten Democrats helped the GOP pass the bill in a procedural vote, but only two supported the final passage.

title: USDA cuts over $1 billion in funding for schools, local food purchases
label: policy
content: The US Agriculture Department has cut two federal schemes designed to boost local food production, representing a blow to farmers and foodbanks.

title: Trump's quest to conquer Canada is confusing everyone
label: white-house
content: President Trump has made clear he wants to redraw the U.S.-Canada border, and a top Canadian official says hes pushing for wholesale annexation of the country. The U.S.s northern neighbor isnt taking the threat lightly.

title: Speaker Johnson says Zelenskyy may have to resign after fiery Oval Office meeting
label: congress
content: Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., said on NBCs Meet the Press that Ukrainian President Volodomyr Zelenskyy needs to come to his senses and negotiate a peace deal with Russia.

title: The pivotal February jobs report is out Friday. Here's what to expect
label: economy
content: A series of recent surveys indicate workers are increasingly uncertain about their employment status, while job hunters say its getting harder to find positions.

title: Weekly mortgage demand surges 20% higher, after interest rates drop to the lowest since last year
label: real-estate
content: Mortgage applications jumped 20.4% last week, as interest rates declined to the lowest level since December 2024, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association.

title: Spirit, fresh from bankruptcy, is ready to take on the new Southwest, CEO says
label: transportation
content: The budget airline has exited bankruptcy, after a crippling few years, and is ready to take on competitors, its CEO says. One of those competitors is about to make a huge strategy shift, and Spirit could possibly win over customers, its CEO says.

title: Despite DOGE, Trump's agenda calls for adding trillions of dollars to U.S. debt
label: congress
content: Budget experts say that even if Trump succeeds at slashing the spending that his Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency is targeting, his policies would still add to the deficit.

title: Senate adopts $340 billion budget blueprint for Trump's agenda after marathon 'vote-a-rama'
label: congress
content: The Republican-controlled Senate has adopted a $340 billion budget blueprint designed to boost funding for President Donald Trumps immigration enforcement efforts, energy production and the military.

title: Moscow under pressure to act after U.S. and Ukraine unite over ceasefire deal
label: europe-politics
content: Russia has given a cautious response to the proposed ceasefire agreement, with Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov stating that Russia would need to hear more details from US negotiators before coming to a decision. The ball is now in Russias court, with analysts noting that Putin faces a quandary in how to respond.

title: Trump praises President Xi, says he looks forward to 'getting along with China'
label: asia-politics
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he has always had a great relationship with Chinese President Xi Jinping and that he looks forward to getting along with China.

title: South Korea's President Yoon impeached after failed martial law move
label: asia-politics
content: South Koreas President Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached on Saturday, after his failed attempt to impose martial law in early December. A presidential election must be held within 60 days.

title: South Korean president defies arrest in standoff with officials over martial law order
label: asia-politics
content: South Korean authorities tried and failed to execute an arrest warrant for embattled President Yoon Suk Yeol over his martial law declaration. Thousands of police officers arrived at the presidents residence but were blocked by his security detail.

title: Canada, Mexico, China and the EU respond to Trump's tariffs
label: asia-politics
content: Heres how Canada, Mexico and China have responded to U.S. President Donald Trumps imposition of tariffs on imports from the three countries.

title: Trump administration ends extension of Haiti's temporary protected status
label: world-politics
content: The Trump administration on Thursday canceled an extension of Temporary Protected Status for Haitians, the latest move targeting the form of immigration relief for people coming from countries facing political upheaval and natural disasters.

title: Trump threatens to slap 25% tariffs on EU, says bloc formed 'to screw' the U.S.
label: world-politics
content: U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to impose tariffs on EU imports, saying the bloc was formed to undermine the U.S. The EU, in response, pledged to react firmly and noted its huge trade surplus with the U.S.

title: How 3D-printing 'microfactories' can transform plastic waste into brand new products
label: energy
content: Manufacturers must direct their thinking around sustainability toward profitability, says Veena Sahajwalla, professor and founding director of UNSW Sustainable Materials Research and Technology (SMaRT) Centre. Manufacturers are turning to 3D printing microfactories that use waste plastics to produce products suitable for the construction industry, such as building blocks. The process is cheap and sustainable, and could be used to 3D print a wide range of products.

title: Women’s elite sports revenues to surpass $2.35 billion globally, Deloitte reports, yet imbalances persist
label: sports
content: Womens elite sports revenues are set to reach a record $2.35bn this year, more than triple the market size in 2022, according to a report by Deloitte, with basketball and soccer set to be the highest revenue-generating sports.

title: Atlanta Drive beat The Bay to set up clash against New York Golf Club in inaugural TGL Finals
label: sports
content: The Atlanta Drive set up a finals clash with the New York Golf Club after beating The Bay Golf Club on Tuesday.

title: ‘This is baseball country’: MLB season gets underway in Japan as national hero Shohei Ohtani inspires Dodgers’ win over Cubs
label: sports
content: Baseball fever swept through Tokyo as fans gathered at the Tokyo Dome to see the Los Angeles Dodgers take on the Chicago Cubs. Thousands turned out to see three-time MVP Shohei Ohtani in action.

title: Outgoing IOC President Thomas Bach on Trump, trans athletes, Putin and the role of the Olympics in a divided world
label: sports
content: Thomas Bach, president of the International Olympic Committee, told CNN he is "very confident" that the 2028 Summer Games in Los Angeles will be supported by President Donald Trump -- and that the American people will welcome athletes, regardless of their background.

title: Katherine Legge never set out to be a role model, but now she says she has a point to prove in NASCAR
label: sports
content: British driver Katherine Legge made her NASCAR Cup Series debut on Sunday for Live Fast Motorsports but a mid-race crash ended her chances of a finish. The 44-year-old Legge, who had limited stock car experience, said she was disappointed with the result but had received support from other drivers.

title: The electric car revolution is on track, says IEA
label: sports
content: Sales of electric vehicles are set to rise by more than a fifth to hit 17m this year, according to a new report by the International Energy Agency, with the agency predicting that half of all cars sold globally will be electric by 2035.

title: Stagflation? Fed sees higher inflation and an economy growing by less than 2% this year
label: finance
content: Stagflation? Fed sees higher inflation and an economy growing by less than 2% this year

label: china-markets

title: Watch NASA astronauts return to Earth on SpaceX capsule after months on the ISS
label: transportation
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams are set to splash down on Earth on Tuesday after spending more than nine months in space.

title: Execs willing to pass on higher costs from tariffs to customers, economist says
label: economy
content: Tariffs will likely lead to higher prices on consumer goods, with nearly half of businesses surveyed by EY saying they will pass on two-thirds of the added costs to customers, according to the firms chief economist.

title: Warner Bros. announces restructuring into linear, streaming units
label: media
content: Warner Bros. Discovery has announced a restructuring plan that will see its business segmented into linear and streaming units, in a move that could simplify future consolidation.

title: These are the most competitive rental markets in the U.S.
label: real-estate
content: Despite a record number of new apartments being built last year, a new report has found that rental market competition has actually increased, with landlords offering longer lease periods and increasing the number of applicants for each property.

title: Trump tariff threats are pushing Canada's largest oil producer to break its dependence on the U.S.
label: energy
content: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says her government will look to ship oil and gas to nations other than the US if President Donald Trumps tariff threats are not rescinded. Alberta is Canadas largest producer of oil and gas and around 97% of its exports head to the US. Trump has threatened to impose tariffs on some Canadian exports and paused penalties on energy goods until 2 April.

title: Musk sending Starlink tech to FAA, says without evidence air safety is 'at risk'
label: transportation
content: Elon Musk has claimed that the FAAs air traffic control technology, provided by Verizon and L3Harris, is causing safety risks and is breaking down. The FAA is testing Starlink technology from Musks SpaceX as an alternative. Democrat lawmakers have raised concerns over conflicts of interest.

title: China is tackling weak consumption with child care subsidies
label: finance
content: Chinas potential plan for a 100 billion yuan ($13.8 billion) child care subsidy is a priority to boost consumption, tackle the countrys drop in births and free up cash for discretionary spending, analysts say.

title: Baidu, once China’s generative AI leader, is battling to regain its position
label: china-markets
content: Baidu, once China’s generative AI leader, is battling to regain its position

title: Drone Defense Startup Raises $100 Million From DFJ, Lockheed
label: Startups
content: Drone Defense Startup Raises $100 Million From DFJ, Lockheed

title: Canada flexes economic muscle as tariff negotiations continue
label: economy
content: Canadians are retaliating against U.S. President Donald Trumps threats of tariffs with an unusual show of patriotism, buying domestic goods and avoiding American-made products.

title: Buffett's Berkshire hikes stakes in five Japanese trading houses to almost 10% each
label: finance
content: Warren Buffetts Berkshire Hathaway has increased its stakes in five major Japanese trading houses, according to a regulatory filing, as the billionaire continues to sell U.S. equities.

title: The world isn't breaking free from coal. Demand for it is surging in some places
label: climate
content: Despite a push towards renewables, global coal consumption looks set to remain at similar levels until at least 2027, according to the International Energy Agency. Increasing demand in Asia, including China and India, is counteracting a decline in Europe and the US, with record-high coal capacity and stockpiling in China. However, the IEA has also forecast that global electricity consumption will continue to rise, meaning a shift away from fossil fuels will remain challenging.

title: Don’t let politics ruin your sleep. Use these expert tips instead
label: sports
content: Stress caused by societal upheaval can lead to insomnia. Heres how to get your sleep back on track.

title: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore, Suni Williams return on SpaceX ship
label: transportation
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who had been on the International Space Station since June after a failed Boeing Starliner mission, have returned to Earth.

title: The overseas Apple encryption battle that could be headed to the U.S. next
label: cybersecurity
content: Privacy advocates worry that an iPhone security feature change in the UK could have worldwide ripple effects and strengthen the hand of those who want backdoors to encrypted data.

title: Google to acquire security startup Wiz for $32 billion after deal fell apart last year
label: mobile
content: Google is set to acquire cloud security startup Wiz in a record-breaking $32bn deal, in a move that will bolster the tech giants security capabilities. Googles largest-ever acquisition, the deal is expected to be completed in 2026.

title: They helped start Twitter. They didn’t realize what it would become
label: sports
content: A new CNN docuseries, "Twitter: Breaking the Bird," features the voices of the founders and early employees of the social media giant as it explores the good, bad and ugly of the platforms meteoric rise.

title: Potential cuts to Medicaid could include work requirements. What that could mean
label: personal-finance
content: The Congressional Budget Office said Medicaid cuts will have to be on the menu if House Republicans want to meet their budget goals. Experts say lawmakers may add work requirements for recipients to curb spending. Six in 10 Americans would support such a change, according to a new KFF poll.

title: China to raise defense spending by 7.2% in 2025 to safeguard national security
label: china-markets
content: China increased its defence budget by 7.2% for the third consecutive year as it seeks to firmly safeguard national security, according to an official government report.

title: A big inflation report is on the way Wednesday. Here's what to expect
label: economy
content: The consumer price index for February is due out and is expected to show an increase of 0.3% across the board.

title: Weekly mortgage demand surges 11% higher, as interest rates dropped for the sixth straight week
label: real-estate
content: Mortgage rates dropped to their lowest level since last October, according to data from the Mortgage Bankers Association, pushing demand higher and giving homebuyers more purchasing power heading into the spring season.

title: Communication is key to getting renewable projects off the ground, experts say
label: energy
content: Renewable energy projects often take many years to get off the ground, with the complex nature of preparation needed before an infrastructure project gets underway, put at an average of six years or up to 14 years if not properly planned. Experts say better communication with stakeholders and a focus on the business value of such schemes could speed up the approval process.

title: Trump plan to freeze funding stymies Biden-era energy rebates for consumers
label: energy
content: Some U.S. states have stopped disbursing funds to consumers via Biden-era rebate programs tied to home energy efficiency, due to a Trump administration freeze on federal funding enacted in January.

title: UK backs expansion of London's Heathrow Airport to boost struggling economy
label: climate
content: The U.K. finance minister said a third runway at Heathrow Airport would boost investment and support economic expansion, adding that growth shouldnt come at the expense of net-zero targets.

title: Davos 2025: Conflict, extreme weather and disinformation among top global risks
label: climate
content: Armed conflict, extreme weather and disinformation have been cited as the top three global risks for the year ahead, according to the World Economic Forums (WEF) annual survey. More than 900 global risks experts, policymakers and industry leaders took part in the survey, which also identified environmental concerns, including extreme weather, biodiversity loss and ecosystem collapse, as the most pressing issues over a 10-year time horizon.

title: Lufthansa hopeful Trump administration will spur Boeing deliveries as delays hit bottom line
label: transportation
content: Lufthansa is hopeful that the new U.S. administration will support Boeing in overcoming issues that have led to industry-wide delivery delays, CEO Carsten Spohr said Thursday.

title: Full Video: Rep. Al Green ejected from Trump address to Congress for heckling
label: congress
content: Rep. Al Green, D-Texas was ejected from the House chamber Tuesday night after repeatedly heckling President Donald Trump during his joint session of Congress speech.

title: Trump says the U.S. will take control of Greenland 'one way or the other'
label: europe-politics
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that the U.S. would take control of Greenland one way or the other, escalating months of increasingly aggressive rhetoric toward the Danish territory.

title: Trump tariffs could raise prices on technology like laptops, smartphones and AI
label: asia-politics
content: Nvidia and Foxconn announced plans last year to build a factory in Mexico to produce AI servers. Now, President Trumps proposed blanket tariffs on electronics from Mexico could throw a wrench in those plans.

title: Apple has big expansion plans in India — but Trump's tariffs could change that
label: world-politics
content: Trade talks between the U.S. and India are breaking down ahead of the April 2 deadline when Trumps reciprocal tariffs on India are set to go into effect. Apple, which manufacturers roughly 15% of its iPhones in India, could be caught in the middle.

title: ‘The eyes of the world are on this race’. Paris Olympics’ triathlon hangs in the balance over E. Coli levels in the Seine
label: Olympics
content: Paris is spending billions to clean up the River Seine ahead of this summers Olympic events, but tests have found the water remains unsafe for swimming due to high levels of E. Coli bacteria.

title: US Olympic medalist Fred Kerley arrested and stun-gunned during confrontation with police in Miami
label: Olympics
content: Fred Kerley, an American sprinter who won a bronze medal in the mens 100m at the 2024 Olympics, was taken into police custody and faced charges for battery, resisting officers and disorderly conduct after a physical confrontation with police officers in Miami.

title: How a NASA scientist and a record-breaking mountaineer conquered an unknown mountain to raise money for girls’ education
label: Climbing
content: Poorna Malavath and Kavya Manyapu are on a mission to empower girls with education, using their shared passion for mountaineering to raise funds and inspire others. The two women, who come from the same Indian village, have tackled some of the worlds most difficult climbs, including Mount Everest and a 6,012-metre virgin peak in Ladakh. Their campaign, Project Shakthi, raises money to fund girls education and provide mentorship opportunities. They hope to expand their efforts globally.

title: A new esports tournament in Saudi Arabia promises to be a game-changer – but it’s also caused division in the industry
label: Esports
content: The Esports World Cup has brought together professional gamers, publishers and fans from across the world, but its launch has also refreshed concerns about the industrys relationship with Saudi Arabia.

title: Iranian rock climber arrives back in Tehran after competing without hijab
label: Climbing
content: Elnaz Rekabi, 33, competed without a hijab during the International Federation of Sport Climbing’s Asian Championships in Seoul. Shes since returned to Iran, amid fears of repercussions.

title: Inaugural Esports World Cup in Saudi Arabia, worth more than $60M, hopes to send ‘positive message’ to struggling industry
label: Esports
content: The record-breaking, eight-week tournament will be held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, and feature top global clubs across 19 esports titles, including Apex Legends, Counter-Strike 2, and League of Legends.

title: Neeraj Chopra has gained unlikely stardom in India. If he wins another Olympic gold, he will be ‘treated like God’
label: Olympics
content: Neeraj Chopra is a javelin thrower from India who has gained celebrity status despite cricket being the countrys favorite sport. Chopra has capitalized on the opportunity and wants to be an inspiration to young athletes. He is the favorite to defend his title at the upcoming Paris Olympics.

title: Analysis: World Series or not – viewership is baseball’s big problem
label: Esports
content: Baseball used to be one of Americas favorite sports, but its lost a lot of traction over the years.

title: Excluded from the Olympics for his whole career, artistic swimmer Bill May set for ‘beautiful’ debut at this year’s Games
label: Olympics
content: Bill May will compete at this years Paris Olympics in the sport of artistic swimming, also known as synchronised swimming, after decades of being barred from the competition due to his gender.

title: Where every sport is being held at the Paris Olympic Games
label: Climbing
content: Paris is preparing for the Olympic Games this summer, which will see a number of disciplines hosted in venues across the city. The Aquatics Centre is the only permanent venue being built for the Olympics, with other events taking place in existing venues or temporary locations. Events such as the opening ceremony will take place in non-sports venues.

title: Congress' proposed Medicaid cuts may negatively impact economy, report finds
label: personal-finance
content: House Republicans have called for $880 billion in Medicaid spending cuts over a decade to help pay for extending expiring tax cuts. While Republicans deny plans to cut the program, economists say it would be difficult to find that level of savings without impacting Medicaid.

title: Businesses can no longer ignore 'north-south' climate divide, warns UN official
label: climate
content: The CEO of the U.N. Global Compact warns business leaders they cant ignore the growing north-south divide on climate change, saying it has created a tension at a global level among policymakers and businesses.

title: Trump is fixated on Greenland — a vast island with massive resource potential
label: climate
content: Experts say U.S. President-elect Donald Trumps pursuit of Greenland could be motivated by a desire to access the islands critical minerals. Trump has said U.S. ownership of Greenland is an absolute necessity and refused to rule out using military force to acquire the territory. Greenlandic lawmakers have said the territory is not for sale.

title: Lucid CEO steps down; EV maker plans to more than double production in 2025
label: transportation
content: Lucid Group said Tuesday that CEO Peter Rawlinson has stepped down and will be replaced by the companys chief operating officer Marc Winterhoff on an interim basis.

title: Preparations urged as much of U.S. braces for arctic blast, freezing temperatures and a potent snowstorm
label: climate
content: An arctic blast is pushing a snowstorm into the Northeast and will be followed by dangerously cold temperatures. More than 212 million people are under winter weather alerts.

title: AI that can match humans at any task will be here in five to 10 years, Google DeepMind CEO says
label: internet
content: Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google-owned AI company DeepMind, said artificial general intelligence (AGI) — as smart as humans or smarter — will likely emerge in the next five to 10 years.

title: Plane crash kills world champion figure skaters and the ‘future’ of the sport in a tragic case of déjà vu
label: Olympics
content: Several members of the US figure skating community, including a married pair of champions and two young skaters, were killed in a plane crash Wednesday night, US Figure Skating says.

label: sports
content: Rory McIlroy and JJ Spaun finished the final round of the PGA Tours The Players Championship tied atop the leaderboard at 12-under par, forcing a Monday playoff.

title: Cincinnati Bengals make wide receiver Ja’Marr Chase highest paid non-quarterback in NFL, per reports
label: sports
content: The Cincinnati Bengals are making sure their top receivers will be around for a while.,JaMarr Chase and Tee Higgins, who scored 47 touchdowns last season, have signed big contract extensions with Cincinnati.

label: sports
content: Mirra Andreeva became the youngest player to reach the Indian Wells final since Kim Clijsters in 2001 by beating defending champion Iga Świątek.

label: sports
content: The Coastal Athletic Association tournament is giving college basketball fans a taste of March Madness a week before the NCAA tournament.

title: Players Championship: JJ Spaun stars but Scottie Scheffler stifled as organizers race to finish tournament before storms
label: sports
content: American golfer J.J. Spaun signed off with a spectacular long-range putt to take a one shot lead into what will be an uncustomary early final round of The Players Championship.

title: Golfer’s ball goes on excruciatingly long journey before dropping into water on famous 17th hole at Players Championship
label: sports
content: Alex Smalleys ball landed on the famous 17th holes wooden ledge at TPC Sawgrass, rolling around for more than 10 seconds before falling into the water. The golfer finished the hole with a double bogey, dropping him down the leaderboard and costing him $287,500 in missed earnings.

title: Mirra Andreeva, 17, claims back-to-back titles with Indian Wells victory over Aryna Sabalenka
label: sports
content: Teenage tennis star Mirra Andreeva thanked herself after winning the Indian Wells tournament, adding to a string of impressive victories in recent weeks. British player Jack Draper claimed the mens title.

label: sports
content: Lando Norris of McLaren claimed the top spot during the Australian Grand Prix on March 13, kicking off the 2023 Formula One racing season. The race was closely contested by Norris and defending champion Max Verstappen.

title: Satellites powered by solid metal could one day use space junk for fuel
label: health
content: British startup Magdrive has developed a propulsion system for spacecraft that will launch into space for the first time later this year. Powered by solid metal, the thrusters could make satellites 10 times more manoeuvrable, while also reducing their mass. Magdrive is also investigating the possibility of using the system to turn space junk into a fuel source.

title: ‘Exercise snacks’ — even a few minutes a day — can boost your health
label: health
content: It may seem hard to believe, but snacking several times a day can boost your health and fitness — exercise snacking, that is. Heres how it works, and why it helps.

title: When speaking with vaccine-hesitant patients, pediatricians turn to these tips
label: health
content: A rare complication of the measles virus — which can appear years after an initial infection — is making a comeback in the US. Doctors say the best way to prevent it is through vaccination and that anecdotes about side effects often circulate in community WhatsApp and Facebook groups.

title: Blobfish overcomes notoriety as ‘world’s ugliest animal’ to win New Zealand’s ‘fish of the year’
label: health
content: The blobfish has gone from being named the worlds ugliest animal in 2013 to being named New Zealands "fish of the year" in a recent competition. The annual competition, organized by the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust, aims to raise awareness of New Zealands marine life. A total of 5,583 votes were cast, with the blobfish winning almost 300 votes more than its nearest rival, the orange roughy.

title: NASA’s Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore finally return home after more than nine months in space
label: health
content: NASAs Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, who stayed in space longer than expected due to a malfunction with their spacecraft, have safely returned to Earth. They landed aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule along with two other astronauts. The pair were supposed to fly back in August but their trip was delayed after Boeings Starliner capsule encountered multiple issues.

title: As bird flu continues to spread, Trump administration sidelines key pandemic preparedness office
label: health
content: The White House Office of Pandemic Preparedness and Response Policy was established by Congress in 2022 to avoid future mistakes that led to a flat-footed response to the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Gender-affirming hormone therapy is linked to lower depression in transgender adults, study shows
label: health
content: The study, published Monday in the journal JAMA Network Open, found that transgender people who were prescribed hormones had a 15% lower risk of moderate-to-severe depressive symptoms than those who were not prescribed hormones.

title: Measles outbreak could last a year, health official in Texas says
label: health
content: There are 321 reported cases of measles in Texas, New Mexico and Oklahoma, an increase of 25 cases since Friday, officials say. The outbreak has been deadly, and officials say it will likely last months.

title: More Americans with college degrees are working multiple jobs, Fed report finds
label: personal-finance
content: Millions of Americans with college degrees are taking on multiple jobs for career and financial reasons. Heres how it impacts their finances.

title: Australian sprint sensation Gout Gout, 17, runs fastest 200m time in the world this year
label: sports
content: Australian sprinter Gout Gout has raced to a 200-metre time of 20.05 seconds, just 0.01 outside his own Australian record. The 17-year-olds time of 19.98 seconds in the final would have been a new record, but officials ruled out the possibility of illegal wind assistance. Gout, who broke the national record aged 16, is being tipped as a future great following comparable times to Usain Bolt at the same age.

title: The Asian Games’ golden ticket: South Korea’s esports stars target medal success – and a military exemption

The Hangzhou Asian Games has seen the first historic gold medals for South Korea in FIFA Online 4 and League of Legends, with more to come in the gaming arena. While some are in support of the initiative, others feel that military service should not be tied to athletic performance.

label: Climbing
content: Jesse Dufton has climbed the famed Old Man of Hoy in Scotland and established a multi-pitch route in Morocco, despite being blind. The climber has a degenerative eye condition called cone-rod dystrophy, and now aged 39, he has only light perception. He and his wife Molly climbed El Matador in just one day, making him the first blind climber to achieve the feat.

The US and South Korea have a free trade pact, with South Korean tariffs on US imports standing at 0.79% as of 2024. The acting President of South Korea has ordered the government to try to resolve any misunderstandings over the tariffs with the US administration.

The companys marketing services grew 17% year-on-year to CNY 35bn, while cloud computing revenue doubled. Tencents AI focus has included increased spending, with capital expenditure for 2024 more than tripling to CNY 76.8bn. The company said it expects these investments to lead to uplifting productivity in its advertising business and longevity of its games.

content: Former UK PM David Cameron fears U.S. President Donald Trumps approach to securing peace in Ukraine could set a worrying precedent, particularly for the Baltic states. Cameron said he fears Trumps view of the world is that big powers shouldnt interfere in what they want to do, which he said could be alarming for Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. Cameron served as UK prime minister from 2010 to 2016 and as a foreign minister under former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak from 2023 to 2024.

content: A federal judge ordered the Trump administration to temporarily restore education grants for diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives. The grants were terminated and the lawsuit claims the move was arbitrary and capricious. The grants are meant to help address teacher shortages, with 80% of US teachers being white. A second judge also ordered the Trump administration to restore grants for teacher preparation in eight states.

The announcements come as Nvidia aims to announce new chip families on an annual basis.

The technology can be used to monitor retail inventory, track the progress of temperature-sensitive drugs and predict when industrial machines may need maintenance. There will be 40bn connected IoT devices by 2030, up from 1.18 billion in 2024, according to research firm IoT Analytics.

The new product will be launched in the coming weeks and scaled to all Walmart channels by the holiday season, sources claim.

title: The incredible true story of the time an astronaut played golf on the moon
label: Golf
content: On February 6, 1971, Alan Shepard became the first man to play golf on the moon. Now, a new book Apollo Remastered brings some of NASAs most iconic images into unprecedented focus.

title: LaLiga match between Espanyol and Athletic Bilbao halted due to alleged racist abuse
label: Football
content: The Spanish league game was briefly halted after Athletic Bilbao player Iñaki Williams reported that he was being abused and the referee activated the leagues anti-racism protocol. The match finished 1-1.

title: These young female athletes died by suicide. They all had head injuries in common
label: sports
content: Two promising young sportswomen, both suffered serious head injuries and took their own lives. Experts say women are more likely to suffer concussions and they often dont get the treatment they need.

title: Manchester United set for new 100,000-seater home, dubbed the ‘world’s greatest football stadium’
label: sports
content: Manchester United has announced plans for a new 100,000-seat stadium, despite the clubs current dire financial situation and on-field struggles. The clubs minority owner, billionaire Jim Ratcliffe, said the new stadium would create a more modern fan experience while preserving the "essence" of Old Trafford. The project is part of a wider government regeneration project of the area.

title: This one-armed player just made college basketball history. She’s just happy to prove her high school coach wrong
label: sports
content: Baileigh Sinaman-Daniel has become the first NCAA Division III womens basketball player with one arm to score a field goal in a collegiate game. The Lesley University player didnt realize shed made history until after the fact. She was just happy to be able to get back on defense.

title: A doping free-for-all Enhanced Games calls itself the answer to doping in sports. Opponents say it poses a danger to health
label: sports
content: The upcoming 2024 Olympics in Paris is causing controversy already, with an alternative games proposing to allow athletes to use performance enhancing drugs. The Enhanced Games says it is an alternative to the "corrupt Olympics", however anti-doping agencies and sporting experts have voiced their concerns over the safety and legality of the event.

title: Arsenal breaks Champions League record with seven-goal performance against PSV, Real Madrid edges past rival Atlético
label: Football
content: Arsenal beat PSV Eindhoven 7-1 in their Champions League round-of-16 tie, setting a new record for most goals scored by an away side in the knockout stages of the competition. Meanwhile, Real Madrid beat Atletico Madrid 2-1 in their own local derby.

title: ‘Crazy is an understatement’: 24 hours after ‘the worst’ round of his career, Justin Thomas ties Players course record
label: sports
content: After a disastrous opening day, Justin Thomas produced the best round of his career to make the cut at The Players Championship.

title: Seattle Seahawks trade DK Metcalf to Pittsburgh Steelers, per reports
label: sports
content: The Steelers have agreed to trade for star receiver DK Metcalf and also signed him to an extension, and hell join another young talented wideout in George Pickens in Pittsburgh.

title: Amid chants, flags, and No. 10 shirts, the trial for the death of Maradona began
label: sports
content: The death of Argentine soccer legend Diego Maradona is being re-examined in a court in Buenos Aires, with prosecutors seeking to prove that there was malpractice during his home hospitalization.

title: Rory McIlroy takes fan’s phone after being heckled by college golfer at Players Championship
label: sports
content: Rory McIlroy took a fans phone after the spectator heckled the golfer during a tournament this week, saying "I dont want you to" when a reporter asked about the incident.

title: Washington Post columnist who resigned over a spiked Bezos op-ed ‘fears’ readers can’t trust opinion writers
label: sports
content: The Washington Posts Ruth Marcus resigned after a column disagreeing with the papers new owner Jeff Bezos was spiked. Marcus shared more details about the events that led to her departure in a piece for The New Yorker, raising concerns about what Bezos changes could mean for the future of the papers opinion coverage.

title: I don’t have diabetes, but I wore a glucose monitor for six weeks. Here’s what I learned about food (and anxiety)
label: Tech
content: Continuous glucose monitors have been revolutionary for people with type 1 diabetes, but theyve also started being marketed as wellness tools. How helpful are they for people without diabetes?

title: Lionel Messi fined for grabbing the neck of an opposition coach
label: Football
content: Lionel Messi has been fined by Major League Soccer for grabbing the neck of an opposing coach during a match. Messis teammate Luis Suárez also received a fine for the same incident.

title: Ally Sentnor scores stunning goal as USWNT beats Colombia 2-0 in SheBelieves Cup opener
label: Football
content: Catarina Macario opened the scoring for the USWNT before Sentnors second-half strike to seal a 2-0 victory over Colombia in their opening SheBelieves Cup match.

title: After breaking both legs and shattering his ‘invincibility complex’ in a crash, freeskier Kai Jones returned to ‘ground zero’
label: sports
content: Freerider Kai Jones was airlifted off a slope in Wyoming after a crash and it took nine weeks of rehab for him to learn to walk again. His ordeal is charted in a new film, "Falling into Place.

title: 5 takeaways from Selection Sunday
label: sports
content: The fields are set and it’s time for a big exhale before the madness kicks into gear. Here are five takeaways from Selection Sunday.

title: Philadelphia Eagles officially accept invitation to visit White House to celebrate Super Bowl LIX victory
label: sports
content: The Philadelphia Eagles, who defeated the Kansas City Chiefs in Super Bowl LIX, have accepted an invitation to visit the White House on April 28, a team spokesperson told CNN.

title: A rookie came to The Players without a spot in the field. Then a shock phone call set up a potentially life-changing payday
label: sports
content: Danny Walker was a last-minute addition to The Players Championship when Jason Day withdrew. Walker, a PGA Tour rookie, is now on the cusp of earning the biggest paycheck of his career.

title: Group of 10 athletic directors in charge of enforcing new rules under college sports lawsuit
label: sports
content: Ten athletic directors have been put in charge of enforcing a July rollout of a new system reconfiguring college sports. The main tasks include creating a digital platform for schools to report payments and enforcing new rules.

title: Barcelona teenager scores stunning Champions League goal to make history
label: sports
content: Barcelona teenager Lamine Yamal continues to impress in Champions League, with assists and goals helping Barca advance. PSG beat Liverpool in penalty shootout to knock the defending champs out of UEFA Champions League. PSG will face either Club Brugge or Aston Villa in quarterfinals.

title: Novak Djokovic stunned by Botic van de Zandschulp at Indian Wells, marking his third consecutive defeat
label: sports
content: Novak Djokovics surprise defeat to Botic van de Zandschulp marked his third consecutive defeat, the first since 2018 and just the second since 2008. The 37-year-old has struggled since his dominant 2023 season where he came close to winning a calendar grand slam. Van de Zandschulp reached the main draw in Indian Wells as one of the "lucky losers from the qualifying tournament" and produced an uncharacteristically error-strewn performance from Djokovic.

title: Former Spanish soccer boss Luis Rubiales found guilty of kissing player Jenni Hermoso without consent
label: Football
content: Luis Rubiales, the former chief of the Royal Spanish Football Federation, has been acquitted of coercing Womens World Cup winner Jennifer Hermoso, but was found guilty of sexually assaulting her by kissing her on the lips.

title: Mikaela Shiffrin battled with a ‘mind-body disconnect’ before winning historic 100th World Cup race
label: sports
content: Mikaela Shiffrins journey to a landmark 100th World Cup win has been a mental and physical battle, with the American skier overcoming severe injury and trauma in the runup to the milestone.

title: Trump tariffs to hit over $200 billion in U.S.-Canada-Mexico rail trade
label: transportation
content: U.S. freight railroads are bracing for an impact that hits at the heart of a vast traffic network connecting world economies, as additional tariffs on China and the European Union are coming, on top of already announced tariffs on Mexico and Canada.

title: Starbucks poaches Nordstrom CFO as executive shake-up continues
label: retail
content: Starbucks announced Tuesday that Nordstrom CFO Cathy Smith will join the company as its new CFO, replacing longtime veteran Rachel Ruggeri.

label: life
content: Trudie Stylers new documentary is a love-letter to the Italian city of Naples, but she had to overcome her fears of the notorious local mafia, the Camorra, first.

title: How Baked by Melissa's founder converted bedroom cold calls to cupcake empire
label: small-business
content: Melissa Ben-Ishay went from a fired ad agency worker to the founder and CEO of a global cupcake empire, with a social media following to match. The female founder says she has experienced gender-based obstacles but says the freedom of entrepreneurship makes it all worth it.

title: Senators warn Trump Social Security nominee of consequences of staff cuts
label: personal-finance
content: Democratic senators Elizabeth Warren and Ron Wyden have warned the Trump administration nominee to lead the Social Security Administration that he will be responsible if staff cuts interfere with benefit payments. The agency has plans to cut 7,000 employees and close regional offices.

label: fintech
content: Crypto industry leaders say banks have been weaponizing banking services to target firms with political views out of favor with the current administration, and theyre getting an audience with Republican leadership in Washington to air their grievances.

label: sports
content: Despite being the shortest player in the NBA, Yuki Kawamura has become a fan favorite in his rookie season for the Memphis Grizzlies. The 23-year-old from Japan is the only man under 6-feet tall on the team.

title: Fiorentina star Moise Kean discharged from hospital after collapsing on pitch following head injury
label: Football
content: Italian soccer player Moise Kean, 24, has been discharged from hospital after collapsing in a game on Sunday. The striker received treatment before being stretchered off following a collision. He spent the night in hospital in Verona as a precaution.

label: sports
content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman says he doesnt "care about the countrys investment in sport being described as sportswashing," in an interview with Fox News. The kingdom has spent big to attract stars like Cristiano Ronaldo and Karim Benzema to its domestic leagues.

label: Football
content: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter and French soccer great Michel Platini are due in court on Monday accused of fraud. Both men were acquitted in 2022 but the Swiss federal prosecutor has appealed the decision.

title: Exchange-traded funds have a 'tax magic' that many mutual funds don't offer
label: etf-street
content: ETFs are more tax efficient than mutual funds due to their in-kind creations and redemptions, which allows for tax free trades, resulting in fewer capital gains distributions. This provides a significant advantage for non-IRA accounts, however, this is not true for all ETFs and depends on the jurisdiction.

title: Pony.ai CEO on Tesla's robotaxis: 'We haven't seen their large scale testing yet'
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: The CEO of Pony.ai, James Peng, has said that Tesla is yet to show the results of large-scale testing of its autonomous vehicles, despite the companys size.

title: Meta's Community Notes will use open-source technology from Elon Musk's X
label: internet
content: The upcoming Community Notes feature for monitoring misinformation will use some technology developed by Elon Musks X for its similar service.

title: Apple Watch Series 10 offers minor upgrades, but faster charging is a big plus
label: tech-guide
content: The Apple Watch Series 10 is appealing to newcomers and those considering an upgrade with its slightly thinner design, larger screens, and software features. While there arent any significant health upgrades, the faster charging and sleep apnea detection are notable.

label: Motorsport
content: Lawrence Strolls Aston Martin team have signed up the highly-rated Adrian Newey, regarded as the greatest Formula One designer of all time. The 65-year-olds deal at Red Bull expires in 2025.

title: Lengthy dispute between Washington Nationals and Baltimore Orioles over TV rights fees finally ends
label: US Sports
content: The Washington Nationals will continue to have their games televised by the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network, with an option to explore other opportunities after the 2025 season, MLB announced Monday.

title: Jimmy Johnson retires from Fox Sports after being a face of its NFL coverage for most of 3 decades
label: US Sports
content: Jimmy Johnson, the Hall of Fame coach who won two Super Bowls and a college national championship, is retiring from his NFL analyst job at Fox Sports after a 31-year run.

title: ‘Breaking has total freedom for me,’ says Menno van Gorp, a medal hopeful in the newest Olympic sport
label: Olympics
content: Menno van Gorp, a competitive breakdancer from the Netherlands, is training for the debut of his sport at this years Olympic Games in Paris, where he hopes to win gold.

title: Can Russians and Belarusians compete at the Paris Olympics? Individual Neutral Athletes explained
label: Olympics
content: Russian athletes will be permitted to compete at Paris 2024 under the acronym AIN, short for Athlètes Individuels Neutres (Individual Neutral Athletes), the IOC has ruled. Strict eligibility requirements will be in place and they will not be permitted to compete in team events, with their medal wins not counted in the overall medal table.

title: Luka Dončić and LeBron James lead LA Lakers to thrilling OT win over New York Knicks, extend win streak
label: US Sports
content: Luka Dončić and LeBron James combine for 73 points to lead the Los Angeles Lakers to an overtime victory against the New York Knicks. Jalen Brunson leaves the game late in overtime with an ankle injury.

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander gets better of fellow MVP candidate Nikola Jokić as Oklahoma City Thunder dominate Denver Nuggets
label: US Sports
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 40 points to help the Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Denver Nuggets and extend their lead in the Western Conference. Elsewhere, the Cleveland Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 14 games.

title: Break dancing makes its debut at the Paris Olympics. A timeline of when every Olympic sport was introduced
label: Climbing
content: Breaking is the newest addition to the Paris Olympics. Only five sports have been in every Olympics. Host countries now have more leverage on what sports are included.

title: ‘Hot embers were raining down’: US swimmer Gary Hall Jr. says he lost 10 Olympic medals in Palisades wildfire
label: Olympics
content: The retired swimmer likely lost his 10 Olympic medals, as well as other belongings, after being forced to evacuate his home.

title: From highs to lows, Everest record breaker sees ‘no future’ in Nepal
label: Climbing
content: For the first time in 20 years, no one reached the summit of Mount Everest last year, but the record-breaking Nepali climber Kami Rita Sherpa - who was on 28th expedition - says the future lies elsewhere.

title: American teenager Sam Watson sets world record in speed climbing, the fastest sport at the Paris Olympics
label: Climbing
content: Sam Watson set a new world record for speed climbing at the Olympics on Tuesday, scaling a 15-metre wall in 4.75 seconds. The 18-year-old from Texas has competed at the games in speed climbing, an event in which athletes have to scale a 15-metre wall in the shortest time possible and hit a buzzer at the top.
