title: China's consumer inflation turns negative for the first time in 13 months
label: china-markets
content: Chinas inflation rate fell into negative territory in February, for the first time since January 2019, as food and other prices declined, according to data from the National Bureau of Statistics.

title: China's ‘Netflix' iQiyi to open theme park with virtual reality based on its shows
label: china-markets
content: Chinese videostreaming platform iQiyi plans to open its first full-fledged theme park based on its own shows. Later this year, iQiyi Land will open in the city of Yangzhou, two hours from Shanghai. It will include immersive theater, interactive film sets and experiences using virtual reality.

title: Chinese EV startup Xpeng delivers over 30,000 cars for a fourth straight month
label: china-markets
content: The Chinese electric vehicle company delivered 30,453 cars in February, including more than 15,000 units of its lower-priced Mona vehicle.

title: China’s growth goal will need stronger stimulus if U.S. trade war intensifies
label: china-markets
content: Chinas economy faces rising pressures from elevated trade tensions with the US and weak domestic consumption, prompting economists to predict that Beijing will need to take more forceful steps to meet its GDP growth target.

title: China's commerce ministry held talks with Walmart: State media
label: china-markets
content: Chinas Ministry of Commerce has spoken with Walmart following the US firms reported request for Chinese suppliers to cut prices by as much as 10% to offset tariff costs.

title: China to cut inflation outlook to two-decade low as Beijing plans rare stimulus
label: china-markets
content: Chinas parliament is expected to reveal highly anticipated details of its latest stimulus package next week, as it aims to shore up economic growth in the face of heightened U.S.-China tensions.

title: China doubles down on AI and tech innovation as Trump ratchets up trade pressure
label: china-markets
content: Chinas parliamentary meetings this week have an undercurrent of U.S. trade tensions and how Chinese technology is offsetting that pressure, with a greater willingness to support the private sector than in the past. Chinese Premier Li Qiang said in his annual report that China would promote the healthy and well-regulated development of the platform economy, while a member of the report drafting team named Chinese AI company DeepSeek as an example of the countrys rapid AI development. The Chinese government also plans to increase funding for biomanufacturing, quantum technology, AI-linked robotics and 6G technology.

title: Oil holds near 1-week high on supply concerns, sanctions on Russia eyed
label: world-markets
content: Oil futures rose Thursday after data showed a drawdown in gasoline and distillate in the U.S. while worries about supply disruptions in Russia supported prices.

title: Consumer sentiment slumps in March to lowest since 2022 as Trump tariffs spark more inflation worries
label: economy
content: The University of Michigans latest sentiment survey revealed consumer sentiment dropped to a ten-month low in March, as inflation worries grew and the stock market slumped. The reading came in below forecasts and across party lines, with consumers citing high uncertainty around economic factors.

title: Unemployment rate in February drops for Black men, but rises for Hispanic women
label: economy
content: The unemployment rate for black men saw a notable decline in February, even as the rate ticked higher for U.S. workers in general.

title: Trump says transition period likely for economy and you can't watch stocks
label: economy
content: President Donald Trump and senior White House officials are projecting an optimistic outlook, with warnings about near-term economic churning as the potential tariff impact, labour market slowdown and negative growth in the first quarter take hold.

title: Tariffs to add as much as $10,000 to cost of average new home, trade group says
label: economy
content: President Donald Trumps tariffs could increase material costs for the average new home by as much as $10,000, the National Association of Home Builders has said.

title: Tariffs are 'lose-lose' for U.S. jobs and industry, economist says
label: finance
content: President Donald Trump has spoken of tariffs as a job-creating behemoth, but economists disagree. Heres how tariffs could affect jobs and the economy.

title: Here’s the inflation breakdown for February 2025 — in one chart
label: finance
content: Inflation eased in February as prices fell for consumer staples like gasoline, groceries and housing, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported. The consumer price index rose 2.8% annually, down from 3% in January.

title: Germany's fiscal U-turn could be a 'game changer' for the country's sluggish economy, analysts say
label: economy
content: Germanys prospective fiscal shift could prove transformational for Europes largest economy, and for defense. But lawmakers dont have much time to make the historic shift happen.

title: Passive investing movement gets its Hollywood moment
label: finance
content: A new documentary titled Tune Out The Noise looks at the financial world and how it moved away from traditional stock picking. The film features interviews with the academics whose work led to a boom in passive investing.

title: Dr. Mehmet Oz may have underpaid Medicare and Social Security taxes, Senate Democratic memo finds
label: health-and-science
content: Trumps nominee to lead Medicare and Medicaid paid no Social Security or Medicare taxes in 2021 and negligible amounts in 2022, according to a memo from Democratic staff on the Senate Finance Committee.

title: Hims & Hers shares plunge 22% on concerns over weight loss business, margins
label: health-and-science
content: Hims & Hers Health slumped 22% on Tuesday, a day after the telehealth company disappointed investors with its gross margin and the future of its weight-loss business.

title: RFK Jr. pressures Big Food to remove artificial dyes in meeting with CEOs
label: health-and-science
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the controversial new head of the Department of Health and Human Services, on Monday told food executives that he wants the worst ingredients out of food.

title: Amazon's One Medical CEO stepping down after less than two years at helm
label: health-and-science
content: One Medical CEO Trent Green is leaving the Amazon-owned health care company after less than two years in the role to become the head of National Research Corp.

title: Healthy Returns: Wegovy is linked to an increased risk of hair loss, study suggests
label: health-and-science
content: A new study, which is yet to be peer-reviewed, found that the active ingredient in Wegovy and Ozempic – semaglutide – is associated with hair loss compared to an older weight loss pill. Hair loss has been a known side effect of Novo Nordisks drugs, but the study highlights the risk of the ingredient itself.

title: Why nursing homes and hospice are so expensive in the U.S.
label: health-and-science
content: Baby boomers are now beginning to hit the long-term health space, but this niche is not prepared for the large number of boomers needing end of life care. Many businesses in this space are acquiring acquisitions from private equities and are for-profit.

title: Why FDA allows so many chemicals in America's food supply
label: health-and-science
content: The FDA is responsible for regulating food and health-related products in the US, but its estimated that it only oversees 80% of the food supply. Companies are finding ways to introduce new food additives without the FDAs approval.

title: Comcast cable network spin may be a signal to the industry for necessary change
label: media
content: Comcast investors didnt seem fazed by the companys plan to spin off cable networks, except Bravo, as a separate publicly traded entity. Uncertainty over the transactions impact and potential motives underscore the media industrys need to consolidate.

title: 1 in 5 Americans get their news from social media influencers
label: media
content: About 20% of Americans say they get their news from news influencers on social media, according to a Pew Research Center survey. The study found that 65% of Americans said information from news influencers helped them better understand the world, while 40% of adults under 30 said they get their news from independent social media figures.

title: Amazon Prime Video to stream Diamond regional sports networks
label: media
content: Regional sports network operator Diamond Sports has agreed a deal with Amazon Prime Video to make its 16 regional sports networks available on the streaming platform as an add-on subscription for Prime customers, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: DirecTV says Dish purchase is off
label: media
content: The deal, which would have combined the two largest satellite TV providers in the U.S., is likely to be called off entirely after bondholders rebuffed a sweetened offer.

title: Homebuyers are making bigger down payments. Coming up with that cash is a struggle
label: real-estate
content: Homebuyers are putting down bigger down payments, but that doesnt mean its easy to buy a home. Heres what people need to know about no- and low-down-payment mortgage options.

title: Toast, Shift4 lead drop in fintechs as investors exit stocks tied to consumer spending
label: energy
content: Fintech stocks were among the worst performers on Thursday as concerns about the economy and the impact of rising tariffs took their toll. Shares of Toast, Shift4 and Bill.com dropped more sharply than the broader market.

title: Binance token rises following report that Trump family has discussed stake
label: energy
content: The Binance Coin token jumped 4% on the news that the former presidents family has held talks to secure a financial interest in Binance.US. The deal would link the Trumps to a firm that pleaded guilty to breaking anti-money laundering laws.

title: Watch Energy Secretary Chris Wright speak live about Trump's energy agenda
label: energy
content: The former CEO of Liberty Energy and Trumps energy secretary will speak at the annual energy conference. Watch live on CNBC at 2 p.m. ET.

title: Palisades nuclear plant agrees to build first of its kind small modular reactors
label: energy
content: The owner of a shuttered nuclear plant in Michigan wants to build the first small modular reactor in the U.S. at the site by 2030. Many companies are hoping to build such reactors to reduce costs and construction times that have plagued larger nuclear projects.

title: Wind energy had a record year in Germany. The election could shake things up
label: climate
content: Permits for onshore turbines in Germany accelerated last year, but vocal skepticism from the CDU and Alternative fuer Deutschland means the sector now faces uncertainty.

title: L.A. wildfire victims face financial anxiety amid recovery
label: climate
content: Los Angeles area wildfires fueled by hurricane-force winds and exceptionally dry conditions have been among the costliest in U.S. history. Theyve killed at least 29 people and are estimated to have caused $250 billion in total damage and economic loss, with insured losses at $40 billion, according to S&P Global Ratings.

title: Greenland’s melting ice is clearing the way for a mineral ‘gold rush’
label: climate
content: Major ice loss from Greenland is exposing the islands natural resources, inadvertently making some of the worlds largest untapped critical mineral reserves more accessible. With much of the territory still untouched, mining companies are eyeing up the island as a potential new mining hub, although the harsh climate and lack of infrastructure may prove challenging.

title: Here's why Trump thinks Greenland is crucial to America's national security
label: climate
content: As China and Russia expand their Arctic presence, Greenland has become vital to Americas ballistic missile warning system and control of Arctic shipping routes. President Trump wants to buy Greenland from Denmark, but other nations like China and Russia have also shown interest in the territory.

title: Trump finds unexpected ally in auto union leader over tariffs
label: transportation
content: Shawn Fain, who has publicly denounced Trump in the past, says tariffs on auto companies will help stop job losses in America. The UAW president is in active negotiations with the Trump administration about plans to end what he calls the free trade disaster.

title: JetBlue talking to 'multiple airlines' about a new partnership
label: industrials
content: The president of JetBlue says the airline is talking to others about deals now that two previous partnerships have been struck down.

title: Applebee's owner Dine Brands to lean on value, marketing to reverse slump
label: retail
content: Applebees and IHOP owner Dine Brands hopes to boost sales in 2025 with wider value meals and buzzier advertising after a soft year in 2024, CEO John Peyton told CNBC.

title: Ulta issues weak guidance, citing consumer uncertainty and company missteps
label: retail
content: Ulta Beauty issued weak guidance for the year ahead as it navigates a series of internal missteps, rising competition, and consumer uncertainty.

title: Trump policies 'promise' an economic downturn, says prominent forecaster
label: economy
content: The UCLA Anderson Forecast, which has been issuing forecasts since 1952, said Trumps tariff and immigration policies, together with planned reductions in the federal workforce, could cause the US economy to contract.

title: Will 2025 finally mark the end of the IPO drought?
label: etf-street
content: Nasdaqs president says the IPO market could be in for a comeback as the back half of the year approaches, though the pipeline still faces roadblocks from players like Panera Brands and OpenAI, which are thriving in private markets.

title: 'World's first downside protected bitcoin ETF:' Calamos' new way to play crypto
label: etf-street
content: Calamos Investments has launched a bitcoin ETF it says offers protection against the cryptocurrencys frequent price crashes, in a bid to attract risk-averse investors. The funds launch comes as bitcoin has risen 10% this month.

title: Bitcoin ETFs are a 'traditional way to buy an untraditional asset,' advisor says
label: etf-street
content: Bitcoin ETFs have been a banner year for spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds, with some of the biggest asset managers introducing ETFs that hold the flagship digital currency but advisors still urge would-be investors to keep their allocation small — around 2% to 3%, maximum.

title: Bitcoin vs. gold: State Street worries crypto rally is distracting investors
label: etf-street
content: George Milling-Stanley, chief gold strategist at State Street Global Advisors, warns bitcoin investors are being lulled into a false sense of security, saying crypto is a return play akin to a casino.

title: Indexes are getting an update. Trillions depend on who’s in and who’s out
label: etf-street
content: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 indexes get new members added and old ones kicked out on Friday in a quarterly rebalancing mostly based on companies adjusted market capitalization. Years ago, these index reconstitutions had very little impact on trading. Not anymore. The explosion of index-based ETFs has changed all that. What stocks are added to or deleted from these large indexes matters a lot.

title: Target warns February sales were soft, adding to concerns about consumer health
label: earnings
content: The big-box retailer says it expects a meaningful drop in first-quarter profit as it contends with ongoing consumer uncertainty, soft sales in February and concerns around tariffs.

title: Volkswagen expects revenue to grow in 2025, says it feels 'all-American' as tariffs loom
label: earnings
content: The German autos giant reported a 15% year-on-year drop in annual operating profit on Tuesday, citing increasing costs and extraordinary expenses associated with its restructuring strategy.

title: Broadcom shares soar 16% as earnings top estimates on demand for custom AI chips
label: earnings
content: Broadcoms stock jumped 16% in extended trading on Thursday after the company reported first-quarter earnings that topped analysts expectations and offered strong guidance for the current quarter. The companys artificial intelligence business is at the center of its recent boom, with $4.1 billion in AI revenue recorded during the first quarter, a 77% increase on a year-over-year basis.

title: ETFs holding bitcoin are now the crypto's largest holders
label: trader-talk
content: The 12 spot bitcoin ETFs in existence collectively now control more than $100 billion in assets under management, and now own more than 1.1 million bitcoin, or about 5% of all the bitcoin in existence.

title: Greenlight's David Einhorn says the markets are broken and getting worse
label: trader-talk
content: Greenlight Capitals David Einhorn is worried about the continued destruction of the professional asset management community and blames passive investors and distortive market forces.

title: Op-ed: What to know about retirement savings if your company merges, is acquired
label: financial-advisors
content: Employee retirement plans are often a key concern during mergers and acquisitions, but there are federal laws in place to ensure workers savings are protected.

title: Trump is losing markets war so far. Here's where investors are taking advantage
label: etf-street
content: Since the inauguration of President Donald Trump, stocks in Europe and China vastly outperform the U.S. equity market.

title: ETF provider is trying to help investors cut exposure to Magnificent 7 stocks
label: etf-street
content: Big Techs historic gains could be affecting your portfolios makeup — especially if your goal is diversification, warns the CEO of Astoria Portfolio Advisors.

title: Britain orders Apple to give it access to encrypted accounts: Washington Post
label: cybersecurity
content: British officials ordered Apple to provide a backdoor to access encrypted material uploaded to its iCloud service, according to a Washington Post report.

title: Here's what Southwest Airlines is changing, from bag fees to basic economy
label: transportation
content: The airline is getting rid of its famous two bags fly free policy and will also introduce basic economy tickets that dont allow free changes or refunds.

title: David's Bridal taps new CEO as it looks to become a bridal media powerhouse
label: retail
content: Kelly Cook, the current president of brand, technology and finance, will take over as Davids CEO on April 1 and become the second woman in the companys 75-year history to hold its top job.

title: Kering shares plunge 11% after Demna Gvasalia named as Gucci's artistic director
label: wealth
content: Kering shares dropped more than 10% as it unveiled designer Demna Gvasalia as the new artistic director of its Gucci fashion line.

title: Shares of Cartier owner Richemont jump 16% as sales rise in December quarter
label: wealth
content: Richemont, owner of Cartier, jumped as much as 16% on the news, buoying hopes for Europes luxury sector. The company reported a 10% increase in fiscal third-quarter sales, which beat analyst expectations.

title: A majority of America's business owners support minimum wage increases
label: small-business
content: A recent survey shows small business owners express both support and concern over an increase in minimum wage, with some fearing it will cause hiring issues.

title: Palo Alto deserves more credit for earnings only a year into its new strategy
label: cybersecurity
content: PANW shares dropped on Thursday after the company reported results that were solid, but not good enough to satisfy investors expectations.

title: One of tax return filing season's biggest financial risks isn't an IRS audit
label: cybersecurity
content: Tax season is open, and with it comes increased opportunities for fraud and scams. Here are some tips for protecting yourself, from filing early to avoiding phishing attempts.

title: Musubi, AI content moderation startup, raises $5 million in seed funding
label: cybersecurity
content: Musubi, an AI-powered content moderation start-up, has raised $5m in a seed round, with the aim of helping social and dating apps stay one step ahead of bad actors. The companys AI systems aim to understand users behaviours better and more accurately assess whether there is a malicious intent behind users content. Musubis technology boasts a 10 times lower error rate than that of human moderators and is being utilised by Grindr and Bluesky.

title: Google, Meta execs blast Europe over strict AI regulation as Big Tech ups the ante
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Public policy chiefs at U.S. tech giants Google and Meta have said that Europes artificial intelligence industry is being held back by excessive regulation at a tech conference in Stockholm, Sweden, this week. Metas director of public policy, Chris Yiu, and Google DeepMinds head of public policy, Dorothy Chou, also said that the EUs AI Act was devised before ChatGPT had even come out, which was a key problem with Europes approach to regulating AI technology.

title: How DeepSeek used distillation to train its AI model, and what it means for the industry
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Chinese artificial intelligence lab DeepSeek has created an AI model that it says is more efficient and cheaper than those made by US competitors. The development has led to a selloff in US tech and semiconductor stocks as investors worry about losing dominance. The innovation behind the DeepSeek model is a technique called distillation, which can allow a small team to create an advanced model quickly and efficiently. Now, startups and research labs can compete at the cutting edge faster than ever before, with Berkeley researchers recreating OpenAIs reasoning model for $450 in 19 hours, and a Stanford and University of Washington team doing the same for less than $50 in 26 minutes. Hugging Face, a startup, also recreated OpenAIs Deep Research as a 24-hour coding challenge.

title: Microsoft deploys new state of matter in its first quantum computing chip
label: enterprise
content: The tech giant has spent two decades researching and developing its first quantum computing chip, which it says is a major leap forward for the technology.

title: Amazon cloud launches service for helping game companies with streaming
label: enterprise
content: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has launched a service for video game publishers to stream their games online, helping developers rapidly distribute titles in development to testers. The service, called GameLift Streams, can be used on any device that supports WebRTC, including smart TVs, phones, tablets and PCs. Amazons cloud unit said it has already signed up several major customers, including Electronic Arts and Take-Two Interactive.

title: Meta goes to arbitrator to prevent whistleblower from promoting tell-all book
label: internet
content: Meta is seeking to stop the promotion of a former staffers memoir that alleges sexual harassment and details the companys attempts to appease Chinas Communist Party. An emergency arbitrator has ruled that the author is prohibited from promoting the book.

title: Digg founder teams up with former Reddit rival to buy and revive website
label: internet
content: The once popular social media platform for news, Digg, is making a comeback with the help of its one-time rival and co-founder of Reddit, Alexis Ohanian. Ohanian and Diggs founder, Kevin Rose, acquired the platform for an undisclosed sum.

title: Intel's new CEO receives $66 million in options and stock grants on top of $1 million salary
label: mobile
content: The Intel CEO, who starts next week, will receive $1 million in salary, eligible for an annual bonus of $2 million and stock units and performance grants worth $66 million.

title: Trump looms over the successful global expansion of Chinese smartphone players
label: mobile
content: U.S. President Donald Trumps continued clashes with China over tech and trade creates uncertainty over whether Chinese smartphone vendors may be targeted by Washington, similarly to Huawei.

title: DeepSeek AI cranks open the spigots on Chinese venture capital
label: china-markets
content: DeepSeeks artificial intelligence breakthrough is stirring up Chinas venture capital world after three straight years of decline, and now some investors are looking to put money into existing AI companies rather than new AI startups.

title: Bessent says a 'detox' period for the economy does not have to be a recession
label: economy
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says a detox period for the economy doesnt necessarily mean a recession is coming, but does depend on how quickly the transition from government spending to private sector happens.

title: Athenahealth to offer Abridge's AI scribe to its network of thousands of doctors
label: health-and-science
content: Healthcare software vendor Athenahealth will offer AI-powered documentation tool Abridge to its network of 160,000 clinicians, allowing doctors to record visits with patients in real-time to draft clinical notes. Abridges tool is the latest addition to Athenahealths solution, Ambient Notes, which offers various AI-powered documentation tools for doctors, with companies such as Suki and iScribeHealth already offering their products through the solution.

title: MSG Networks in deal with Altice USA to bring back NY Knicks, Rangers games
label: media
content: MSG Networks has reached a deal with Altice USA to bring back its New York-based NBA and NHL teams on its Optimum service.

title: NBA, Warner Bros. Discovery agree to settle lawsuit over live game rights
label: media
content: Warner Bros. Discovery has agreed to end its quest to buy live NBA games in the US for the 2025-26 season and beyond, ending its legal disputes with the league and keeping the company in the mix with some NBA content.

title: Gold surges above $3,000 as investors seek a haven from Trump tariffs
label: energy
content: Gold prices have crossed $3,000 an ounce for the first time ever as Trumps tariffs roil financial markets, causing investors to flock to safe-haven assets such as gold.

title: Trump signs executive order establishing U.S. strategic bitcoin reserve
label: energy
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday creating a strategic bitcoin reserve, marking a major shift in U.S. digital asset policy.

title: Airline CEOs warn domestic travel demand is slowing
label: transportation
content: Airlines have begun to cut their first-quarter profit and sales estimates as warnings of weaker economic backdrop are weighing on travel demand.

title: Trump tariffs could quickly cut North American auto production
label: transportation
content: Roughly a third of vehicle production in North America could be cut by next week as a result of President Donald Trumps 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, according to S&P Global Mobility.

title: Treasury delays deadline for small businesses to file new form to avoid risk of fines
label: small-business

title: Millions of past-due student borrowers may see credit scores tank: VantageScore
label: personal-finance
content: Delinquencies will start to reappear on credit files for the first time in five years, which could negatively affect the credit scores of 43% of borrowers.

title: Pro-Trump techies enraged by crypto reserve announcement, causing early rift
label: fintech
content: Trumps plan to reward crypto supporters with a strategic reserve appears to have backfired, with critics saying he is using taxpayer money to pump the bags of a select few investors.

title: Americans lost $5.7 billion to investment fraud in 2024. How to protect yourself
label: finance
content: Consumers lost $5.7bn to investment scams in 2024, more than any other type of fraud, according to the Federal Trade Commission. The typical victim lost more than $9,000, with fraudsters using AI to develop fake videos, images and sounds to convince victims to part with their money. organised crime networks in Southeast Asia are using scam operations centres to target victims globally.

title: Hughes Fire containment grows after thousands are forced to flee
label: climate
content: Firefighters made progress on a brush fire north of Los Angeles that exploded to thousands of acres amid high winds on Wednesday. The cause of the fire is under investigation.

title: Coca-Cola says it will use more plastic bottles if aluminum tariffs take effect
label: climate
content: Coca-Cola CEO James Quincey says the company will shift more of its packaging from aluminum to plastic bottles if President Trump implements tariffs on aluminum.

title: Pinterest shares rocket 19% on strong revenue and user growth
label: social-media
content: Pinterest shares surged as much as 19% in Wednesdays trading session amid the company beating Wall Street estimates and robust user growth.

title: Nvidia’s next chips are named after Vera Rubin, scientist who discovered dark matter
label: mobile

title: Reddit shares slump 5% on daily active user miss
label: social-media
content: Shares dropped 5.3% after the company fell short of Wall Streets user growth estimates. But Reddit surpassed estimates for earnings and revenue.

title: Fanatics is opening first trading cards store, but it's not in the U.S.
label: cnbc-disruptors
content: Fanatics, which acquired Topps in 2022, hopes its first European store will inspire other hobby shops to open while encouraging more Europeans to start collecting.

title: Palantir up 11% on Microsoft partnership to sell AI to U.S. defense, intel agencies
label: tech-guide
content: Palantir announced a partnership with Microsoft to provide secure cloud, analytics, and AI capabilities to the U.S. defense and intelligence communities. The news sent Palantirs shares up 11% on Thursday.

title: Amazon announces new $79 Echo Spot alarm clock
label: tech-guide
content: Amazon on Monday announced a redesigned Echo Spot alarm clock with improved audio quality. The device now features a display and a better speaker, and Amazon is selling it at a reduced price for members of its Prime program.

title: Apple to roll out artificial intelligence features in October
label: tech-guide
content: New artificial intelligence features from Apple planned for October release, according to a Bloomberg report on Monday. The release date was pushed back due to stability concerns, with the features needing more testing, the report said.

title: Musk says he's running his businesses 'with great difficulty' as Tesla shares tank
label: white-house

label: policy

label: white-house

title: Jack Daniel's maker says Canada pulling U.S. alcohol off shelves 'worse than tariff'

Several Canadian provinces have taken US liquor off the shelves as part of retaliatory measures against President Donald Trumps tariffs.

title: Europe clambers to form Ukraine plan as U.S. forges ahead with Russia on peace talks
label: defense

title: Mitch McConnell announces he will retire, ending his decadeslong Senate career
label: congress

title: Star Weighs Last-Minute $157 Million Capital Offer From Ballys

content: Star Weighs Last-Minute $157 Million Capital Offer From Ballys

label: Real Estate

label: Telecom

label: Space

label: europe-politics

title: If the U.S. halts military aid to Ukraine, how long can it continue to fight?
label: europe-politics
content: U.S. military aid for Ukraine has been halted following the spectacular falling-out between President Donald Trump and Ukraines leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy, leaving the country in an extremely precarious situation, defense strategists say.

title: Tributes to former Indian PM Manmohan Singh pour in
label: asia-politics
content: Condolences and tributes have poured in following the death of former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, with economists, political leaders and industry titans remembering his role in liberalising the countrys economy and strengthening its international ties.

title: Asia’s year in review: Who had it good — and who had it bad — in 2024
label: asia-politics
content: For bringing a bit of hope and joy to a region and world that could use a lot more good cheer, the designation of Best Year in Asia for 2024 goes to Moo Deng, the pygmy hippo who took the world by storm in 2024. Heres to a hopeful and joy-filled 2025.

title: Intel names new CEO to lead the struggling chipmaker’s turnaround effort
label: sports
content: Intel has named Lip-Bu Tan as its new CEO, after the previous CEO Pat Gelsinger resigned in December. Tan, who has over a decades CEO experience in the tech industry, will commence the role on March 18. The announcement saw Intels share price rise by almost 13% after hours.

title: These 5 actions can help protect your personal and financial data
label: financial-advisors
content: Data security should always be a priority, experts say, urging people to take these five steps, from freezing credit to using passkeys.

title: Tesla's China rival Zeekr to roll out advanced driver assistance-system for free
label: finance
content: Chinese electric vehicle brand Zeekr will offer advanced driver-assistance capabilities to its customers for free in a bid to keep up with competition from Tesla and other EV makers. The technology will enable nearly autonomous driving between pre-set destinations, as long as drivers keep their hands on the steering wheel and there is regulatory approval.

title: Australia Sees A$250 Million Investment Boosting Nature Market
label: Health
content: Australia Sees A$250 Million Investment Boosting Nature Market

title: Nvidia, GM announce new deals for AI, factories and next-gen vehicles
label: transportation
content: The companies will build custom AI systems using Nvidia compute platforms, including Omniverse with Cosmos, to optimise GMs factory planning and robotics, as well as in-vehicle hardware for advanced driver-assistance systems.

title: After Liverpool cruises and Arsenal slips up, is the Premier League title race all but over?
label: Football
content: Liverpool is now 15 points clear at the top of the English Premier League with just nine games left to play. The closest competitor, Arsenal, dropped points in each of its last three matches and is not posing a serious threat to the Reds.

title: Kylian Mbappé scores hat-trick as Real Madrid thrashes Manchester City to reach Champions League Round of 16
label: Football
content: Kylian Mbappé scored his first hat-trick for Real Madrid against Manchester City on Wednesday to send them through to the Champions League round of 16. The win came as Manchester City flounders, this being its earliest exit from the competition since 2012.

title: Chinese government bond yields jump amid renewed economic hopes, rate cut delays
label: china-markets
content: Chinas sovereign bond prices fell and yields rose to their highest levels this year as investors trimmed holdings on bets that additional fiscal spending will boost growth and push back interest rate cuts.

title: U.S. budget deficit surged in February, passing $1 trillion
label: economy
content: The U.S. debt and deficit problems grew larger during President Donald Trumps first month in office, despite efforts to cut government spending and tighten the fiscal belt.

title: Disney and James Gorman hope to foolproof the process to find Iger's successor
label: media
content: Disneys board is counting on new chairman James Gorman to lead the selection of CEO Bob Igers replacement, and hopes hell do so sooner than the early-2026 deadline the company has announced.

title: Pending home sales drop to the lowest level on record in January
label: real-estate
content: Sales of existing homes fell sharply in January, according to a new report, as high mortgage rates and sky-high prices pushed in-person buyers out of the market.

title: U.S. could reach deal with Canada that avoids oil and gas tariffs, energy secretary says
label: energy
content: The US is in active dialogue with Canada and Mexico about avoiding tariffs on imports of oil, gas and other energy resources, according to Energy Secretary Chris Wright. President Donald Trump has paused tariffs on Mexican and Canadian imports until 2 April. It is unclear how much of the energy that the US imports from Canada is compliant with existing trade agreements.

title: Software startup Rippling sues competitor Deel, claiming a spy carried out 'corporate espionage'
label: enterprise
content: Rippling has filed a lawsuit against its competitor, Deel, alleging that the latter company cultivated a spy within Rippling who orchestrated the theft of trade secrets. Rippling stated that the spy, who was hired by Rippling in 2023, accessed sensitive internal information including customer details, and passed this information to Deel executives and a reporter.

title: Alibaba makes AI video generation model free to use globally
label: ai-artificial-intelligence
content: Alibaba has made its video-generation AI models open source, in a boost to the Chinese tech giants AI credentials and a further ramping up of competition with rivals like OpenAI. The four models, which will be available to academics and commercial institutions via Alibaba Clouds Model Scope and Hugging Face, are part of Alibabas Wan2.1 series, its foundational AI model.

title: iPhone 16 Pro Max review: Great battery and cameras, but Apple Intelligence isn't done
label: tech-guide
content: The iPhone 16 is here, but the much-hyped Apple Intelligence features wont be available until later in the year, so this review is tricky to write.

title: Vance expects a 'high-level' TikTok deal by the April 5 deadline
label: white-house
content: President Trump has asked JD Vance to help broker a deal to sell TikToks US business by April, when the app faces a ban under a 2020 law. Several bidders are in the running to acquire the business, including Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian and Wyoming entrepreneur Reid Rasner.

title: Europe wants a say in Ukraine peace plan
label: defense
content: European leaders held an emergency summit to discuss plans for peace in Ukraine as they were left out of U.S.-led talks between Washington and Moscow on the Russia-Ukraine war. Defense stocks jumped. U.S. companies are fielding questions about how U.S. President Donald Trumps policies will affect business. Major U.S. benchmarks ended last week in the green to close near all-time highs.

title: Counter-counter-tariffs? Trump threatens to hit back against EU's retaliation
label: europe-politics
content: The EU said it would impose countertariffs on $28.33 billion worth of U.S. goods. Trump said the White House will be doing reciprocal tariffs so whatever they charge us with, were charging them.

title: U.S. stocks start December chilly; Korea stocks tumble on political chaos
label: asia-politics
content: Stocks opened lower in South Korea as investors digest political turmoil. The Bank of Korea said it would boost short-term liquidity and offer special loans to stabilize markets. Meanwhile, France faces its own political chaos, giving rise to trading opportunities.

title: Trump administration hasn't complied with order to halt foreign aid freeze, judge says
label: world-politics
content: A federal judge ruled the Trump administration hasnt fully complied with his order pausing the freezing of foreign assistance grants and contracts. The judge suggested the administration was trying to justify its large aid pause.

title: How to play alongside crocodiles, snakes and kangaroos: Golf, Aussie-style
label: Golf
content: Australia is teeming with wildlife, and many of its myriad golf courses provide ideal habitats for an array of dangerous species.

title: ‘Sweatergate’ landed this couple at the heart of a social media firestorm. Here’s why they welcomed it
label: Golf
content: A fashion storm at the Masters has put a new brand in the spotlight. Malbon Golf aims to make the sport more appealing to younger fans.

title: Emma Raducanu says she ‘will be okay’ after a man was ejected from her Dubai Tennis Championships match
label: Tennis
content: Emma Raducanu has spoken out about a disturbing incident with a spectator during a tennis match; the WTA says it is working to ensure her wellbeing.

title: Stefano Vukov: Former tennis coach of Elena Rybakina suspended after investigation
label: Tennis
content: The long-time coach of Elena Rybakina, who won the womens singles title at Wimbledon in 2022, has been suspended, the Womens Tennis Association announced on Wednesday.

title: 2026 World Cup final will include halftime show for the first time
label: Football
content: The 2026 World Cup final, hosted in the United States, will include a halftime show for the first time, FIFA president Gianni Infantino has confirmed.

title: ‘Billions’ of golf balls could be lost every year. Where do they end up?
label: Golf
content: A record 45 million people played golf in the US last year, and there were another 31.6 million unregistered and registered golfers across 146 countries in 2023, too.

title: Soccer star Nabil Bentaleb scores in first game since suffering cardiac arrest last year
label: Football
content: Nabil Bentaleb scored an emotional goal for Lille after making his return to football just eight months after suffering a cardiac arrest. The 30-year-old midfielder came on as a substitute against Rennes and scored within four minutes of coming on.

title: Harry Kane sets numerous marks in Champions League win while ‘best in the world’ helps Liverpool survive PSG onslaught

content: English striker Harry Kane scored twice as Bayern Munich beat Bayer Leverkusen 3-0 in the first leg of their Champions League last-16 tie. Kane, who was playing at the Allianz Arena on Wednesday, has now scored 31 goals in all competitions this season. His two goals against Leverkusen mean hes now scored the most goals in all of Europes top five leagues since 2023.

title: Lewis Hamilton feels ‘invigorated’ ahead of new F1 season for Ferrari
label: Motorsport
content: Seven-time F1 champion Lewis Hamilton is excited about his new adventure with Ferrari saying it has invigorated him. The British driver will link up with Charles Leclerc in a bid to return the team to world title-winning ways.

title: The haunting Masters meltdown that changed Rory McIlroy’s career
label: Golf
content: The then 21-year-old was poised to become the youngest winner of The Masters since Tiger Woods in 1997 before a disastrous back nine.

title: Carlos Sainz wins Mexican Grand Prix as penalties for Max Verstappen cut into championship lead
label: Motorsport
content: Carlos Sainz wins the Mexican Grand Prix, taking the checkered flag first to score his second win of the season and the fourth of his Formula One career. McLarens Lando Norris finished second, with Ferraris Charles Leclerc coming in third. The race had a dramatic impact on the Constructors Championship, with Ferrari now second behind McLaren.

title: For nearly 50 years, only Black men caddied The Masters. One day, they all but vanished
label: Golf
content: The caddies at Augusta National were mainly Black men from the Sand Hills neighborhood adjacent to Augusta Country Club. They learned to read greens, how to tell golfers what club to use, and how to read people.

title: ‘Fixated’ spectator ejected from Emma Raducanu’s Dubai Tennis Championships match
label: Tennis
content: The WTA said the man displayed "fixated behavior" toward Raducanu and will be banned from all WTA events until a threat assessment is completed.

title: December: Disabled golf No. 1 Kipp Popert is on a mission to lift trophies in able-bodied tournaments
label: Golf
content: Kipp Popert, the worlds No.1 disabled golfer, promised 12-year-old local talent Andreas Ma in Hong Kong that he will create more opportunities for disabled golfers in the future. Popert hopes to bridge the gap between disabled and able-bodied golf and become a role model for young golfers.

title: Lewis Hamilton dismisses criticism from ‘older, ultimately, White men’ after Ferrari switch
label: Motorsport
content: The seven-time world champion joined the Italian team last year and brushed off criticism from the sports former CEO and a former team chief.

title: This 12th century castle in the ‘green heart’ of Italy is transforming into an exclusive luxury resort
label: Golf
content: Antognolla, a centuries-old castle in Umbria, Italy, is being transformed into a resort that will include a golf course, hotel and wellness center set to open in late 2026. The castle, which sits on a 560-hectare estate, will include a 3,000-square-meter wellness center and 17 bespoke residences. The region is known for its cuisine, nature and historic sites.

title: ‘We created history together’: Lewis Hamilton on writing one of F1’s greatest chapters with Mercedes
label: Motorsport
content: Hamilton has grown to become Formula Ones conscience, standing up against injustice and calling for more to be done to address diversity and inclusion in the sport. Now, both on and off the track, hes reaching for new heights.

title: Early research suggests why exercise is so protective against brain disease
label: Food
content: New research shows that upping your physical activity protects against neuropsychiatric diseases, regardless of how intense the exercise. Experts say the takeaway is to just move more.

title: How to protect your teen from dating violence
label: Food
content: Teen dating violence is common in the US, with about 1 in 3 teenagers experiencing some form of abuse. Coercive control, sexual victimization, and reproductive coercion are all forms of abuse that teens may struggle to recognize. Parents and guardians should be aware of the signs and provide resources and open conversations to help teens navigate relationships.

label: sports
content: In the 1960s the US military built a top-secret base in Greenland to hide nuclear missiles from the Russians — and a physician who worked there has now shared his memories.

title: How to keep your cool in any situation, according to a rapid response nurse
label: Fitness
content: Stress is a common part of daily life, but being prepared ahead of time for those situations can help keep your cool. Heres how to train your mind and body for the next high-stress moment, according to experts.

label: Food
content: The US Food and Drug Administration has banned red dye No. 3, and some experts want the agency to further restrict the use of red dye No. 40 and other food color additives. Heres what you need to know.

title: 5 things this ER doctor would like everyone to stop doing
label: Fitness
content: People are rushed to the hospital emergency room for all sorts of unavoidable injuries, whether they got hit by a car or injured while playing sports.

title: Self-hatred isn’t the same as depression. A psychiatrist explains how to treat it in teens
label: Food
content: CNN spoke with psychiatrist Dr. Blaise Aguirre about his new book, "I Hate Myself: Overcome Self-Loathing and Realize Why Youre Wrong About You," and what contributes to self-hatred, especially in young people, and how it can be treated.

title: Civil rights icon Rosa Parks was a Yogi: ‘She was often taking care of herself’
label: Fitness
content: A photo of Rosa Parks taken in 1973 shows the civil rights activist in a yoga pose, a reflection of the strength and fearlessness that Parks displayed throughout her life, experts say.

title: If you’re constantly tired, these health conditions could be the reasons why, experts say
label: Sleep

title: Forget crunches: The smarter way to strengthen your core
label: Fitness
content: Your core is an important part of your bodys physical function. Heres why core health is important and how to train your core effectively.

content: Sedentary jobs that make up 80% of the US workforce are linked to higher rates of insomnia, according to a new study in the Journal of Occupational Health Psychology. Insomnia is then linked to a greater risk of various health issues, from cardiovascular disease to depression.

title: 3 health conditions increase risk of liver damage if you drink, study says
label: Food

label: Fitness
content: A Yale lecturer on public health stopped showering for five years to test whether personal care products were necessary for health — and to explore the "large health halo" around them.

title: Gap shares spike 17% as retailer blows away expectation again
label: retail
content: The company, which owns the Gap, Old Navy, Banana Republic and Athleta brands, reported better-than-expected earnings and sales on Thursday.

title: Costco checks plenty of key boxes for investors despite missing on earnings
label: retail
content: The retailer beat Wall Street forecasts for the quarter and raised its outlook for the year on the back of rising sales and membership fees.

title: Kering beats quarterly forecasts even as sales at embattled Gucci brand plunge
label: wealth
content: The French luxury goods firm reported a 12% decline in Q4 revenues to 4.39bn euros ($4.52bn), slightly ahead of the 4.29bn euros forecast by LSEG analysts. Sales at Gucci, which account for almost half of the groups total revenues, plunged 24% annually.

title: IRS unveils plan to close ‘major tax loophole’ used by large partnerships
label: small-business
content: The U.S. Department of the Treasury and the IRS want to close a tax loophole that benefits large partnerships, which could raise more than $50 billion in tax revenue.

title: Small business owners turn more bullish amid Fed interest rate cuts: CNBC survey
label: small-business
content: Small business confidence improved as the Fed cut rates and inflation appears to be moderating, but inflation still remains the top worry for owners, a new survey finds.

title: Trump sued by 20 states to halt the 'dismantling' of Education Department
label: personal-finance
content: A group of Democratic state attorneys general filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration over its plans to dismantle the U.S. Department of Education and termination of nearly half its staff.

title: Resistance training is the right way to tire your brain and body for better sleep, according to a study
label: Sleep
content: Insomnia can be a big problem as you get older. A new study finds that exercise, especially resistance training, can help improve sleep for older adults. Some doctors also recommend light stretching before bed to relax the body.

title: What I found when I tried to unplug from social media
label: Fitness
content: Many social media users are trying to unplug from Big Tech, spurred by Metas alliance with President Trump and the companys change in fact-checking policy, and are seeking alternatives like Bluesky or simply not using social media at all. The movement has exposed the myriad ways people rely on social media for information, communication and connection, and raises questions about the extent to which people are willing to unplug.

title: Gold prices hit $3,000 for the first time as investors push the panic button
label: sports
content: Gold hit a record $3,005 an ounce on concerns over Trumps tariffs and the Ukraine war, as well as a weakening dollar, with experts saying it reflects global uncertainty.

title: The US is in a steep decline of food enjoyment — which has impacts on health, data shows
label: Food
content: A new Gallup survey finds that while most people still say they enjoy their food, fewer people are eating in a way they consider healthy. Heres how to find satisfaction in your meals, according to a dietitian.

title: In need of a dopamine hit? 5 things to know about creating a dopamine menu
label: Mindfulness
content: Heres how to create a "dopamenu" of activities to give you a boost when you need it, according to a clinical social worker and ADHD coach.

title: Does my child have an anxiety disorder? Here are the signs parents should look out for

content: Fears are a normal part of human development and can serve as survival mechanisms, but can become debilitating and impair daily function, experts say. Heres how to know when its time to seek professional support.

title: Why your phone doesn’t make for the best alarm clock
label: Sleep
content: If you want to get up earlier, or get better sleep, a small and helpful step may be trading your phone for an alarm clock.

title: Those NFL snack ads are fun, but you should be careful of the foods they sell, study shows
label: Food
content: Foods advertised during NFL games contain high levels of sodium, fat and calories, researchers say. Eating too much salt can lead to worsening of heart failure, hypertension and stroke. Try making simple switches to lower-sodium foods and eating in moderation, experts say.

title: How much coffee is too much, according to a doctor
label: Food
content: Recent large studies have found multiple benefits from moderate caffeine consumption, including lowering the risk of heart disease, diabetes, certain cancers and even dementia. But how much coffee is good for you, and how much is too much? CNN wellness expert Dr. Leana Wen answers these questions and more.

title: Married for 50 years, these psychologists who study love share what they’ve learned to do — and not to do — to stay happy
label: Relationships
content: The psychologists who coauthored "The 36 Questions That Lead to Love" have been married for 50 years. Heres their secret to a long-lasting relationship.

title: The secret to great sex isn’t really a secret. It’s asking the right question, 81-year-old sex professor says
label: Relationships
content: For world-renowned human sexuality professor Dr. William Yarber, having great sex comes down to asking and sharing with your romantic partner a mix of two magical words.

title: Anxiety can be debilitating. Controlling it starts with this simple step, Martha Beck says
label: Mindfulness
content: Martha Beck says curiosity and creativity can act as antidotes to anxiety. The sociologist and best-selling author explores how these practices can help liberate the creative genius inside us all.

title: Narcissists are significantly more likely to feel excluded, new study finds
label: Relationships
content: Grandiose narcissists are not only more likely to feel ostracized but are also genuinely excluded more often than those with less egocentric personalities, a study has found.

title: Experts tell parents how to help their kids through their anxiety
label: Relationships
content: A lot of our kids are still struggling with their mental health and parents are concerned. Heres how they can help their kids navigate through a world that seems to get more chaotic every day.

label: Relationships
content: Dana Reeve expressed grief in caring for her husband, Christopher Reeve, in a way that many caregivers often feel but hesitate to express. Experts say failing to express it can have negative consequences for caregivers.

title: Online estate planning firm Trust & Will raises $25 million in funding round

The company offers online estate planning services and has partnerships with financial institutions including Bank of America and USAA. It aims to make wealth preservation and wealth transfer services more accessible.

title: Greenland PM blasts Trump talk of U.S. annexation: 'Enough is enough'
label: white-house
content: Greenlands outgoing prime minister has criticised President Donald Trumps comments about the potential annexation of the island, calling the remarks disrespectful.

title: Trump administration, DOGE hit roadblocks in three court cases
label: congress
content: A trio of federal judges dealt the Trump administration setbacks in separate court cases involving federal spending, refugees and foreign aid.

title: Trump FBI pick Kash Patel accused of directing staff purge while still a nominee
label: congress
content: President Trumps nominee to lead the FBI, Kash Patel, faces accusations that he has been directing an ongoing purge of the agency. Sen. Dick Durbin called for an investigation, writing that Patel may have committed perjury in denying any knowledge of plans to punish FBI agents involved in Trump investigations.

title: 'We felt at home': Israeli weapons firms out in force at Abu Dhabi defense expo
label: defense
content: IDEX 2023, the Middle Easts largest defense expo hosted in Abu Dhabi, saw a record 34 Israeli companies exhibiting. The warm reception for Israeli arms manufacturers contrasts with the last major aerospace exhibition in the UAE, which took place one month after Israels bombing of Gaza began.

title: Trump threatens to put 200% tariff on French Champagne and other EU spirits

content: President Trump said he plans to put a 200% tariff on alcohol from France and other European nations in retaliation to their tax on American whiskey.

title: Starmer says Europe faces a 'once in a generation moment' as leaders discuss ending war in Ukraine
label: europe-politics
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer is hosting a meeting of leaders to shore up support for Ukraine and Europes defenses. He says the meeting will involve a coalition of the willing and an agreement for peace will be taken to the U.S.

content: Romanias central election authority has barred far-right pro-Russian candidate Calin Georgescu from running in the presidential election re-run in May, which is likely to deepen the constitutional crisis in the EU and NATO member nation.

title: China to impose retaliatory tariffs on some Canadian products
