content: China has announced retaliatory tariffs on some Canadian agricultural goods, including a 100% tariff on rapeseed oil, oil cakes and peas, in response to Canadas recent imposition of import duties on Chinese-made EVs and steel/aluminum products.

title: Ukraine captured two injured North Korean soldiers, Zelenskyy says
label: asia-politics
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced that Ukraine has captured two injured North Korean soldiers, marking the first time Ukraine has said it has detained North Korean troops. The soldiers were transferred to Kyiv, where they are now communicating with the Security Service of Ukraine, Zelenskyy said.

title: Singapore says U.S. firms should comply with export controls after DeepSeek questions
label: asia-politics
content: Singapores Ministry of Trade and Industry has said that it expects US companies to comply with local export controls, following concerns that Chinas DeepSeek obtained semiconductors from Nvidia via the city-state.

title: Here’s what a blockbuster Nissan-Honda merger could mean for the auto industry
label: asia-politics
content: Nissan and Honda are reportedly set to enter merger negotiations, with the possible addition of Nissan subsidiary Mitsubishi Motors; the deal could create the worlds third-largest auto group, behind only VW and Toyota. While neither company would confirm the reports, shares in Nissan soared almost 24% on the back of the news. Any tie-up would face several obstacles, including political scrutiny in Japan and the need to unwind Nissans existing alliance with Renault.

title: Trump says he spoke to Putin about ending the war in Ukraine
label: world-politics
content: The presidents of the U.S. and Russia spoke by phone Wednesday about ending the war in Ukraine and negotiating a settlement despite an ongoing invasion, with Trump saying Putin is willing to negotiate with Zelenskyy.

title: Can a consumption boost save India's slowing economy?
label: world-politics
content: Indias first budget under the current government was highly anticipated as the country contends with a slowing economy, depreciating rupee and global macroeconomic headwinds.

title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Ulta, Nvidia, Chipotle, Peloton and more
label: finance
content: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Ulta, Nvidia, Chipotle, Peloton and more

title: Trump's war on Biden's climate policy is creating a new form of EV range anxiety
label: energy
content: EV adoption continues to rise in the U.S., but the industry is now under threat from the Trump administration, which is seeking to slash EV incentives and is reviewing federal funding for EV charging infrastructure.

title: March Madness is here: How to watch Selection Sunday, start times and more
label: sports
content: The best time in college basketball is here: March Madness. Heres everything you need to know about the 2025 NCAA tournament fields — full brackets, dates, TV schedule and more.

title: This startup is creating a global tech platform for recycled wood
label: climate
content: A start-up that links tree surgeons, haulage firms and sawmills to recycle felled trees is aiming to go global after doubling its sales last year.

title: Trump economic aide: There will 'absolutely' be tariff uncertainty until April 2
label: white-house
content: The US administrations evolving tariff agenda is creating economic uncertainty, according to President Trumps top economic adviser. Kevin Hassett said there would be uncertainty until 2 April, when Trump is due to unveil reciprocal tariff plans.

title: 2024 CNBC Disruptor 50 full list: OpenAI is the first back-to-back No. 1 company
label: cnbc-disruptors
content: Artificial intelligence (AI) is essential to two-thirds of the 50 companies on CNBCs annual Disruptor 50 list, with 13 describing themselves as generative AI companies, and five of the top 10 hailing from the sector. The list of companies on the list, which have raised a combined total of $70bn at an implied valuation of $436bn, includes those working in cybersecurity and agriculture, as well as those in generative AI.

title: Trump rejects CEO pleas for more clarity on tariffs: 'They always say that'
label: white-house
content: President Donald Trump dismissed the growing chorus of CEOs, investors and policymakers who are pleading with the White House for greater clarity about his sweeping tariff agenda. They have plenty of clarity, Trump said.

title: Zelenskyy absent as U.S. and Ukrainian officials meet for first time since spat
label: europe-politics
content: U.S. and Ukrainian officials are meeting in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday for the first time since a contentious Oval Office meeting between President Trump and Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy in February.

title: Chinese battery giant CATL posts annual revenue drop ahead of Hong Kong listing
label: china-markets
content: The worlds largest battery maker saw its revenue drop for the first time amid an EV battery price war in China and an overseas expansion.

title: Malaysia says it will take action if its firms involved in Nvidia fraud case
label: china-markets
content: The Malaysian minister for investment, trade and industry said the country will take necessary action if Malaysian companies are found to be involved in a fraud case linked to the alleged movement of Nvidia chips from Singapore to China.

title: China is trying to attract foreign investment amid geopolitical tensions
label: china-markets
content: Authorities in China have published a 2025 action plan for stabilizing foreign investment in an attempt to encourage foreign businesses to invest in the country. The plan includes proposals to open up the education, culture, healthcare and telecommunications sectors to foreign investment, as well as offering clearer standards for government procurement. The move follows several years of declining foreign direct investment in China.

title: Xiaomi launches $1,600 Samsung phone challenger as it rides 300% stock rally to record high
label: china-markets
content: Xiaomi has launched two new smartphones as it looks to challenge Samsungs market lead. The Xiaomi 15 and Xiaomi 15 Ultra were unveiled at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona. The company is also pushing its premium brand in Europe as it looks to diversify from affordable devices.

title: DeepSeek has stoked a rotation out of India stocks into Chinese equities — but experts advise caution
label: china-markets
content: A rotation is occurring from India to China as the latters stock market has surged since DeepSeeks artificial intelligence breakthrough, while the formers has languished in correction territory. Chinas economy is doing well, while Indias is struggling with a 5.4% GDP growth rate. Experts warn it is still too early to tell if the recovery in China will be sustained.

title: Beijing embraces DeepSeek to lead AI adoption as it looks for new growth drivers
label: china-markets
content: Chinas DeepSeek has developed an AI model that some are claiming can match or outperform global competitors, while running on cheaper and less sophisticated chips. The enthusiasm around DeepSeek is reflected in the rally of China stocks, with the MSCI China index soaring over 21% from its January low. The company has shaken Chinas AI ecosystem, with state-owned entities and tech players, including competitors, leveraging its open-sourced architecture.

title: Dollar firms on Ukraine tensions, kiwi slumps as Reserve Bank of New Zealand slashes rates
label: world-markets
content: The U.S. dollar held firm on Wednesday as investors weighed up the latest note in U.S. President Donald Trumps tariff crescendo and uncertainty after initial Russia-Ukraine peace talks finished without Kyiv or Europe at the table.

title: Asia markets mixed despite tariff uncertainty and recession fears in the U.S.
label: world-markets
content: Asia-Pacific markets were mixed on Wednesday as investors reacted to news that U.S. President Donald Trump will not raise tariffs on Canadian imports.

title: Oil holds near 1-week high on supply concerns, sanctions on Russia eyed
label: world-markets
content: Oil prices held near a one-week high as worries about supply disruptions in Russia and the U.S. outweighed expectations of a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Why Trump wants to bring aluminum production back to the U.S.
label: economy
content: Aluminum is a critical material for many industries, and the US is currently heavily reliant on imports. The Biden and Trump administrations have used tariffs as a policy tool to encourage domestic production, but critics say this policy could negatively affect consumers.

title: ECB policymaker Centeno 'very concerned' about Europe's struggling economy
label: economy
content: Mário Centeno, senior European Central Bank policymaker and governor of the Bank of Portugal, has said he is very concerned about the European economy and warns of the impact of a potential tariff war. Centeno also indicated further ECB rate cuts could be on the cards.

title: Tesla lost $15 billion in brand value in 2024 with aging lineup, Musk at helm: report
label: climate
content: Teslas brand value has fallen 26% in 2024, a second straight annual decline, according to research and consulting firm Brand Finance, which cited an aging vehicle lineup and CEO Elon Musks antagonism.

title: World's largest luxury group LVMH posts better than feared full-year sales
label: wealth
content: LVMH reported organic growth of 1% versus the previous year, beating expectations, driven by a strong performance in its selective retailing unit.

title: Burberry shares jump 13% after better-than-expected quarterly sales
label: wealth
content: Shares of Burberry jumped as much as 16% on Friday after the company reported a shallower-than-expected dip in sales in the fiscal third quarter, providing a first glimpse of CEO Joshua Schulmans efforts to revamp the beleaguered British fashion house.

title: How a small business community in California looks to rebuild after wildfires
label: small-business
content: Small business owners in the Los Angeles area of Altadena who have lost everything are beginning the long process of rebuilding after wildfires swept through the area in January, but many are facing financial struggles as they look to the future.

title: Advice for aspiring entrepreneurs: 'Embrace what makes you different'
label: small-business
content: Junior Achievement Free Enterprise Center helps high school students plan their careers. Gen Zers prefer being entrepreneurs over a day job, a recent survey found. Here are 5 pieces of advice for young entrepreneurs from business leaders in Denver.

title: Inflation fears among small business owners are running hotter again
label: small-business
content: Small business owners are increasingly pessimistic about inflation, with most saying it is the No. 1 issue that will determine their vote in the presidential election, a recent survey found.

title: California pauses home energy rebate program amid Trump funding freeze
label: personal-finance
content: California has paused energy rebate programs worth $582m due to a Trump-era freeze on federal funding for green initiatives. The programs, created under the Biden-era Inflation Reduction Act, offer consumers money to install insulation, heat pumps and efficient appliances. Other states, such as Maine and North Carolina, have yet to pause similar initiatives.

title: Block shares fall on profit, revenue miss
label: fintech
content: Shares of the newly named Block declined as the company posted Q4 results that fell short of Wall Street expectations. The company faces increased competition from Toast and Fiservs Clover unit.

title: Higher-income American consumers are showing signs of stress
label: financial-advisors
content: Even high earners with incomes of $150,000 or more are feeling the pinch from inflation, rising delinquency rates on credit cards, auto loans and mortgages.

title: Three months into 2025, US measles cases surpass total for 2024
label: sports
content: As of Friday, Texas has reported 259 cases this year, New Mexico has tallied 35 cases and Oklahoma has reported two, health officials say.

title: Wide-awake at night but tired in the morning? Here’s what could help, according to experts
label: sports
content: You drag yourself out of bed in the morning and immediately make a promise that you’re going to go to bed earlier that night. Once bedtime rolls around, you find you couldnt be more wide awake. Heres what to do.

title: Tracking measles cases in the United States
label: sports
content: Recent outbreaks of measles in the United States are driving up case counts and raising alarm among public health experts, especially as vaccination rates among children lag.

title: These are the biggest concerns facing teen boys and girls
label: sports
content: A new survey shows both teen boys and girls face similar issues, but they may need different kinds of support.

title: The potential dangers of sleep trackers, according to experts
label: sports
content: Sleep trackers can provide valuable information, but some people become obsessed with getting a perfect nights sleep, which can cause sleep anxiety and insomnia, experts say.

title: Stop stretching your shoulders! Here’s what actually works for stiff muscles
label: Fitness
content: Stretching can provide temporary relief but doesnt address the real cause of shoulder stiffness, which is often muscle imbalance and poor joint stability. Heres what you can do instead.

title: H5N1 bird flu virus is infectious in raw milk cheese for months, posing risk to public health, study shows
label: sports
content: Raw milk cheese made with milk from infected cattle can harbour bird flu for months, according to a study from Cornell University, adding a new potential vector for transmission to humans and other animals.

title: Forget ‘sparking joy.’ Try this for easier decluttering
label: sports
content: Holding on to things that have sentimental value or could be useful in the future is a natural part of growing older, but for some people, this tendency grows over time, to the point that they eventually meet the criteria for hoarding disorder.

title: What your kids drink matters, this doctor says
label: sports
content: What you serve your kids to drink is as important as what you serve them to eat. Four national health and nutrition organizations recommend you consider their beverage intake.

title: White House withdraws nomination of Dr. Dave Weldon to lead CDC
label: sports
content: The Trump administration withdrew its nomination of Dr. Dave Weldon to lead the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The decision was made less than an hour before Weldons confirmation hearing was set to begin.

title: After canceling meeting of independent advisers, FDA issues 2025-26 flu vaccine recommendations
label: sports
content: The FDAs Vaccines and Related Biological Products Advisory Committee was scheduled to meet Thursday to decide the composition of the flu shots for the upcoming season but it was abruptly canceled.

title: Voice of America channels fall silent as Trump administration guts agency and cancels contracts
label: sports
content: The Trump administration has silenced a key tool for promoting American values and countering foreign propaganda, leaving allies and partners in the lurch.

title: America’s automakers aren’t rushing to move production to US factories to avoid tariffs
label: sports
content: President Donald Trump has said that automakers can avoid his tariffs by moving production to American plants. But it’s not that easy. Not by a long shot.

title: Mysterious radio pulses from the Milky Way ‘are unlike anything we knew before’
label: sports
content: Astronomers have discovered the origin of long-period radio transients; they are pairs of dead stars orbiting each other closely. The discovery could help scientists better understand what types of stars are capable of producing and sending radio pulses across the cosmos.

title: Your boozy nightcap is disrupting your sleep. Try these tips instead
label: sports
content: The history of the nightcap dates to the early 18th century, but the impact of alcohol on sleep is less sanguine. Heres why its time to rethink your evening drink.

title: The 6 annoying types of air travelers — and how to rethink interactions with them
label: life
content: Plane etiquette seems simple, but campaigns and crackdowns suggest disruptive behavior on flights persists. A new book offers lessons on how to deal with difficult flyers — and how to apply those lessons to your career.

title: Half of all workers will struggle to get weight-loss drug insurance coverage
label: small-business
content: Small businesses are increasingly unable to offer expensive weight-loss drugs such as Wegovy and Zepbound to employees, as costs are prohibitive and employees are increasingly turning to their employers to foot the bill. However, other options for small business employees to gain coverage include captive health plans and flexible spending accounts, despite the fact that insurance premiums may rise.

title: Health officials prepare for measles spread as disinformation threatens already low vaccination rates
label: sports
content: A Texas school celebrated being named the number one school in Texas for the least amount of vaccinations, but public health officials in the state, as well as in New Mexico and Oklahoma, are working to raise vaccination rates and protect vulnerable communities amid a measles outbreak.

title: Disrupted US vaccine meetings could threaten timelines, access and transparency around shots
label: sports
content: Two long-planned meetings — one at the CDC and another at the FDA — have now been disrupted under the watch of US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., stirring questions about whether seasonal flu shots or other lifesaving vaccines will be delayed or harder to access.

title: Is Guinness really ‘good for you’?
label: sports
content: Guinness may have some health benefits, but dont plan on ordering a pint of Guinness just yet.

title: Some La Roche-Posay, Proactiv and Walgreens acne treatments recalled due to benzene levels
label: sports
content: U.S. health officials are asking retailers to pull a handful of acne creams off store shelves after finding they contained elevated levels of benzene, a chemical associated with cancer.

title: SpaceX’s Crew-10 arrives at the ISS, paving the way for NASA’s Wilmore and Williams to return home
label: sports
content: The four astronauts arrived at the space station Sunday, allowing NASAs Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore to return home. The Crew-9 mission was delayed a few days because of launch issues.

title: RFK Jr. wants to eliminate FDA’s controversial food additive program. Here’s why that matters
label: sports
content: US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy has begun the process of eliminating a US Food and Drug Administration program called GRAS, or “generally recognized as safe, that critics say has been abused by the food industry for decades.

title: Why what you wear can affect how you feel
label: Fitness
content: When youre feeling down, one simple thing you can do is put on your sneakers (or other "get moving" clothes). Heres why it may help.

title: Daylight Saving Time is controversial. Here’s why the US kept it
label: sports
content: Clocks will "spring forward" on the second Sunday in March for Daylight Saving Time. Heres how it started and why it has lasted so long in the US.

title: Not ready to ‘spring forward’? This sleep doctor says there’s still time to prepare
label: sports
content: "There are two secrets that people whisper to each other to remind each other what to do," says one expert, who offers advice on how to deal with the time change.

title: Exercise may help patients with colon cancer live as long as those who never had it, study suggests
label: Fitness
content: Exercise is "associated with longer lives" for those diagnosed with colon cancer, according to a study published in Cancer, a journal of the American Cancer Society. Patients who exercised regularly both during and after chemotherapy also saw a reduced risk of the cancer returning.

title: Here’s how I learned to enjoy running after only a month of practice
label: Fitness
content: I always hated running, until I started hacking it by setting easy goals, going at my own pace and making myself comfortable. Heres how you can learn to love running, too.

title: Top soccer clubs are using an AI-powered app to scout future stars
label: sports
content: A London-based technology company wants to "democratize" talent-identification and scouting in soccer, using its aiScout app. The app uses AI to allow players to enter virtual trials for professional clubs, and is now looking to expand.

title: Can you lose your job for what you post on social media? Here’s what the experts say
label: sports
content: While there are some safeguards in place that allow employees to speak about their employers, the situation is tricky as evidenced by the recent firing of a Tesla manager who posted critical comments about CEO Elon Musk on LinkedIn.

title: Kennedy downplays immunity from vaccination as measles outbreak grows
label: sports
content: Cases in the ongoing measles outbreak have risen to 258 across Texas, New Mexico and Oklahoma, and state health departments are urging more people to get the measles-mumps-rubella vaccine.

title: Don’t overdo it, but light exercise can help with minor illness
label: sports
content: Light exercise is recommended for mild illnesses, but you should always pay attention to your body and avoid heavy exercise. Consult a doctor for the best advice on exercising while sick and take precautions when exercising outdoors.

title: Don’t drink water only when you’re thirsty and other expert-backed hydration tips
label: Fitness
content: Muslims refrain from consuming any food or liquid from dawn until sundown during the holy month of Ramadan and break their fasts in the evening. Heres how to make sure youre getting the nutrition and hydration you need.

title: What’s ‘sleepmaxxing’? Experts weigh in on the social media trend
label: sports
content: Sleepmaxxing – a collection of activities, products or "hacks" used simultaneously to optimize sleep quality and quantity – is becoming more popular. Heres what experts say you should be wary of – and what actually works.

title: Bacterial slime on microplastics helps breed antibiotic-resistant superbugs, study says
label: sports
content: The proliferation of antibiotic-resistant superbugs may be aided by microplastics being an excellent host for slimy biofilms created by bacteria, says a new study. The protective three-dimensional structures allow bacteria to thrive and replicate, increasing antibiotic resistance by hundreds of times.

title: Study finds another possible cause of fatigue felt by many menopausal women
label: sports
content: Having experienced three or more episodes of heavy or prolonged menstrual bleeding within a six-month period is associated with symptoms of fatigue, according to a new study. No large studies have evaluated whether heavy and prolonged menstrual bleeding is associated with fatigue, and no menopause questionnaires assess this association.

title: Tea brewing benefits: It may help filter out heavy metals, study finds
label: Fitness
content: Researchers found that brewing tea may help to purify water by adsorbing heavy metals such as lead and cadmium. The type of tea, length of steeping time, and type of bag all played a role in how effective the purification was. Experts say carbon filters are still the best method for cleaning drinking water.

title: Exercising: How often do you need to clean your yoga mat?
label: Fitness
content: Nearly 75% of swab samples taken from fitness equipment such as dumbbells, treadmills and exercise mats tested positive for harmful bacteria, a 2018 study found.

title: Physical decline is common as we age. These exercises can help mitigate the effects
label: Fitness
content: Age-related physical changes can impact your mobility, cause chronic pain and increase the risk of fractures. Heres why mobility is important and exercises to improve it as you age.

title: Is it time for divorce? Therapists and attorneys weigh in
label: Fitness
content: Holiday, birthday and other major milestone times can cause people to evaluate their relationships. Heres how to know if its time to break up — and how to do it with kindness.

title: Adults may want to consider revisiting their childhood hobbies, according to a psychologist
label: Fitness
content: CNN Life has a weekly roundup on living well, made simple. Sign up for our Life, But Better newsletter for information and tools designed to improve your well-being. Heres why its beneficial to return to a childhood hobby, and how to get started.

title: Op-ed: 5 steps to help you financially recover after a wildfire
label: climate
content: Winnie Sun says enduring a wildfire can be emotionally and financially overwhelming, but there are steps you can take to regain control.

title: China’s factory activity growth hits 3-month high in February, as millions return to work after holidays
label: china-markets
content: Chinas factory activity expanded at its fastest pace in three months in February, a private-sector survey showed on Monday, as millions of migrant workers returned to work after an extended Lunar New Year holiday.

title: The record-breaking run of 'Ne Zha 2' may seem like a surprise. It shouldn't
label: china-markets
content: Chinese animators are racing to keep up with booming demand for locally made films, as the success of Ne Zha 2 makes local blockbusters increasingly attractive to domestic audiences. Producers are looking to capitalize on the countrys growing middle class and a government push to develop the domestic film industry.

title: 'Tariff war, a trade war or any other type of war' — China says it's ready to fight U.S. until the end
label: china-markets
content: China said its ready to fight any type of war with the U.S., days after President Donald Trump increased tariffs on Chinese goods. In a statement, the Chinese Embassy in Washington pointed to an ascendant China with a different ideology, and warned that if the U.S. wants to harm Chinas interests, Beijing is ready to fight till the end.

title: This ETF provider thinks it's time to rethink investing in China
label: china-markets
content: Life + Liberty Indexes founder, Perth Tolle, warns Chinas capitalism will not lead to democracy and that its model is unsustainable. Tolle, who runs the Freedom 100 Emerging Markets ETF, which has never invested in China, prefers emerging economies that prioritise personal and economic freedom.

title: Asia stocks fall despite soft U.S. inflation report
label: world-markets
content: Asia-Pacific markets mostly fell on Thursday as investors reacted to a soft inflation report in the U.S. overnight that helped two of three benchmarks on Wall Street reverse course from two days of losses.

title: Dollar wobbles, Aussie just below 2-month high ahead of Reserve Bank of Australia decision
label: world-markets
content: The dollar was near two-month lows on Tuesday as traders weighed tariff worries and the path to U.S. rate cuts. Meanwhile, the yen held near its highest level in nearly two months as Japans strong growth data bolstered odds the Bank of Japan will raise interest rates again this year.

title: Why this week's positive inflation reports won't look as good to the Fed
label: economy
content: While US inflation data for February showed prices easing, the figures arent expected to convince the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates any time soon.

title: Job openings see gains in January in a sign of labor market stability
label: economy
content: Job openings increased in January, but the report likely wont stay stable as federal government layoffs rise and employee confidence falls.

title: U.S. payroll growth totals 151,000 in February, less than expected
label: economy
content: Job growth was weaker than expected in February, despite the ongoing efforts of Elon Musk and President Donald Trump.

title: Treasury secretary says the American dream is not about 'access to cheap goods'
label: economy
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Thursday offered a full-throated defense of the White Houses position on tariffs, insisting trade policy has to be about more than just getting low-priced items from other countries.

title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says economy could be 'starting to roll a little bit'
label: economy
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent acknowledged Friday that the U.S. economy is showing signs of weakness, saying its in a detox period as it moves away from government spending to private sector.

title: Sen. Blumenthal asks Visa for records of its payments deal with Elon Musk’s X
label: finance
content: Sen. Richard Blumenthal, the ranking member of the Senates Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, pointed to Elon Musks role in hobbling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau as among the reasons for the information request.
